Reviews.Title: “It's Boston”
Reviews.Author: dia480
Reviews.Content: Amazing the price you pay for this place, I got hit for over 300.00 for a walk in. this is at the airport not like you can walk out and visit the city or anything. But like my title states "It's Boston" bend over

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton in Boston”
Reviews.Author: klrchef
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Logan this past week for a trade show at the Boston Convention Center. We love this hotel and think it is the nicest Hilton in Boston. It has a very modern clean feeling to it and the staff was very welcoming to us. We were upgraded to the Executive Floor due to our Hhonors Gold Status and had a great city view room. The room was clean and spacious with a nice flat screen TV and the Hilton bed we love so much. We did not eat at the restaurant but got a room service pizza which was good for hotel pizza. The only reason that this hotel does not receive an excellent rating is that the location is not the best being at the Airport. It was around $25 to get a cab to Boston so not cheap but since this is our favorite Boston Hilton we figure it was worth it. The rates are often cheaper than other Hiltons in Boston as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and value”
Reviews.Author: YstayIN1place
Reviews.Content: Every time I'm in Boston I stay at this hotel. Staffs are very friendly. Minutes away from downtown. Shuttles run every 15 mins to subway, airport and rentals cars. The gym is excellent and up to date. Rooms are average and clean. Noise and vibration from planes taking off can be annoying but tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SusanM202
Reviews.Content: Not great but good. All you need to be comfy, especially if you have to catch a 5:00 a.m. flight out of Boston Logan. Clean, modern, will stay there again. Let's face it, who loves airport hotels, but we sure need them!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly convenient”
Reviews.Author: Janetbme
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is right at Logan Airport and, depending on the terminal you're using, you might not even need the shuttle. I stayed there with four friends before an early morning flight to Haiti; we didn't need the shuttle, and check-in was very quick. My only complaint was that one of the two (non-smoking) rooms reeked of tobacco smoke . . . I imagine they would have given us different rooms, but it was late and we had a ton of luggage. We were more interested in eating supper and getting a few hours sleep before our flight. I've stayed here before, and will certainly stay again if the need arises. It's a little pricey, but you can't beat the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel ta the airport”
Reviews.Author: Urs68
Reviews.Content: Good Hilton Hotel directly at the airport. Airport shuttles are available. If you are at Airport Terminal A or E you could even walk to the hotel over the connection walk from Terminal A to E. Also the city of Boston is not far away. The rooms were big and clean, the bed is comfortable. Nothing special and as most airport hotels it is unpersonal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: GumbyNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed there at the Hilton Logan airport as we were leaving for Punta Cana early in morning, It was a beautiful hotel. very large rooms and best part is you can leave your car there for a price but well worth it. and the hotel is connected to the airport which is very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Big hotel, Shuttle is quick, food options are lacking”
Reviews.Author: spgISLANDtraveler
Reviews.Content: Pursuant to the other reviews, it is a big giant and "as expected" Hilton. Nothing bad- nothing special. Location is very convenient for work travel, but should be the only reason you stay here - airport access. Bar is good area to meet other peers from work, but other than that nothing spectacular. Tired cliche "Boston" food such as chowder and the nothing on the menu really stands out. Food is so-so. Would stay again for airport access.

Reviews.Title: “A dreadful experience”
Reviews.Author: RichardPurley
Reviews.Content: On the executive floor so it must have been poor elsewhere. Room OK, bed comfortable, bathroom very tired, lobby great, restaurant shocking. Corridor strewn with used room service trays. Arrived tired wanting a meal, only one place to eat in the hotel we were told, the bar / pub. No tables available only "bar stool booths". Very limited, carzily expensive menu produced poorly cooked, poorly presented and poory served food. Shameful. A dreadful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good place if you've got an early flight.”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: Drove up from the Cape and dropped the rental car. The shuttle bus dropped me at the front door. Nice room. Got room service for dinner...it was good. Hotel bus to terminal in the morning. I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: T_R_Grant
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight after my flight was cancelled. The staff were helpful, and overall the hotel was very nice. My room was extremely comfortable and surprisingly quiet considering the number of planes taking off and landing. The food was good but nothing exceptional. There is a skywalk that connects the hotel to the airport, making it a very convenient airport hotel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you need to catch a flight in the AM...”
Reviews.Author: JoeHouston52
Reviews.Content: We overnighted before catching a 6:30 AM flight the next day. We checked in, dropped off our rental car, had them drop us off at airport for a great meal in Terminal C at Legal Seafood, and the walked back (10 minutes) to our hotel (all indoors). Rooms were standard Hilton. The convenience factor is huge.

Reviews.Title: “VERY convenient hotel, great service, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: gscooper
Reviews.Content: I had a quick overnight stay here after a late flight, and it was probably the nicest "airport" hotel I have stayed in. Very convenient to walk (via skybridge/walkway) right from the airport, and they also offer a free shuttle service. The shuttle also took me directly to the rental car location in the AM. I paid a bit extra for a room on the "Executive Floor," which provided access to a very nice executive lounge, as well as an included expanded continental breakfast. Great coffee bar and pub right in the hotel, as well. My king room was quite spacious -- bathroom was nothing special, but perfectly nice. Usually they charge for Internet, I believe, but I was offered a free 24-hour access code -- not sure how standard this is, however. *Excellent* and courteous service overall, and quite speedy check-in and check-out. I would definitely stay here again if passing through Logan. (Note: In my opinion, this is not a place to stay if you are staying for extended periods in Boston proper, as it is right on the airport grounds, and not hugely convenient to the city itself.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: banker1225
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights this past weekend. This Hilton is very well maintained, spacious rooms and really, really quiet! Could hear nothing from outside even though I could see planes coming and going from their gates. The hotel shuttle will take you to the nearby Metro station, and pick you up there if you call. Convenient way to get in to the City. Had an order of chicken wings and two drinks, a little pricy at $39 with tip, but tasty. Breakfast buffet was ok, but no omelet station and the scrambled eggs were powdered eggs I believe. I have ordered from the breakfast menu here before and the food is good, Overall, an enjoyable stay. Connected to airport, closest to Delta terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel. Convenient, clean and safe.”
Reviews.Author: TravellerTokyo6058
Reviews.Content: Have stayed over 5 times at the Logan Hilton prior to early morning flights. Comfortable, clean rooms. Easy shuttle ride or covered walk to the airport, and very friendly and accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay before an early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: SuzitravelsLondon
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms. Had an excellent meal in the Connollys Publik house - seared tuna with wasabi dressing followed by cod - yum. Breakfast was not great as it came out cold and was expensive. It also took 20 mins and mine was the only breakfast order in the kitchen. They did not charge me, but I then had no time to order anything else. The shuttle bus service is excellent. I was able to ask for a pick up from the car hire place and the bus came in a few minutes. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Location, clean, not much else. Tip: turn on the sauna 20 minutes before use, douse it with water for 10 minutes.”
Reviews.Author: akcol
Reviews.Content: Good: location, very clean rooms, impressive lobby albeit "The Shining-esque" which I liked, staff will accommodate basic responsibilities, some with attitude, some, with lovely energy. The lovely staff stand out, the others...eh, forget them. Bad: it's the small things that add up: key not activating gym, or room post gym, steam room not working (the reason i chose this hotel over the Embassy Suites with the breakfast option..which will cost you $20 out of pocket), poor, minimal food choices, expensive...let it go traveller, have a good sleep in your clean bed, catch your flight. Ugly: when the menu asks to inform of allergies, and I, the gluten free customer do, do not dismiss me, nor make zero attempt to accommodate my simple request (baked potato) ...gluten free foods can be easy for your chef, even if you dont understand the need...and for me, the person with the allergy, I'd tip you even bigger for actual service rendered versus dismissing me as a customer from your own ignorance and arrogance.

Reviews.Title: “Representative of the Hilton Brand”
Reviews.Author: Wandering_Rick
Reviews.Content: The Logan Airport Hilton represent reasonable value for money. The Positives 1) The hotel is attached to the airport although the walk can be a long one depending on the desired terminal. A shuttle service runs every 15 minutes via the various terminals and the Boston 'T'. 2) The hotel was representative of the Hilton standard in terms of its infrastructure and front desk service. 3) The gym was excellent. The Negatives 1) The one restaurant option, apart from using the airport options, was expensive and the service and food were average. A hamburger cost $16 and it was not worth the price. Service was marginally slow and somewhat contrived. The In-between 1) "Joey" was one of the shuttle drivers. He was exceptionally enthusiastic and even offered donuts and chocolates as a courtesy. impressive. Unfortunately, his enthusiasm often manifested in him interrupting CONSTANTLY. it was difficult to maintain a conversation with him. That said, he is memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: ValVil
Reviews.Content: This is an average Hilton property. Convenient to airport (you can walk to terminals), but not really focused on an excellent experience. This lack of focus is evident from the service in the restaurant (four meals and only one had good service) and from attention to details like a noisy ventilation system in the room. We have stayed here once in the past and have stayed in the Hyatt also located at the airport, and after staying at the Hilton again, we would recommend the Hyatt, which has a free shuttle, though you can't walk to it. For this visit we selected the HIlton because we had a business meeting at the hotel and Hyatt provided a cost for meeting facilities much more expensive than the Hilton, so if that is your need and cost is an issue, check out the Hilton. The staff did efficiently and satisfactorily handle all meeting related tasks.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hiflya
Reviews.Content: I'm traveling through Boston regularly. When I'm in need of a place at the airport, I usually pick my choice between either the Hilton at the airport or the Embassy Suites. Price is my deciding factor as both properties can fluctuate wildly, at any one time, one or the other can be more expensive by over $100. What I like about this property is that it's so easy to get to your flight in the morning as it's just a simple walk.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: capeys
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a three day conference. It was convenient to get in and out of the city as well as the airport, although it is a bit of a walk. Typical conference hotel

Reviews.Title: “This hotel to good to be in an airport!Great food,staff,rooms.CLEAN.”
Reviews.Author: tluddy1
Reviews.Content: Can`t believe this Hilton is in an airport. From the staff, food, rooms, and shuttle service, our stay couldn`t be better. Again, hats off to Hilton for a class act. Would stay here again! VERY NICE!

Reviews.Title: “Need new carpets”
Reviews.Author: Terserus
Reviews.Content: For the kind of money you have to spend here Hilton should invest some into upgrading the rooms. Even an airport hotel should invite to a next stay, this hotel does not.

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious front desk, staff is great otherwise”
Reviews.Author: ali28970
Reviews.Content: Agree with FreqTrav99 on the poor service specific to the front desk only. Our stay was a last minute booking at the end of a snowboarding trip, we changed our hotel to be situated near the airport for our flight out in the morning. Called the reservation line for Marriott and hung up before booking since we were already in the lobby of the hotel, not realizing that they offer a lower rate for a better room over the phone vs showing up. The front desk guy didn't want to honor the rate for me and gave me the stink eye when I suggested that I'll just call back to book thru the Marriott hotline. He had no words, just completed with the transaction and gave me a key. Maybe his issue was more my sweatshirt and the enormous bags under my eyes from spending several days on the slopes? I thought I was in a Hilton, not the Waldorf Astoria -- The other staff members are just wonderful, a very nice gentleman skillfully handled alllllll our luggage (a ton of snowboard equipment, suitcases, laptops, shopping bags). Loved his Boston accent and his tips for getting to the airport and returning the rental, he even whistled while he put our stuff away! Same goes for the staff the bar, so accomodating and friendly. The room was spacious and had a great view. I want that chair/ottoman/chaise with tray for my home! :) On our floor, there was a sitting area by the elevators where you could lounge and watch the planes go by. Pretty cool and perfect for "unplugging" after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Love It, Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: MJCNewYork_NewYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a month this past July for work and loved it. It is so close to the T and water taxi. The staff are professional, especially Dulce in the Executive Lounge she was very helpful. I recommend a corner room, you get more space and the views are great. The gym is great also, they have a sauna, steam room, Jacuzzi, and a nice pool. The bellman will tell you the right places to go and with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay at Logan”
Reviews.Author: MatinicusRock
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Boston Logan Airport is definitely the most convenient and nicest place to stay at Logan. I think I've stayed there 5-6 times and it's never a let down. Check-in is fast and easy, rooms are clean and beds are super comfortable. Bar is great - heavy pour cocktails and full of people who are there for the same reason you are - because they love to travel. I've had many a fun conversation at that bar! Only downside is sometimes if you're there to catch an early morning flight, their shuttles to the terminals can get backed up on weekends and holidays so make sure you leave enough time in case the line in the lobby is long!

Reviews.Title: “Steps to Logan Airport!!! Fantastic for early morning flights!”
Reviews.Author: FearlessNinja
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a life saver. I had a 6am flight and I wanted to get as much sleep as I can. This was just minutes to Logan airport. It had its own walkway to the airport. The walk to the furthest terminal was about 15 to 20 minutes. You can also take the free shuttle - it departs every 15 minutes. The room is clean, spacious and comparable to downtown hotels. As usual in Boston, Wifi is extra! Bottomline: I would stay here again if I had an early morning flight. For other flights, I may check out other hotels. It was good but not good enough for me to be a loyal customer.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: ryokogasuki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the start and end of our trip to Iceland. It was nice to be able to walk from the terminal (15-20 minutes via skywalk). The room was large,comfortable and quiet.We ate dinner at the airport before walking to the hotel since there were more choices. This hotel is a good alternative to going to a downtown hotel. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: SuzanLaw
Reviews.Content: The room and bed were comfortable and amenities were thoughtfully provided. The service was great from checking in, to dining, and to departure. I completed an online hotel questionnaire and the only complaint I had was with regard to the scent from the bathroom products as I am highly allergic. (The scent was neither strong nor unpleasant.) At my return stay at this hotel I was put in a scent free room (I had not requested this as I didn't know it was possible) and when I returned to my room following a concert, I found a cheese and fruit plate along with a hand written note from a hotel executive expressing appreciation for my feedback and the hope that my stay would be enjoyable. Transport from hotel to airport--exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Rude Service”
Reviews.Author: FreqTrav99
Reviews.Content: The room was great and the location was great, I can't flaw the accommodations at all. It was also very convenient to terminal E for our flight. The sky walk on the 2nd floor brings you right there with a 20 minute walk. We also didn't hear any plane noise which was great. We had a problem though with the desk manager that night. We didn't put a credit card on the room as we weren't expecting any room costs but we became very tired and opted for room service instead of visiting the restaurant. We misunderstood the waiter who brought the food to our room and thought we could settle the bill on check-out the next morning. Apparently this was not acceptable as we received a call to the room from the restaurant a few hours after the meal to ask for settling the bill. We asked if it could be settled at the desk in the morning and we were told it was at the discretion of the desk manager. We were transferred to him where he promptly said "no" and asked us to come down to settle. I went down with the credit card and no smiles, no "thank you for coming down", just an excuse that the restaurant needed to have it settled for the night (which contradicted the restaurant's statement). After paying there was no thank you again, just my card handed back. Made me feel like a deadbeat trying to skip out of a bill. I've never been treated like this in a hotel before and have always been able to settle on check out. Howard Johnson in Newark (which is a fleabag hotel) treated me better then this. It was a misunderstanding, but the manager could have treated us much better then he did. Room was nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but can be pricey”
Reviews.Author: ScooterRed71
Reviews.Content: After learning never to stay too far away from Logan when you have a 6:00 AM flight, the Hilton Boston Logan has become my "go to" hotel when flying home. It can be a bit expensive but knowing that I can wake up, walk across the skywalk to my terminal and not have to fight Boston traffic is so worth it. Rooms are nice and have been updated. The lobby still looks like it's stick in the mid 90's but that's no big deal. Fitness center features a good bit of Precor equipment and is maintained fairly well. And while I never have a big need for hotel staff, they're always friendly and welcome me back since I usually stay here 4-5 times a year. Only downside is the restaurant (Connoly's Public House).It's meant to be a British type pub but it's just a sports bar with lots of wood. Food has gotten worse each time I've dined here. It's not bad and I know it's an airport hotel so they've pretty much got you trapped but they could at least try to make a somewhat decent meal. I think the guests who stay here expect better food and are willing to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your pet”
Reviews.Author: Lilylake219
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently as our son was flying out for a ski trip and it appeared to be the most convenient location for a 6a.m. flight. Not only was everyone extremely friendly they even accept pets. A lot cheaper than boarding overnight. We ate at the hotel restuarants and the food was excellant and the service was great. We were not in Boston for anything other than an airport drop but we were all (including the dog) made to feel as though we were on vacation. We will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This place deserves ZERO stars!”
Reviews.Author: kobekeith
Reviews.Content: The Hilton near Logan is not like any other Hilton I have ever seen. It seemed low-class. The check-in process was terrible. I had to wait for about 20 minutes while "Hilton Honors" guests kept showing up when I was "next" in line. They are allowed to continually cut in line while regular guests stand there waiting. I was first in line the entire time. It was NOTHING like First Class check-in at the airport where there are separate agents for us and other agents for the economy people. I will NEVER stay at the Hilton again. The restaurant was a low-class sports bar. They did not have a nice place for drinks. The menu at the restaurant was terrible and the food had no taste at all. It's a terrible place. It does not even compare to the Hilton Hotel that we have here in Osaka, Japan. This place is a dump. It may seem nice to people who have no idea what a classy hotel is meant to be. It must cater to a certain type of person who would be satisfied with such terrible service. The man who checked me in denied that I waited for as long as I did. My two friends with me confirmed that I had not been exaggerating the time. They kept saying, "Aren't you first in line?!" But then another couple would walk up to the other line. The 3 idiots at the desk should not have been there for only Hilton Honors guests. There should have been a better system. Don't bother eating in the restaurant. Do not order room service from that terrible restaurant either. 35 dollars for 2 pieces of Boston Cream pie that tasted like plastic was a bit steep. We also got 2 bottles of water with that order. We did not even eat the cake. Too nasty. Bad service, bad food and bad atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “quintessential airport lodgings”
Reviews.Author: ShelLeary
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Boston Logan is great for several reasons: although you can take a complimentary shuttle, it is possible to walk to the airport + the rental car area; there is easy access to the highways; the rooms are neat and clean; and the staff has that classic Boston area dry humour. I highly recommend the avacado BLT from Connolly's Publik House. And a big thanks to the gentleman-staffer, "Sebastian" for looking up the first night code for me, I really appreciate you going the extra mile to help me out.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: frogbog
Reviews.Content: This is a great airport hotel...very clean, nice, very good service...highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: blanquita79
Reviews.Content: The hotel is contemporarily decorated and looks brand new. The rooms were well kept and very clean. The convenience of being close to the airport is a plus if you are in between flights. The restaurant was excellent as well. I got a great rate, in addition to free Starbucks hot beverage in the morning and free internet access for being an honors member. This is top of the line Hilton! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but disappointed this trip”
Reviews.Author: SBtravelgal
Reviews.Content: We usually have a perfect stay at this hotel when we travel to the east coast. However this time we noticed a sharp decline in the quality of the food. It was barely edible and very expensive. Would reconsider staying there next time.

Reviews.Title: “never believe what they tell you on the phone”
Reviews.Author: JohnEustace1
Reviews.Content: I arrived at short notice, picked up the phone in Logan arrivals, and with a 6.00 am, the next morning, on-bound accepted a room at the Hilton Logan at $250 p.n Walked to the hotel after an hour awaiting the courtesy bus to be told there was no room after all! Spent the night in the lobby here, being woken and told I could stay in the lobby as long as I didn't fall asleep. Despite the fact it was their error, I was forbidden to sleep as that made me a well educated, 66 year old, vagrant. F.F.S. as my Scottish friends would remark.....Welcome to America!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for traveling in and out of Logan”
Reviews.Author: kathleen a
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel, as my flight in the am departed at 6am!! Uggh!! I got pretty good rate on the room with my AAA card. The hotel is clean and again, very convenient for traveling. As shuttles run back and forth to the airport. He only complaint I would have, is the room had double beds not queen, sometimes I find the beds to be a little small

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nomis Y
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night, catching an early plane the following morning. Really easy to get to from airport: a short walk from Terminal A and Terminal E. Helpful staff, quiet room and a comfortable bed. Good food in the bar downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Can be used as a tourist base to avoid expensive Boston hotels”
Reviews.Author: dogsareforlife
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before but not for some years. Overall I'd say that they've managed to keep the high standards of cleanliness but its definitely lost some gloss. It IS still easy to get to from terminal E (international arrivals) and its even closer to terminal A. I like being able to walk to a hotel after a flight - it feels relaxing. You can catch the hotel shuttle too if you are feeling less than energetic. If you are arriving via the T get off the shuttle bus/Silver line at Term A for a shorter walk. We stayed in an exec room on the 10th floor. We decided to use the hotel for a city break and use the T to get to Boston. Firstly, the rooms are adequate in size and nicely furnished. Bathroom looked a little bit tired compared to what I remember but nothing bad. It was very clean. The worst part of the room was that we had a connecting door. This meant that on one night we could hear *everything* our neighbours did/talked about. They arrived late, were very noisy and were the same again very early in the morning - at all costs avoid rooms with a connecting door in order to ensure a good night's sleep! We had no trouble on the other evenings we stayed. The room has everything you need - iron/board, robes, slippers, coffee maker (lavazza coffee), Large flat screen TV (didn't use so cannot comment on quality or channel choice), radio/alarm, phones, safe and laptop tray. You cannot hear any aircraft noise which is amazing. The exec lounge is no longer opened on weekends so breakfast on Sunday was served in the Berkshire restaurant downstairs. This was a pretty good buffet with lots of choice. The rest of the time the breakfast was served in the 10th floor lounge. This was hugely disappointing compared to some other airport Hiltons. All carbs, nothing hot. Bascially its all sugary cereals, pastries and fruit. No protein apart from cold hard boiled eggs. I can't believe that in this day these people still cannot offer some eggs and bacon in the morning - its so easy. But they seemingly want you to go and spend your money in the Berkshire each day - which you have to if bread/cereal is something you can't eat. I just find this lazy and not really catering to HHonors members. We chose to use the Silver Line to get into Boston each day - it goes from the far end of Term A and ends at South Station where you can transfer to the red line or simply walk into downtown (its a very small city) Coming back, its easier to get the blue line to the airport stop and then get off the free airport shuttle at Term A leaving you with a very short walk back to the hotel. The travel was extremely cheap - $15 for a week of unlimited travel via Charlie Card (which is really easy to purchase from the machine at the far end of Term A by Au Bon Pain) - you can use this on the T and on the buses. You can even use it on zone 1 of the commuter rail network. We ate in Connelley's Publik House (a sports bar/pub type of place within the hotel) - service was prompt, food OK (there is an online menu via the website but no prices) - not much atmosphere but it may be people were tired after a day's work/a long flight. At any rate there are much better food choices in town (Legal Sea Foods and The Chart House are right outside the Aquarium T Stop...) Overall I think I'd stay here again - the rooms are warm and welcoming, the hotel is clean and tidy and you can usually get a good rate via the website - we paid $200 per night compared to the $350 ave price of a downtown hotel. I personally think its cheaper than staying Downtown (others may disagree?) and the new(ish) Silver Line gives you good transport connections to the city - very quick and easy in fact. Just beware of the connecting rooms! :)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: PeteD_London
Reviews.Content: Convenient but bland hotel. Unlikely you would stay here except for convenience of being able to walk to airport by covered walkway. Rooms overlooking airport have a very dull view but are reasonably quiet. Scored 3 for location, but is 5/5 if you want airport, It is not too inconvenient for downtown Boston by the subway, which is a 10 min walk away (or free shuttlebus) and then just 2 stops. However, much more convenient to actually stay in downtown Boston unless you have an early flight from Logan.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel and Services”
Reviews.Author: ScottyA320
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent patron of this particular Hotel. The Staff at this Hotel are always kind and warm, the gym, for a Hotel offers nearly everything one wold find at a professional gym. The restaurants offer a warm ambiance and good food, though a little pricy; service is always prompt, however :-) Getting to the Hotel is easy; either by walking through the skyway or via shuttle service. This is a great Hotel for business or if simply passing through!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Balloo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convenient for the airport. There is a shuttle bus to bring you to and from the train station which runs very frequently. I have stayed here twice, previously with children and we stayed in Executive rooms which were really nice and the staff in the lounge were great. The room was very quiet and we had a fantastic view. This time when we stayed in an Executive room we were really annoyed that the executive lounge closes at the weekends, there was nothing on the website to let us know this.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the business traveler!”
Reviews.Author: FireMedic203
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great location, great service. Not much else to say about that. Walking to the airport through the skyway or take the shuttle. Great hotel. I have stayed here several times and it ranks in my top 5 hotels to stay at in the country. As a business traveler, the gym is great, the bar is good (food and drink) and the location can't be beat. I have enjoyed every stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: cs03
Reviews.Content: After a very late (1AM) flight arriving at Terminal B, I was able to walk (via the central parking garage) to the Hilton. A very friendly person at the front desk checked me in, and off to a comfortable room on the Executive Floor. The lounge opened at 5:30AM, so I had a light breakfast before walking to Terminal C for my early morning flight. Although I missed using the other faciltities of the Hilton this time around, the relatively short distance between terminal and room meant more time on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great for early flights AND seeing 4th of July Fireworks”
Reviews.Author: thewilsonswanderings
Reviews.Content: We had to catch an early flight on July 5th, but we wanted to see the 4th of July fireworks without having a really crowded late night. Shirley at the front desk was great, reassuring us that the fireworks could be seen from the hotel (city/harbor side) which was true. We were able to see the main fireworks as well as as fireworks throughout the city. And then in the morning we were able to walk to the terminal we were leaving from. So convenient. Great service from all hotel staff that we encountered. Nicely appointed hotel room and quiet! One of the critiques that I read about the Hyatt Harborside was that even though the windows were sound proofed, the walls and doors were paper thin. We found this to not be the case at the Hilton and were very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bob_829
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed over at the Hilton Logan airport hotel last week and it reminded me that this is my favorite airport hotel. Within walking distance to Terminal A/E or a short van ride to B/C, the location is great for easy terminal access. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and surprising quiet for being just about on the runway. As a Diamond member of Hilton I have access to the executive lounge- one of the nicest in the fleet. Great views of Boston and the harbor, good snacks, nice breakfast, and friendly service. The only real negative is the cost of parking and the cost of taking a cab to the city. I recommend parking on level 2 of Central Parking and using the skybridge. That is $24/day vs. the $30/$40 fee for self and valet parking at the hotel. A cab ride to the city will run at least $25 and likely $30+ each way. The tunnel fee is part of the cost but cabs in Boston are high in general - as is parking in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great for after a long flight...”
Reviews.Author: travellingman59
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel for an overnight stay after arriving in Boston and before heading off the next day. It is connected to the airport, at least from the international arrivals, via a somewhat convoluted walkway, (there is also a shuttle, which i did not spot!) but fairly easy to find. Room was good. I had a meal in the "traditional" Irish pub which was good. As far as airport hotels go this was above average and fairly reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the weary traveler”
Reviews.Author: CdrMcBragg
Reviews.Content: Although we live in the Greater Boston area, we have stayed at this hotel many times. Usually we use it because our flight to wherever is so early in the morning that it would be impossible to get someone to drop us off, or I am too cheap to pay for a full week of garaging my truck. The hotel is a stone's throw from the airport and has a very dependable shuttle. The food at the restaurant is pretty good pub style fare, and it is a very relaxing atmosphere. The rooms are very nice and well appointed. Views can be achieved but for our purposes not neccessary and never asked for. For what we need it for, this Hilton goes above and beyond the call.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tolenram
Reviews.Content: The hotel is five star and very convenient to downtown via metro rail and the airport. There is a bridge from the hotel to the airport terminal A & B. There is also a shuttle. If you're beyond Terminal B, I'd recommend taking the shuttle instead because of the long walk. The restaurant is convenient but pricey. I'd recommend going to the Northside instead because they have a lot of very good Italian places there. When I travel to Boston I always stay here if I can and had never been disappointed. I return my rental car though and just take the metro to go around.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: mbreggar
Reviews.Content: Let's face it. Airport hotels exist primarily for overnight transients. They are not dolled up for the tourist trade...unless, of course, the airport is also near the touristy areas of the city. That is certainly not the case with Boston's Logan airport. But the Logan Hilton was a fabulous surprise. From its lovely towering lobby to its spacious, well appointed rooms and it's pleasant staff, the only downside it that this is not a downtown hotel. Hotel excellence is all about attention to detail...and these guys get all the details right! One note... Careful before dining in the Publick House restaurant. While the food was decent, the prices were outrageous. It would be cheaper to take a taxi downtown and eat in a nice restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gasolineass
Reviews.Content: Needed a hotel in Boston close to the airport and my sister will only stay at 4 stars or above. Boston hotels are very expensive, especially 4+stars. This hotel meet our expectations and more. You can use the hotels courtesy shuttle to the airport or walk via the skybridge. Very easy walk with luggage on wheels. Upon check in we were upgraded to executive level that had awesome views. I was sceptical but the rooms were truely soundproofed for airport traffic-- watched planes taxi and take off but never heard them. We did however hear our neighbor flush toilet more than once. Room to room soundproofing not quite as impressive as the outside noise soundproofing. Courtesy shuttle was also more than willing to drop us off at subway. Very helpful staff. Clean room, nice amenities. Food very expensive and not worth it. In room coffee was surprisingly good. Beds were not very comfortable. We had just come from a few days at a Marriott and they have very comfortable beds. Had been advised there is a charge to use business center computers, however bellman told us we could print boarding passes for free at computer next to elevator. There is a 24 hour dunkin donuts in the airport. Easy to walk over via skybridge and get coffee and donuts anytime day or night. Definately recommend this hotel if you need a hotel near airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stays Twice Now”
Reviews.Author: TransCon1
Reviews.Content: I have had two wonderful stays at the Boston Airport Hilton. Both times, my Hilton Honors Diamond VIP status was recognized and rewarded with nice rooms on the executive (top) floor. The desk clerk also gave me free parking when I asked about how the parking worked â€“ not a Diamond benefit, but a much appreciated gesture. They have a wonderful lounge with friendly staff and a great view of the Boston skyline across the harbor. The restaurant in the lobby had nice regional tavern fare and friendly efficient service when I was there for dinner on my second stay. I would like to have spent some more time there (both visits were quick over nights) which says a lot about an airport hotel. They seem to have a nice gym. I should do more of that a less of the exec lounge cookies â€“ four last time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: tallchick1978
Reviews.Content: Landed at Logan and walked across the bridge to the hotel. Incredibly convenient (although the walk from Terminal E to the bridge is a decent hike with luggage) - but within 10 minutes, I was checked in and up in my room. Great room, good pub in the lobby, and service staff were incredibly friendly. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Adel_Ealing
Reviews.Content: Despite it's an airport hotel, the underground takes you into town in les than 10 minutes so location is great! A skyway connects it with Terminal A and E. Restaurant was open till late and had a v nice burger after our delayed flight.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT, GREAT, GREAT for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: KathrinaO91
Reviews.Content: I loved the room-- I had a quiet, end of the hallway room, the bed was far enough from the door that I did not hear the bill sliding under my door! Great appointments--including a cozy lounge which was perfect for reading while sipping wine. The hotel bar/restaurant was competent... and clearly becoming a lively place around 9 PM! Best of all, it was great for being ready for an early morning flight. There is a bridge to terminal A and shuttle options to other terminals. Smooth/plush exit from Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GZOOOM
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms and facilities minutes from the main terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and functional”
Reviews.Author: ilrich
Reviews.Content: Great location for an overnight stop at Logan. There is a covered walkway from Term A straight through to the hotel, it's a bit of a walk but great when you get in late because you can just pick up your bags and make your way, no waiting for shuttle buses in the cold! On the way back to the airport, the free shuttle bus will drop you off at your terminal or if you want to get into town, to the subway. The hotel has a huge light and airy lobby area and there is a small gym and indoor swimming pool which are useful, if you need to kill a few hours. The Hilton Exec lounge is a little drab but the views over the city are stunning. Would definitely stay here again, for a 1 night stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Travel Fan 2
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel mainly for convenience, as we had a very quick overnight trip to Boston and I wanted to be sure we didn't miss our flight having to deal with traffic. It is definitely convenient! We walked from the airport to the hotel, all in an enclosed skywalk that only took a few minutes; same for the next morning when we headed back to the airport. Besides convenient, the room was roomy, clean, and comfortable. I also particularly appreciated the bellhop in the luggage check area. He found a great rate for us on a car and driver to take us to Wellesley, and couldn't be more helpful! Will stay here again next time we're in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Fall off the plane and straight into bed; Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Windswept_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this Hilton a handful of times when traveling to Boston/Cambridge and when connecting to other US/Canadian cities and have nothing but positive experiences. Easy to get to via a sky-bridge from two of the terminals, and if you land at one of the non-linked terminals then you can actually walk by heading through the parking garages - easy enough once you've done it for the first time, but probably not recommended if you're not familiar with the airport layout. Shuttle bus works just as well, but it's often quicker to walk. Rooms are good, with predominantly sensible layouts in the doubles/kings although the desk is sometimes a bit close to the end of the bed meaning you have to shimmy past. Bathrooms have always been clean and tidy. As others have mentioned, despite being so close to the airport and being surrounded my major roads you hear very little noise and I've had rooms over looking the entrance, the roads, and pointing at the main terminals. There may be a side of the hotel that is more noisy, but it isn't obvious. Breakfast is good and although the selection is somewhat smaller than at other Hilton's it has more that enough for most people.The older serving staff are polite, courteous and will stop and have a chat if you wanting to talk a bout any thing and everything, otherwise they leave you alone to enjoy your breakfast. The bar serves reasonable food if you're wanting a bite to eat of an evening but is a bit dimly lit which can make reading a paper/book a bit of a challenge - better to find a comfortable seat and watch some of the channels on the handful of TV screens they have. Having said I've nothing but positive experiences, the only grumble would be that the left luggage is just put behind the bell hop in the foyer and not secured in any way. Bags have always been returned without any issues, and the counter is visible to a number of reception staff when the counter isn't manned, but still, seeing a big pile of bags/suitcases out in the open makes you wonder how secure they really are. 10 mins after clearing immigration you can be in a decent hotel room, unpacked, showered, and no longer feeling like you've been squashed inside a plane. If I'm traveling alone, then this is my hotel of choice in Boston/Cambridge - I don't need to be in a hotel downtown as its simple enough to get there with a charlie card and the T.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to convention center”
Reviews.Author: shanderawx
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I registerered late and all the other hotels for the convention were taken. It was by far the cheapest and despite a few trepidations I liked the place a lot, very friendly staff, nice pool, easy access to airport and bus, Silver Line, to downtown. Really pleasant and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: marinadelrey11
Reviews.Content: I never stay in an 'airport hotel' but since our fall foliage bus tour was starting there - we had no choice. What a pleasant surprise! Lobby was beautiful, front desk staff was very professional and friendly. The rooms were nice and clean - even the breakfast was good. The free shuttle took us to the "T" and to the airport. Very good all around service.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for an early flight”
Reviews.Author: DJS377
Reviews.Content: We had an early flight out of Logan and so this hotel is in an ideal location as you can walk to and from 2 of the terminals and the others are only a short distance away by shuttle. It's a typical Hilton in that you could be anywhere in the world with the usual Hilton professionalism. Front desk polite and friendly. Good availablity on internet to check-in for the next day. The restaurant was fine - good plain American food served quickly with friendly service. You can't hear the planes even though you are in the airport so for a late arrival or an early departure ikt's ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Watch the Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Lisa D
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hilton Location 10/13/2011-10/18/2011 for a professional conference in Boston. Yes it is convenient to airport and the shuttle service was efficient. The room was nice. had a nice view of airport and water. It is amazing this close to the airport but you don't here the noise of the planes. However the bedding is a standard mattress and boxspring and lesser quality compare to hotels that are in the same category as a full service Hilton. Five day, sore shoulders, back and hips. Hotel restaurant is fair and it pays to eat there if you stay in for the night because room service adds about an addition 25% to the bill. Much better food was available at the Legal Seafood in Terminal C out side the gates and the hotel shuttle service will take you to the terminal and back to the hotel. My biggest issue was the poor housekeeping service. 3 out 5 days I had to flag down the evening housekeeper turning down beds for towels as the towels were taken but not replaced during the day. Also the housekeeper took it upon her self to throw away a bag with gifts because she thought it was trash. It was no where near the trash can, infact I tucked it away so it would be disturbed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Watch the Room Service and WiFi”
Reviews.Author: PugLuvr99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Boston Logan as part of a bus tour with Caravan New England Colors tour. Our first night was at this hotel. We were picked up at the airport by shuttle service to a very quick trip to the hotel. The front desk clerk was very polite and friendly. The room itself was beautiful. Much more than I expected as part of a bus tour. I was surprised that there was a $9.95 charge for WiFi access in the room, but since I needed it, I signed up to pay for it. I also ordered a sandwich and clam chowder to be delivered to the room and was astounded that the final bill was $36. The food was good, but that seemed way out of line for what I got. Turns out, when I checked out the next morning, without me asking, the desk clerk waived the fee for the WiFi access which I thought was awesome. I would overall highly recommend this hotel and it was a beautiful place to stay. Bed was very comfortable and the room spotless.

Reviews.Title: “most convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: fannyWestPalmBeachFl
Reviews.Content: if you have an early morning flight this is the most convenient hotel with both a shuttle service and a bridge to some of the terminals. The hotel has a good fitness room, a spa, and a small lobby coffee shop. The restaurant is good - we had great burgers. You are out at the airport so there is no other place to go, but taxis are available for quick trips into Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LCLee
Reviews.Content: Convenient hotel from the airport. Hotel shuttle picks up at the airport or you can walk across the bridgewalks in the airport through the airport parking structure to get to the hotel. The hotel shuttle also drops you off to the T-Lines (Blue and Silver) from the hotel. This was very convenient for my husband and I to go into Downtown Boston and take the subway for only $ 2.00 one way destination. And take the shuttle back to the hotel from the T-line station. Front desk check in staff gave us a high floor based upon my written request, ninth floor (on the Executive level) and got a great harbor and city view. Room is a typical Hilton room, but this had a nice L shape lounge chair with a heavy quality wood tray for use. Beds were comfortable and feather pillows are what I normally use at home. Also enjoyed the buffet breakfasts at the hotel. Al lthe staff were friendly. I really like the location, convenience and consistent Hilton quality rooms at this Boston location. Will definitely consider this hotel again when I come back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Paris_Junkie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is attached to Logan Airport with "sky bridges". Love the fact that I can be off the plane to the lobby in ten minutes or less (walking). Lines at recption can be lengthy. Staff at hotel is friendly and does their best to accomdate requests. The food in the restaurant "Publik House" is limited to "up-scale pub food". Food quality and portion size are excellent. Rooms are VERY QUIET and offer comfortable bedding and nice bath products. I do not have status with Hilton so not able to offer any insight to the permium offerings.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well designed”
Reviews.Author: RoxietheRunner
Reviews.Content: Room was well-lit, comfortable, details well thought out (such as towel rack inside spacious shower). Good water pressure and hot water for shower. Front desk staff friendly and accommodating, as were bell staff and shuttle drivers. Driver on Sunday morning was hilarious, and a great stress reducer for travelers anxious to get to airport. Pick up from airport took longer than advertised, but I appreciated the service. Negatives: $9 for a lukewarm bowl of oatmeal and $5 for a likewise not hot cup of plain black coffee in the Berkshire. No newspaper and no bill under the door for express checkout, as advertised. Also, at those room rates, guests should not have to pay for WIFI access in room. Overall a good experience and I would stay there again if I need to be near Logan airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great rest up before flying”
Reviews.Author: AZandDZ
Reviews.Content: With an early morning flight I wanted to be near the airport; the Hilton is right on top of it and I was in the lounge ready to fly with 15 minutes of leaving the hotel. Rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable and the food much better than most airport hotels, taking advantage of the local sea food. The hotel is reasonably lively and there is an excellent fitness centre, it"s not cheap but prices are not unreasonanle. The staff are polte ahd helpful

Reviews.Title: “As airport hotels go ...... One of the best !”
Reviews.Author: mapHongKong
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in airport hotels around the World, this is up there with the best. Good location, with Terminals A and E accessible by a connecting walkway. And great views of the airport. Most airport hotel bars are either empty or full of very tired business people, but here the bar was as lively as any in a downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Like this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GB4469
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel very much! We had an early morning flight out of Boston after a week of leaf peeping in the NE and this fit the bill. The hotel is on Boston Logan airport property and our room was quite clean and modern. We enjoyed it very much! The staff was friendly and helpful and our room overlooked the harbor, which was nice. The bathroom had a magnified makeup mirror for the ladies, a nightlight for those who need to get up during the night, and the counter was of granite and plenty wide for all our toiletries. The toiletries provided by the hotel were soap, shampoo, conditioner, lotion and a shower cap. The bed was very comfortable. All the table lamps had electrical outlets (the bedside ones had two, and the desk lamp had at least one and possibly two). The desk had a pullout return for added writing space. We ordered room service and it arrived within 30 minutes and was piping hot and delicious. If we had to find anything to complain about it would be the 3 or 4 automatic fees added to room service (15% service charge, $3.50 eating in room charge, tax and I believe one other that escapes my memory). Also, the hotel did not get a certain national television station that my husband is accustomed to having available in most hotels he frequents (ESPN) and missed a sporting event he was looking forward to watching. But these are minor issues. We did not hear any airplane noise during the night. The hotel runs a complimentary shuttle to the airport terminals. They pick up every 15 minutes at the front door starting at the top of the hour. They will also pick you up at the car rental place if you call and request to be picked up. We found their shuttle to be very punctual. We would stay here again if we needed to be near the airport and would recommend it to others. Keep in mind this is an airport hotel with all that entails (i.e., limited hotel parking and very congested traffic at times).

Reviews.Title: “Only if you have to...”
Reviews.Author: cherryRUk
Reviews.Content: Large,indifferent,mediocre airport hotel. Reception on arrival was pleasant enough but everything about this hotel feels impersonal and service certainly does not seem to be aimed at attracting repeat custom.No real direction given to our room,no offer of help with luggage. The room itself was large,clean and perfectly adequate. There is a charge for wi fi - one of my major gripes in hotels. With wi fi freely available in many public places and cafes it smacks of profiteering to charge for wi fi,particularly in an airport hotel where you might reasonably want to check flight details.The only available restaurant in the hotel served truly awful food. I only had a turkey sandwich but the bread was close to cardboard ie stale and the turkey did not taste fresh.It took a while for us to be seated and then another age for us to be served. The waiter (who was friendly enough at the outset) barely subdued his anger at the lack of a tip- which we only give if we've had GOOD service.In years gone by "Hilton" used to be a by word for quality, not any more.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and EXCELLENT customer service”
Reviews.Author: Bruce D
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 day trip to Boston that was work related but I took my wife and 3 year old son with me to make more of a holiday from it. I booked the Hilton Hotel at Logan airport for the convenience and familiarity with the Hilton Brand. I have to say that although there were a couple of things that went wrong the friendliness of the staff and willingness to rectify problems outweighed any of the negativity that could be felt with the issues. Firstly the hotel itself is as advertised. Close to the airport, easily reached by either a walkway from Terminal A or E (A being closer) and easy to get into the city itself (the hotel will shuttle you to either the subway or water taxi terminal). Rooms are more than ideal, the breakfast buffet is just right with hot and cold options (what do some people expect in a hotel breakfast buffet!!??) and the beds themselves were comfy for us as a family. The staff were the main plus point (for us). Firstly we arrived a couple of hours before the main checkin time due to our flight being early. I figured we would just leave the bags with a porter and come back later. The front desk agent however found a room available with a King bed (that I had requested but had not been available on internet checkin) and when she was told that the cleaners had not quite finished with that one, found another with an upgraded harbour view. This all being 2 hours before the advertised checkin time. Whilst I was in the process of doing this my wife was playing with my son in the lobby and a kind bellman gave him a packet of crayons and a coloring book to keep him happy and occupied. In a hotel that I would expect to be more oriented towards the business traveller..I found this friendliness towards my child impressive. Secondly All of the drivers we met on the shuttle buses were VERY friendly and helpful...not only with bags but with tips on things to do in Boston itself and pointers on public transport. Third. Received the bill on checkout. An extra room service charge had appeared that we had not used. Spoke to the desk agent. Explained the situation and how it could have happened. Not a single argument or question of my story. Profuse apology and charge taken off the bill. Having read the horror stories at numerous hotels on Trip advisor I found this to be most refreshing (especially as it would have been easy to stall whilst they investigated). The maid service for some reason decided to come into our room at 630am in the morning (I was already out for a meeting) but my wife and son were asleep in the room. This early entry woke both of them up. I was dissappointed on hearing this later as you don't expect to be disturbed at that time..even if we hadn't put up the do not disturb sign. Again when relating this as just a comment to staff at the desk (and it wasn't even a complaint..more just a comment of "please look into this") I was given sincere regrets and a small amount taken off the bill by way of apology. I found this level of service excellent and more than enough reason to visit this hotel again. If you are looking for an airport hotel where they treat you as an individual whilst giving you the convenience and comfort you would expect...then I highly recommend the Hilton at Logan airport One note....when returning on subway or water taxi the hotel does not have have a courtesy phone at either of these locations and you are expected to call them on payphone or cell phone in order to get a shuttle bus to pick you up. A bit inconvenient if you either don't have change or have an international cell phone that will stiff you on call rates. Perhaps a direct phone could be installed at these locations if the hotel is offering shuttle to them?

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: cemckeon
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is a nice airport hotel with lots of meeting space. Stayed here 3 days for a conference. Easy to walk to from Logan. Has an executive lounge for Hilton elite members. Room was spacious, and I didn't lose sleep from the sound of airplanes. Staff was very gracious and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just the ticket”
Reviews.Author: Designer_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights; on late arrival in Boston and prior to an early departure back to the UK and I couldn't fault it other than the grindingly slow computers in the exec. lounge. Clean, great staff, quiet and well placed. Be warned though - if you are arriving very late you may find you do not have the room you expected - this happened to us on the way in but the staff quickly sorted it out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Road-King777
Reviews.Content: Well appointed rooms and triple pane glass make this hotel an outstanding choice. You can walk thru the parking garage from any terminal in 10 minutes. Friendly and helpful staff. Great workout facility full of the latest equipment which is well maintained. A 10 min walk or 2 min van ride to the T gets you downtown in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Good, convenient and expensive!”
Reviews.Author: swisstony123
Reviews.Content: Had a short overnight connection at Boston so to maximise sleep hours I picked this hotel. It's walkable to all the terminals so no hanging around for shuttles (although it may be faster to take the hotel shuttle to the terminals at the far end of the airport). Check in was very efficient, room was clean, bed comfortable. As a silver Hhonors member they had an offer for free internet in the room and a free coffee from the shop in the lobby. No noise from the airport, but why oh why can't other guests have the courtesy to just keep quiet walking past your room at 3am. (This is a problem in general, not specific to this one property....) Only downside was the incredibly high price for an airport hotel - I paid almost $500 including taxes for a basic room and can't have been in the hotel much more than 7 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff after our encounter with Hurricane Irene”
Reviews.Author: AndrewandMandy
Reviews.Content: Had booked this hotel for the convenient location for our flights home, but was a great choice in view of Hurricane Irene's attentions. Arrived at the hotel at around 11am, whilst she was blowing a gale and raining as hard as she could, and the staff were so helpful in quickly taking all of our luggage inside to allow us to return the hire car. They then arranged for the hotel's minibus to collect us from the hire car office, a few minutes later. Our arrival at the hotel was earlier than the usual check in time, but this was not a problem and we were also upgraded to the executive floor where snacks and free soft drinks were available at certain times during the day. The views of the airport and of Boston were great from here. The bar/restaurant was a godsend as no food outlets were available within the airport, and we thoroughly enjoyed what we ordered. When we return to Boston, we will have no hesitation in staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable & convenient”
Reviews.Author: Madeline34
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel before an early morning flight - complimentary airport shuttle provided - also shuttle to subway making it easy to get into town. Very comfortable room & very reasonably priced. Would recommend for this purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Reception”
Reviews.Author: Grantie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August this year twice. We arrived after a late flight from the UK and found our check inn quick and welcoming. It was great being able to walk from the terminal straight into the hotel. We left after a two night stay planning to return for one more. After our return night we were unsure whether to stay another night as Hurricane Irene was on her way and we were supposed to be going to visit friends in Connecticut. The lady on reception who my husband was dealing with was absolutely lovely. She let us keep our room until 3pm before we checked out and then once it became clear we were going to have to stay another night gave us another room at a really good rate. We also got complimentary parking. She went above and beyond to be helpful to us. I'm afraid being a man he didn't get her name but she was a real asset to the hotel. The hotel was clean, rooms were comfortable and attractive. There was a good gym and pool which my sons made good use of during the storm. The breakfast buffet was very good and all the staff we came across were friendly and helpful. We used the shuttle a few times to take us to the T and car hire and the service was very good. I couldn't fault this hotel and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: littleiggy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within 5 minutes of the airport thus is convenient for individuals looking for a night stay prior to a early morning departure or late arrival from the airport. The rooms are very clean and the hotel offers free WiFi and internet. The hotel also offers a free shuttle, every 15 minutes, to the airport. 'T' and water taxi. We used this service numerous times and found the drivers and service to be excellant. This hotel is not cheap but is well located if using the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and so convenient”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Buff_BL
Reviews.Content: This hotel had all the basics covered. It's an excellent location after a late flight to have a nice night's sleep before starting a longer trip. The basics are good: excellent bed, bathroom, view, television. The internet was hard to access so they need to work on that. Service was good. The pub and restaurant were decent -- nothing great but worthy of an airport hotel. The price is just a bit high, but for the quality of the room, the location, and the decent service, I felt it was worth it. I recommend this hotel for anyone flying in late or flying out early of BOS airport.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: summitsvs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is connected to the terminals and I thought that it would be loud and inconvenient. However, I was surprised that it was very quiet and comfortable. The turn down service was wonderful and the ladies were more like my mother than employees! Free water is a plus in this location. The Executive Lounge was ok, not the greatest I have been to. The gym was very good. There is a pool and jacuzzi that looked clean and well kept. All employees were very nice. There is a shuttle that will take you to the train/bus station and all terminals, or it is a few minute walk and takes you almost directly into the city for far less than a cab. The pub on-site was good, but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice airport - hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mickeytzan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night due to a flight cancelation, and i was impressed. Situated very near to Boston Logan airport, the hotel offers all the amenities of a 5 star hotel. Big spacious rooms, nice bar and a spa in the ground floor which is free of charge. Very relaxing before a long trip. The receptionists were very helpful and kind too. I suggest it for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “An Hilton?? It should be called a motel!”
Reviews.Author: mibl06
Reviews.Content: At this price you would expect nicer rooms not a old designed room with no bar, no light extinction automated, etc... The restaurant (if we could call it so) is very bad and the waiters are not nice at all. For the breakfast the buffet is small and potatoes were not cooked! Oh I was about to forget the 32$/day for a parking were you park and get the car by yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay ...”
Reviews.Author: AsuParent2009
Reviews.Content: Very confortable bed, clean, and spacious. Great shuttle bus service from hotel to the train station. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “BAD COST BENEFIT”
Reviews.Author: ElcioBR
Reviews.Content: This hotel in at the Logan airport and itâ€™s easily reach by a walkway. We paid a very expensive fare and we expect for excellence, but it was average. The executive lounge was poor and had a not friendly intern taking care of the Gold, Diamond and VIP Guestâ€¦ in general it was disappointing. Thereâ€™s a shuttle service from the hotel to the airport and this is a very efficient service. From the airport you can easily reach Boston Downtown. Rooms are ok, and I had no great view, but itÂ´s possible to have a bayview. I recommend stay downtown. Itâ€™s possible for the same price or less

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient and Spacious”
Reviews.Author: travelbasic
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most convenient hotels I have stayed in. The rooms are very spacious and the view is impressive. We stayed the day after a cruise so it was convenient to use the walkway to the airport. The staff was helpful and friendly and the garden was very nice. It was great to have free WiFi and internet terminals.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hilton - Walk from Boston Aiport”
Reviews.Author: jim0521
Reviews.Content: Very high end Hilton. Largest pool and exercise area in any Hilton I visited. They drive you to the train station to catch the subway train to downtown, 5 minute train ride. Excellent location if you do not want to rent a car. Also water taxi available from downtown to airport/Hilton. Was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: tdl119
Reviews.Content: Good business hotel directly connected to Boston's Logan Airport. Can access via the walkway from Terminal A. Free shuttle to Logan. Room was clean and modern. Had dinner at Connolloy's Publik House. Food was pretty good. You must try the Lobster Deviled Eggs appetizer. More lobster than egg.

Reviews.Title: “Nickle and dimed”
Reviews.Author: NyBlumpkin
Reviews.Content: Check in was slow maybe lose the girl handing out the week old cookies and have her help check people in. The hotel was nice and clean the rooms clean the shuttle buses to the T ran good. Parking is way over priced 40$ for valet and 36$ for self parking per night with no in and out privileges. Room service had like 25% additional fees,tax and a $3.50 service fee and the service was slow at best. Its 2011 your really charging $17 + for wireless internet? Really come on.. It seems like the theme of this hotel is to get you any way they can.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Stotties7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before our early flight back to England,and what a disappointment. Our room was spacious but didnt have any bath robes, only had two towels and the bathroom door was dirty.We paid a alot of money for this room and we got much more value for money and service at the Radisson.We would never stay at a Hilton hotel again if this one was anything to go by!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Service unsatisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Domer130
Reviews.Content: Checked late in the evening ahead of an early AM flight. My wife and I were both quite disappointed by the service at the front desk. Guy clearly didn't care about customer service. Considering I'm a diamond member, i wonder how others who aren't elites get treated. Hotel was convenient though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if a bit expensive for an airport option”
Reviews.Author: charlierdu
Reviews.Content: The Hilton at Boston Logan is literally attached to the terminal buildings. I guess this accounts for the somewhat more expensive pricing structure of the hotel. While other airport hotel options are consistently better priced, you do get added convenience by paying more at the Hilton. The hotel itself is typical Hilton nice. The rooms are well sized with nice amenities. The public spaces are pleasant. The restaurant is a pub and is good. The hotel has a top-notch fitness center. Very enjoyable to use with plenty of equipment to make your workout effective. The hotel offers two Executive level floors with a nice sized Executive Lounge on the 10th floor. The one challenge with the hotel was with the adjoining room door. A family of four with two young children were in the room next door on the Executive floor. The two kids were under four years old. From 5:30am they were up and about speaking very loudly as young kids do. I know this because I was woken from my sleep by the volume of noise coming through the adjoining room door. I expect something a bit better from Hilton. Overall I always stay at this property if the pricing is not so much more expensive it is hard to justify the additional costs.

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent service, good location!”
Reviews.Author: a8l2010
Reviews.Content: For $300/night you would expect better food being served at the executive lounge, it was your 2nd rate Holiday Inn continental stuff, and once when i went around 10.00ish, they had already removed the breakfasst eventhough the hours for the lounge is supposed to be unitl 11.00 AM week days.... Room was smallish, and very ok nothing special, small bathrooms as well.... Nice cafe downstairs for starbucks coffee...... Excellent shuttle service to downtown, blue line etc......some of the drivers are pretty stiff however! Probably not my first choice......

Reviews.Title: “Quiet”
Reviews.Author: tooblackdogs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here courtesy of American Airlines cancelling my flight to Seattle. Great convenient location right on the airport grounds. We had an early morning departure and it was nice to be at the counter 5 minutes after leaving the hotel. The hotel was clean and quiet, and the shuttle driver was fantastic! Dropped us off at the Blue line so we could take the T into town and picked us up upon return. They have a really nice bar/restaurant so you don't even have to leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Functional & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Jake F
Reviews.Content: Came here at short notice as my flight was rerouted from Newark. It's a short (five minute) bus ride from the airport, or a short (15 minute) walk. Welcome in the lobby was OK, nothing special. Room was decent enough - comfortable bed, good shower, etc. Food in the onsite bar/restaurant was also OK (grilled cheese). The business centre was fine. Check out was quick and efficient. All in all, a good place if you have to be up very early for a morning flight and need to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service!”
Reviews.Author: balkanmomma
Reviews.Content: On Saturday, August 27th, I made an online reservation for an incoming student of mine from the DRC who was supposedly put on a Paris-Boston flight because all Paris-NYC flights that day had been canceled due to Irene. This student--whose English is poor-- had left me a text message about her flight change. I had no idea what time she was coming but I knew I had to get a room in Boston for her fast due to the weather. Well by 8 pm that night, I found out she was not coming to Boston. I panicked because I had used my personal credit card to make this reservation and I was four hours past the cutoff to cancel. I called reservations at the hotel and the man I spoke with couldn't have been nicer. He told me that there was no problem and that all fees due to my late cancellation would be waived because of Hurricane Irene. I apologized profusely but he insisted it was no problem. He then thanked me for being patient while he did all that was necessary to get me free of this charge. At the end, he even told me to stay safe in NYC. This man is absolutely lovely and if he is indicative of the quality of this hotel, then I say you won't go wrong here! Thank you, kind customer service rep!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, amenities, and service”
Reviews.Author: TrueBlue100
Reviews.Content: A no hassels hotel that has terrific service, clean rooms, great amenities, and a location to the airport that can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: flygirlsf
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, clean, convenient, with a great pool. And the view from my room was fantastic, I could see the entire harbor and skyline. It's a little expensive, but most nice hotels in Boston are. And in this case you really get what you pay for. This is a great place to stay before a flight!

Reviews.Title: “Super Convenient to Airport & Boston Subway”
Reviews.Author: BigFeet16
Reviews.Content: I've read complaints of high prices on tripadvisor, but didn't find many cheaper offerings when I booked a king-size room here (and some hotels appeared twice as much). Savings come in the form of not needing to rent a car or to hire a taxi to drive you around. Boston has a first-class subway/mass transit system (spoken by an envious Southern Californian) and I enjoyed using it. The hotel was very comfortable for me: quiet (including air-conditioning system), good KS bed and decent breakfast food... But I had a return-home take-off at 6:30 a.m. on Friday, and in addition to the very cool skybridge which connects to Terminals A & E, The Hilton provides 24-hour shuttle service directly to airport (even at 4:30 a.m. the shuttle was full)... so that I was able to wake, dress, shuttle to airport, move through security and find myself, 45-minutes after waking, sitting at my gate. Over the 2 days I was in town (moving my son to Harvard) I enjoyed using the subway, which extends its reach to Logan via the Silver Line (bus). I will return to Hilton on future visits and recommend the hotel to my well-traveled wife simply due to its tremendous convenience.

Reviews.Title: “very quiet, clean and walking distance from international terminal”
Reviews.Author: FleurGroningen
Reviews.Content: we stayed here immediately after arriving on a late long haul flight from Europe. The Hilton is easily reached from the international Terminal through a skybridge (10 minute walk). What struck us as very positive was that the hotel was very cool (and not like most hotels very hot!). The quiet and efficient aircon in the room combined with ultra quiet sound insulation (you cannot hear any planes at all!) and very comfortable beds. Beds are firm and very clean. Room is spacious enough and would accommodate the airport trolley easily, thus making it easy for us to take our luggage with us. Reception staff were efficient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “a convenient airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: cleste01
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at this hotel. It is located on the grounds of the Boston airport, and is literally connected by pedestrian bridges with the international terminal and one of the domestic terminals. It has small but pleasant rooms and a nice lobby. There is, of course, nothing to walk to except for the airport. The room was not spotless, but was cleaner than most airport hotels. There was free internet access in the lobby. The major downside is that they charge high prices for food and other items. The coffee stand in the lobby did not prominently disply prices which were extremely high. However, service was excellent and room service was average quality. Overall the convenience of not having to navigate Boston traffic (or public transportation) in the morning outweighed the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: munchyDublin
