Reviews.Content: very nice staff. stayed here twice in 2 weeks was exec floor first time very nice nibbles in loungesecond time was normal floor went into room late afternoon and noise from tv next door wayyyy to loud so i rang down and was upgraded free of charge back to exec floor, pool lovely , bar food nice but pricey,

Reviews.Title: “so quiet!”
Reviews.Author: swissguest
Reviews.Content: Just amazing how quiet the rooms are even though the Hotel is in the middle of the airport with planes like 200 m away and the highway next door. We had a large room with a nice bathroom. A mini-bar would be a plus, but then you have the usual vendor machine on the floor. breakfast was good with an ok service despite us being really early there. Bus service to car rental worked well. Price quality excellent in my opinion

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: captaink007
Reviews.Content: A stones throw to bostons logan airport, short stroll or qiuck hotel shuttle to trolley or water shuttle to downtown boston

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: SharZ_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient for an early morning flight. And we couldn't believe how quiet it was considering it was right by the airport. The price seemed reasonable to me, but that may be because I was there on a weekend. The only suggestion I have is to add more attendants to check people in. There were only 2 when I checked in and the line was long. The flight crews get to go right up the desk, so that also slows things down.

Reviews.Title: “We slept so well in their terrific beds!”
Reviews.Author: WhippetsRule
Reviews.Content: Attached to Boston Logan Airport. Take the Hilton Bus from the transportation platform of any concourse right to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outrageous prices!”
Reviews.Author: RincenaTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week and the cost of one night would have bought me a carribean cruise. Simply outrageous that this property would charge this amount. The food was also overpriced and it was not a high quality. Basic expensive pub grub. I recommend using hotwire when staying at Logan. You'll save a fortune for the same type of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for an early flight”
Reviews.Author: PotterMoose
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice, on arrival at Logan and before leaving again three weeks later. Both rooms the same, reasonable size, walls a bit thin but no noise at all from the airport. The decor is bland, but clean. There is a smallish bathroom with a shallow bath, shower over and lots of surface area for stuff, and a nifty low level light for night visits. Lots of power points for charging stuff, including in bedside lamps: excellent. Big comfy bed, and great views over the airport and Boston. There was a wait in line to check in at 10:30 at night, but no wait at all second time around at about 5pm. We booked an Executive Room, but the lounge got so busy on the Sunday night that we took our snacks back to the room. Ate in Connolly's Publik (sic) House - fish & chips plus beef burger were both good, but the bar isn't very nice. The Fitness Room is well equipped, with free access via lobby. The staff are very friendly, especially the bellboys & reception. Only about a 10-15 minute walk to the airport, which is very convenient for an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Not as convenient as the location suggests”
Reviews.Author: azs123
Reviews.Content: You really need to take the shuttle to get to the terminals. It is small and runs every 15-20 minutes and then takes a long time to get back to the main terminals. Might as well be off airport

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: ailismum
Reviews.Content: Large hotel with long corridors. Very convenient for airport. Complimentary Hilton bus takes you where you need to go. Comfortable room. No complaints at all - perhaps lacks the personal touch but I expect they have so many guests it's a bit of a carousel of people coming in and going out. Couldn't fault it for location - walkable from the airport. Lots of pilots and crew staying over. More of a business stay than a holiday base = overall feel and impression.

Reviews.Title: “The best choice for an early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: gosaka
Reviews.Content: I just stayed again at the Hilton Logan since I had an early departure in the morning. This place is very convenient, solid service, quiet for an airport hotel and always buzzing with activity. It's pretty easy to drop a rental car and get to the hotel. The Hertz bus driver even dropped me right at the door (I don't think this is normal) since I was his only passenger. In the morning, there was a big crowd of guest headed out and the hotel wisely had two shuttles running so we weren't jammed in or late. They also have a reasonable medium sized gym that's open till 11PM. I've used this in the past on long layovers for a fee. Worked out and showered....good break that beats hanging around the airport lounge. Lastly, come on Hilton, what's with paying for Wifi?

Reviews.Title: “Super convenient”
Reviews.Author: alphabetsoup2010
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for one night en route to the airport. Overall, it was great: - Room was spacious, spotless, and well appointed (was on executive floor) - Service was gracious, efficient, polite - The skybridge to the airport terminal is amazingly convenient Only things I would suggest working on: - The lobby feels cold and dated - i.e. more Marriott than Hilton. Must be some design fixes that would bring it up to date. - The breakfast buffet in the restaurant is pretty weak. -

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for price and location”
Reviews.Author: 5wiseguys
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a really good price on two rooms at this hotel through Priceline. One of the rooms had a view of the harbour and downtown Boston, the other - the airport. Airport noise was a NON-issue - we didn't hear anything and I am a light sleeper. This hotel was very easy to get to from the Interstate. Rooms were clean and a good size. Beds were comfortable and water pressure in the shower while not great was adequate. Fitness centre was open 24 hours per day. Housekeeping staff and shuttle drivers were all friendly. While there is not a lot immediately around the hotel other than the airport, shuttle service to the "T" subway station (which takes you anywhere you want to go in Boston) was excellent, arriving about every 15 minutes. We found excellent value in purchasing the 7 day transit pass for $15. Parking was $23 daily. We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant one morning for convenience and were disappointed. The eggs in our lobster eggs benedicts were overcooked and the english muffins were burnt! We should have sent them back but didn't want to miss the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel In Newark!”
Reviews.Author: DorannBermuda
Reviews.Content: Returning home after a family wedding we stayed over night at the Hilton Airport hotel. The rooms were spotless, great sound proofing and wonderful beds. There is a restaurant on site, a little pricey for pub type food, but good food and you didn't have to leave the hotel. What we found really great was that you can use the hotel's skywalk right over to the Delta terminal. They do have bus shuttle service but with stops - it was so easy just to walk right there. It's about a 5 minute walk - there are elevators as well as esculators and the hotel have luggage carts which you can collect and keep in your room until you are ready to use them. The hotel, including tax was $202 but most airport hotels are high in price - we felt with the great comfortable quiet room and the use of the skywalk - it was well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Flight Cancelled Emergency Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: Roz78
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenager and I were detained overnight as our flight was cancelled "due to weather in Baltimore" and we unexpectedly needed a room for the night. We walked across the skybridge from the Southwest terminal at Logan to this beautiful Hilton. We were informed that all the rooms were totally booked however a lovely desk clerk, Javier, got on the phone and found availability in the hotel for us within 90 minutes as we sat in the lovely lobby, all 3 of us calling hotels in Boston and everyone was booked with one exception that looked kind of seedy. We did pay just under $300., twice what I normally spend as a Hilton Honors member, for a double room on the executive floor but after 7 hours of airport chaos, we just enjoyed the terrific food, view and first class accomadations. It may seem silly but the arugula salad and the bath soap, shampoo, lotion were almost worth the entire $300. Large, clean, quiet,comfortable rooms and very kind of Javier to help a stranger in distress. Great employee, Hilton people!

Reviews.Title: “Great easy stop for early airport departures”
Reviews.Author: t1999
Reviews.Content: I've probably stayed here about 10 or 15 times in the last few years. Its right at the airport so its great for early flights. Rooms are clean, service is very good. Food in restaurant and bar area are also good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: mbfrye
Reviews.Content: We stay here often and I can't say enough about this hotel. They are lovely, child friendly and perfect for early morning departure from the airport. I love that you can wok over to the airport if you don't feel like waiting for the shuttle and the walk is covered so you don't have to worry about the shuttle. We often order pizza and have it delivered to the hotel. The rooms are big and have anise view of the city (and sometimes the harbor). While nothing is perfect this comes close to making travel out of Logan in the morning stress free. It can be a bit expensive but is worth it. The staff will go out of their way to accommodate your every(and sometimes random) wish.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to get to Boston on the T.”
Reviews.Author: five4theroad
Reviews.Content: We selected the Hilton because of the connector walkway it had to the airport, since we were arriving at midnight and not knowing the airport or Boston, I wanted an reputable and easy hotel to get to. As it turned out, our flight was delayed 9 hours and we arrived at 9am, thus not needing this easy connection. The hotel is very nice, clean, comfortable rooms and bed. It was even quiet, which was surprising being next to the airport. Breakfast buffet was included in our package and it was very good - lots of selections to satisfy anyone (including two teenage girls and one vegetarian). The onsite restaurant was good but a bit pricey. We had to wait one night about 30 mins and the hostess seemed a bit frazzled. Getting to the T (subway) station at the airport was easy, just took the shuttle and told them where we needed to go, sometimes we had to make other stops in between, but it was reasonable. The girls enjoyed the indoor pool, and we all enjoyed the exercise room with the various equipment and tv's. In room internet service is available for a fee, which disappointed me, should be included with your room. There are computers available for free in the lobby. If you need to be close to the airport and only have a couple of days to be in Boston, this is a great location and it's easy to get anywhere via the T.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mountaineer600
Reviews.Content: My son, daughter-in-law and I stayed here the night before I flew back to Seattle. We had a two room suite that was very nice. It was one of the few hotels near the airport that had two queen beds. I also had free shuttle service to the airport the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jen31373
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for airport convenience. The rooms were modern and spacious enough. Quiet rooms, comfortable beds, nice TVs, nice bathrooms with good water pressure. The hotel has an indoor pool, jacuzzi, sauna, and a gym with cardio equipment. There is an outdoor area if you want to layout in the sun. The restaurant has a decent menu, but everything is pretty much airport prices. Breakfast buffet was OK offering standard breakfast options (breads, fruits, cereals, bacon, eggs, cheeses, etc). Overall, a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Early out or late in? This'll do.”
Reviews.Author: SATXAG
Reviews.Content: Very convenient if you have an early flight out and don't want to get up at 3 or if you get in late. The rooms are clean, quiet and comfortable. No food or drink after 12:30 was the only problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel and so convenient”
Reviews.Author: CaliTour2009
Reviews.Content: Connected by a skywalk to the main terminals, this is so convenient - especially if you have an early flight out of Boston. We're Hilton Honours Gold members so we were upgraded to the executive floor - our room was great. Comfortable bed, very clean and remarkably quiet given its proximity to the runway - don't think we heard one plane. We got free continental breakfast in the Executive Lounge, which was good and opened at 5.30am. You could even stay here if you were visiting Boston as it's only $2 (each way) on the T train into town and there is a free shuttle bus that runs from the terminals to the T stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great for morning flights”
Reviews.Author: dolphinswish
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight prior to a morning departure. What a great way to avoid the morning stress of getting to the airport on time. We returned our rental car, took the shuttle to the airport, printed boarding passes then walked to the hotel. The room was great - clean, quiet with comfortable beds. Use of the pool and spa area downstairs was also included in stay- the lap pool was a real treat, there is also a whirlpool, steam room and sauna. WiFi is supposed to be included but did not work for my son. He did not call the desk for assistance so with more persistance it probably could be worked out.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and definitely to recomend to a friend !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dsusilo99
Reviews.Content: The services were great, Shirley was be able to accommodate early check in and late check out as well. She provided an excellent Customer Services. Will definitely recommend to friends. Great location, sky-bridge connected to the terminal directly, shuttle bus to the T station.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: pfgltd
Reviews.Content: Traveled to the Boston area for business in a city about 45 minutes away. Decided to stay at this hotel due to the convenence of turning in the rental car the evening prior to my early morning flight and being able to walk to my gate via the Skybridge. The hotel was nice and the room was comfortable. The walk to the airport via the Skybridge from the hotel took less than 10 minutes. A note to those who plan to stay at this hotel after returning their rental car in the late evening hours....If you call the hotel to arrange the complimentary pick-up from the airport to the hotel, just tell the dispatcher the name of one of the airlines that are displayed on the overhead signs by the complimentary bus transportation pick-up. The dispatcher I spoke with didn't seem to know how to react when I told them I had arrived on a different date and was dropped off at the airport by the rental car transport.

Reviews.Title: “Really a great find”
Reviews.Author: Luvthebeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights after returning from a trip abroad. I was very impressed with this property, and surprised that there was absolutely no airport noise. Our room was spacious enough and the bed extremely comfortable. Having just stayed in many hotels where WI/FI was running as much as $25/day it was a pleasure to have access to so many free computers on the first floor as well as a couple in the executive lounge. The hostess in the lounge was quite pleasant and helpful with information and it was nice to get up and enjoy a coffee and fruit in such lovely surroundings. The added bonus was the shuttle service to and from the T station which made it so easy to travel into the city. My only observation is that while the hotel provides benches for smokers outside and away from the entrance, it would be nice if there were some for those nonsmokers waiting for the shuttle and/or a pickup. I would definately recommend this hotel to others and will probably stay there again when I travel out of Logan.

Reviews.Title: “Above par for an Airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: MtlFire
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Logan for a week on business. Chose between the Hilton's largely based on price and not location. I however came away thoroughly pleased with my visit. The Hotel was quick walk after my flight and yet is just far enough away that you don't feel like you're at the airport. Check-in was simple and efficient. As a Hilton Diamond I was upgraded to the top floor which offered a nice view of the harbor as well as terminal A. As with most Hiltons, upgrades typically mean the same room on a higher floor. The room was clean, nicely furnished and your typical although modern Hilton decor. The executive lounge is located on the top floor, just over the main entrance. It offers some equally impress views. Those that like plane watching and see them line up over the horizon as the land one after another. The lounge was rarely full, has a few TV's and computers. There was always a concierge present, most days I ran into Gayle. Although I didn't require her services she was always polite, friendly, and greeted everyone as they came in. Breakfast was fresh fruits, toast, hard boiled egg etc. No hot items. Canapes in the evenings seemed to vary from night to night, but there was always two hot choices. The lounge is closed from Friday afternoon until Sunday evening. At check-in I was offered certificates for a continental breakfast on the weekends. The continental breakfast appeared to consist of picking something up at the coffee shop (which serves Starbucks for those of you that are addicted). I inquired about purchasing and upgrade to a full buffet breakfast and was upgraded for no charge for my loyalty. I was more than willing to pay, but a big thumbs up for this gesture that left a great customer service impression. I always leave a little tip for maid service. This is the first hotel where the maid would leave me a little thank you note. Once again, just a little small gesture that although not expected contributes to portray a superior level of interest on the part of the employees. The gym is very nicely equipped, including a pool and hot tub as well as sauna and steam room. I thoroughly enjoy the steam and am always pleased to find this in a hotel. The gym is located just off the lobby, so I was happy to see that it also had changing rooms to avoid walking across the lobby in sweaty clothes. However when I inquired about getting keys to the lockers was told they don't provide them and that they are locked on purpose? Odd, but whatever. Transportation was great, there was always a shuttle outside within a few minutes and they would drop you off at any of the terminals or the train/subway/metro station. The driver seemed quite flexible and appeared to drop people off at many other places, car rental etc. A 7 day metro pass was only $15. A great deal that saves you a car rental, parking fee's and a lot of time. I was fortunate to get a decent convention rate, outside the convention rate this hotel was quite expensive. The rate would have likely turned me to look at one of the other Hilton properties but in the end I was more than pleased with my stay and would certainly suggest you consider it. The onsite restaurant had a great dinner menu (pub style though), service was fast and the food was very good. I actually returned more out of interest to try other things on the menu then out of necessity. Kudos to the Chef.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you are passing through”
Reviews.Author: coalmanshoss
Reviews.Content: You can get to the hotel from the walkway, We came in from Terminal E and it was an easy walk. We went out at Terminal C and used the free shuttle bus which runs every 15 minutes but it would have been as easy to walk. Usual Hilton hotel and had a good nights sleep. We also used it on the way home as we were early for check in so we had a meal at the bar/grill and then staying in the hotel and worked on our computer. It would have been better if we could have found comfy chairs in the bar/coffee area.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: TravlinLs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while in route to take a daughter to camp in Maine. Very convenient for late night arrivals or departures from Logan. $329 was expensive for a regular room with a view of the taxi way. Very quiet, nice work out facility, and indoor pool. On the second day, the maid left toilet paper/tissue in toilet without flushing after cleaning-disgusting! Watch the rates, they go up and down day by day-I just happened to pass on the $259 rate and tried to ride it lower but it went the other way.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: DDMMM
Reviews.Content: We usually don't stay at hotels around the airport. Not much to see and not much to do, noisy, congested and often not the best of neighborhoods. But the Hilton at Logan Airport is so convenient....it's like another terminal - you and your luggage can walk there without so much as taking a step outside. You can take the hotel shuttle to the train station, or the free airport shuttle. A short train ride takes you just across the water to the heart of Boston. The best part of this stay? Not having to wake up at 4AM to make our morning flight to Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel3737
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night before an early morning flight out of Boston. It was just what we needed. We took the free hotel shuttle to the subway that evening to go to dinner in Boston (about a five minute train ride into Boston). We took the subway back to the airport and caught the shuttle back to the hotel again. Very easy! The shuttle runs every 15 minutes. We never waited more than five minutes or so. The room was clean and large. Comfy bed with loads of pillows and a very soft extra blanket. The a/c worked great! We both slept very well. Didn't notice any noise from airport or other rooms. Used the hotel computer located in lobby to print our boarding passes. Very easy process. Caught the free shuttle early the next morning and arrived in plenty of time for our flight. I would definitely stay again! We used Hilton Honors points and got the room free. Loved that!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel. Expensive, However.”
Reviews.Author: Phil_from_NYC
Reviews.Content: There's a skywalk that connects this hotel with the terminal, which means you can sleep somewhat later than usual before catching an early plane. I stayed at this hotel on a nice day in May, but I can see how it would be terrific in bad weather for avoiding taking a cab (or rental car) into snarled highway/airport traffic. This place is expensive, though, with a base rate (before taxes) of $319 for the lowest-priced room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a quick business trip ... sound proof airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gambit76
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 11:00 pm on a Sunday night at Logan Int'l. So I booked to stay overnight at the Hilton airport hotel and then meetings in Boston starting Monday morning. It was a perfect way to get some rest as the sound proofing in the rooms was excellent. I have never used an airport hotel before but would recommend it if you are certain that the rooms are sound proof.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for Airport, nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: redwrangler
Reviews.Content: The Hilton at Logan Airport is the best place to stay if you need quick access to the airport - good shuttle service and great parking deals if you need to leave your car for a few days. Standard Hilton services - clean, nicely decorated room, good room service, nice restaurant and a safe, well maintained property. It is worth a few dollars more to stay here rather than struggle to the airport early in the morning! Shuttle drivers are invariably polite - even at 4 am!

Reviews.Title: “Good location at airport, plush hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BaronFoer
Reviews.Content: Walking distance if you don't want to wait for a van, but it has a van also. Verey nice amenities and a coiple of restaraunts but expensive. $17 burger. Nice rooms and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, pleasant staff, good access to public transit”
Reviews.Author: MarieMom25
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice - generally on-par with other Hiltons. The staff was generally helpful, with the exception of one grumpy shuttle bus driver. It had good access to public transit. You can also walk to the airport (all indoors) which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for terminal e and a”
Reviews.Author: Laurista
Reviews.Content: Like many others we stayed here as we had an early flight home. The porters were excellent and very helpful and friendly. They quick to get a cot to my room for my baby. The room was clean, although a little worn, but for 1 night it was good. We did get food to go from the pub in the hotel. The food was very good, however the staff were less than friendly - maybe it was because I ordered out. Only takes 10 mins to get to check in and was very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with helpful staff. Rooms well appointed.”
Reviews.Author: Tessx
Reviews.Content: Our room was great. Clean, quiet, great bedding. Room service great! We arrived late and they rustled up a superior parfait even though it wasn't on late nite menu.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing negative about staying here”
Reviews.Author: gooberlucy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my daughter, a new college grad, who is re-locating to Boston to start her new job/career. Check-in was easy & informative. Room was neat, clean & had everything we could ask for... we had been a little apprehensive to stay so close to the airport, but we never heard the planes in our room. Concierage was helpful with Boston info & info about riding the "T". The shuttle drivers were always friendly & helpful. We ate in Connelly's restaurant 2 of the 3 nights -- service was great, food was delicious. All in all, we will stay in this hotel again & will recommend it to friends & family when they come into the Boston area (to visit my daughter)!

Reviews.Title: “No Stress”
Reviews.Author: Compuvideo
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston to attend Commencement at Clarke in Worcester, which is an hour away, but stayed at the airport for convenience on arrival and departure. It also meant renting a car for only one day to get to Worcester and back. since my mother is 85, I wanted to make it easy to get to our room on arrival and to allow an early departure back home. They have a great shuttle service every 15 minutes from the airport and the car rental kiosks. They will also take you to the subway and the ferry dock. The drivers are knowledgeable and very helpful. Other family stayed in Worcester and paid about the same for a much lower quality hotel (check out Hampton Inn, Worcester) and had to rent their car for 2 days, so the $250 per night at the Hilton was compensated by this. The restaurant was draughty, but the food good and with good portions. Check-in was a snap, once I gave them my confirmation number as they had spelled my last name incorrectly. Room was very quiet, considering it is right next to the airport, and the HVAC worked very well. Bathroom was in good shape.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DAVIDJORGE
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel regularly for business. I always find the staff to be extremely professional and friendly. Rooms are very nice and the bed extremely comfortable. It is conveniently located and walking from the terminal to the hotel only takes about 10 minutes. A great choice if you should be wanting to stay in or around the airport vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: artap
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and we really enjoyed our stay! Super friendly staff, clean room, and given a wonderful upgrade as a HHonors Gold Member with a big thank you for our loyalty! Love their hotel bar/restaurant! Great food and generously poored drinks! The airport shuttle is great as well! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel and very convenient for the airport.”
Reviews.Author: philburnley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight en route to Orlando from Heathrow. Got our bags and easily found the hotel which is connected to Terminal A. Easy check in, in a very impressive reception! Very comfortable room and beds, bathroom clean. Food fine in bar/ restaurant, a little expensive but all hotels are! Had to be up by 4am next morning for connecting flight so couldnt take full advantage of the room. This is a very smart hotel which is convenient if you need the airport near by.

Reviews.Title: “COnvenient for both the airport and the city”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyerLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights with our two teenagers. It was a return visit for us although the first time as a paying customer as an airline had picked up the tab last time when we were diverted. It's a decent hotel with reasonable rooms, good service and a nice gym and pool (which I enjoyed using). The hotel honoured our request for connecting rooms although we did have to wait a while for them. It's not a Four Season or Ritz Carlton but those chains don't do airport hotels and it's wonderful to tumble out of bed and stack up the luggage on the trolley (which we had kept since arrival. At $4 per trolley and no refunds when you return them, you want to hold onto them!). We didn't really eat at the hotel as there are many great restaurants to visit in Boston. We would highly recommend staying the night at the hotel before a day flight back to Europe

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for stop over”
Reviews.Author: bluenosegirl06
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze and the employee (Joshua) was one of the most upbeat, friendly hotel employees I have met to date. Our room was clean, comfortable and our 3 year old loved the view of the planes. In the morning before our flight, we took the hotel shuttle to the water taxi wharf and spend a lovely morning at Quincy Market before returning to our hotel to check out and catch our flight. Would defintely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend as a place to stay prior to early morning flight.”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandTraveler09
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our 18 month old and stayed here prior to our early morning flight. We loved that we could see the planes! Also, the room service and food was excellent. The bell hop service was prompt, polite (even at 4:30 in the morning!), and very helpful. When we called for a crib to be brought to the room, it came right away. The room itself was okay, the bathroom needed a little work on the cleaning end, but overall the room was great for what we used it for.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended. Close to airport and perfect for sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: smonti
Reviews.Content: Traveling solo. Conference got out Friday afternoon and I had to fly home Saturday evening. Got a ride with some others flying out and stayed at Hilton Airport. Hotel was perfect. Got early checkin. Room was awesome. Hilton shuttle runs every 15 minutes and drops you at train station where blue line will take you to downtown Boston in 5 minutes for $1.70. Train is fast and safe. Aquarium station is right in the middle of things - Trolley Tours, Legal Sea Foods, North End, Aquarium, etc.. Went into Boston Friday afternoon and most of Saturday. Hilton held my bags on Saturday and got me to my terminal even though I had checked out earlier. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drichrx
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively new, upscale hotel and one of the better Hilton properties, both aesthetically and service-wise. The rooms are large, modern, clean, and the public areas of the hotel are great. The hotel is within walking distance (by skybridges) from the terminals at Logan Airport, making this a great place to stay before an early morning flight. The food at Connolly's Public House (the restaurant in the hotel) is very good for hotel food, albeit a bit pricey. The pork chop was tender and prepared perfectly as were the buttered brussel sprouts. The pumpkin rissotto was flavorful, and the house salad with tender baby greens and a wonderful balsamic vinagarette dressing.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bookworm426
Reviews.Content: For the past five or six years, I have gone to Boston for an annual conference. The first year, I went with a co-worker who made our reservations here. Since then I have traveled alone, but always choose this hotel. The rooms are clean and spacious, and the staff (check-in, concierge, restaurant, gift shop, and housekeeping) is always very helpful. This year I noticed that the Hilton website offered a new rate - if you agree to pay in full in advance, you get a discounted rate. And if a deluxe room is available when you check in, they upgrade you for a very nominal fee ($9/night). I ended up with a large, corner room with a view overlooking the harbor with the city on the other side for about half of what my colleagues were paying at other hotels. The surprising element about this Hilton is that I have never heard an airplane - even though it's right on airport property. And although you're not right in downtown Boston (sometimes that's a good thing), you can cross a pedestrian walkway to the airport and catch the T into the city for $2. Great deal, great place, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a convenient airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: mervie357
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after arriving in Boston from an international flight and, needing to catch a morning domestic flight, thought we'd stay by the airport. This is a great hotel connected to the airport with a skybridge; it took us just 10 minutes to walk to the hotel. The hotel is extremely clean and check-in and check-out were easy and uneventful. They also provide a complimentary shuttle to the terminals, in case you don't want to walk to the terminal that it's connected to or you're in a different terminal. Also, we didn't hear any of the airplane noise in our room that you might expect from an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LadyTripTaker
Reviews.Content: Living in Massachusetts, I've stayed a many Boston hotels for business over the years. I wasn't expecting too much from an "Airport" hotel, but this was fantastic. Stayed on the 7th floor. wonderful room. Great furnishings (desk, bureau, chaise), great TV, and wonderfully comfortable king size bed. Clean bathroom and plenty of light (dim bathrooms are a pet peeve of mine). Plenty of lamps in the main rooms also. No airport noise. I stayed a couple of nights for business but also saw a stay and park package on their website (stay one night and park for 3 or 7) for a great price. I'll definately stay here again, perhaps before a family trip (since I bragged about taking an extremely great, hot, powerful shower to my husband) and this would be a great kick off to a vacation. Staying here instead of fighting the southeast expressway morning traffic for an early flight. One of the top Hilton's I've ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here night before every flight.. great service nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: auwareagel
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great service, the staff is excellent and makes you feel like you are VIP every time you step foot in the hotel. The rooms are nice, the view of the airport, boston harbor or city is awesome.. Beds are like floating on air.. perfect place to stay before or after long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellingSara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton hotel because we only were in Boston for 1 night and thought it would easier than staying in the center. The hotel was very good, clean and what you would expect from Hilton. The location is very good and its very easy to get to the terminals and the center, because they have a free shuttle that takes you to either. Would recommend this hotel to people who are wanting to explore Boston and only have 1 night to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but eating options are WAY overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: AirFairy
Reviews.Content: I have to stay at this hotel when in Boston for work, so I come here frequently. It is connected to the airport and if there is a shuttle provided from your terminal to the hotel I am not aware of it as we always walk through the airport or through the parking garage to get to the hotel. The hotel is a nice size and has a nice workout facility. But what I can't STAND is the overpriced eating options. I stay at a LOT of hotels, but this one doesn't provide a single meal (breakfast, lunch, or dinner) option for under $10. I had a burger in the bar during one stay, it was $16. That was with a 20% discount! Room service charges the 15% service fee as expected, but then there is an ADDITIONAL 3% administrative fee AND $3.50 room service charge. Continental breakfast will run you $20, that's for a muffin/pastry choice, juice option and coffee/tea option?!? What really bothered me on my stay here last night was 1) the toilet paper dispenser is in an inconvenient location and then, it didn't spin! You try to pull some, and it just tore because the roll stayed still. I had to wrestle the roll of the spinner and just spin it in my hands to use it. The facial tissue dispenser had 3 white tissues before they turned orange to let me know they were all gone. Great! Especially when you're coming down with a cold. Why they can't put a full one in during housekeeping cleaning time makes no sense, or keep a spare in the bathroom like some hotels do with the toilet paper rolls. I also couldn't fall asleep for 3 hours. If you're a side sleeper, you will not like the pillows at all! I also had to unplug that alarm clock, cause that orange glow wasn't making things any easier. This of course was after the 20 minutes we lost downstairs at the front desk checking in because they couldn't find my companies' reservation for our rooms. Unless your company covers your room AND meal charges at this hotel, I wouldn't stay here at all.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT - Nice Hotel, Clean, Great Logan Location”
Reviews.Author: snow_beach
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Boston Logan Airport Hotel the night before an early am flight to St Thomas. I stayed with my mother and a friend....we were all flying out together for a trip to St John. The hotel could not have been nicer. Perfect spot to stay to get flights out of Logan. It was clean, quiet, friendly staff and reasonable. I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “loved it, but felt nickeled and dimed”
Reviews.Author: bluejey
Reviews.Content: We stayed a night because we had an early flight from Logan the next morning. I have almost nothing but nice things to say about this establishment; however, it is ludicrous that the room cost $200 for the night and I was expected to pay for wireless internet service in my room? C'mon, if I pay $50 to stay at an Econolodge, the wireless internet is included. Give me a break.

Reviews.Title: “The Winner at the Airport”
Reviews.Author: Tellurian
Reviews.Content: Within a week's time I had two flight cancellations that left me overnight in Boston. The first time was with my husband on our dime and we "won" the Hyatt Harborside on Priceline. The second time I was solo and the airline put me up at the Hilton. We have both stayed at both hotels in the past and found them to be pretty much on par. The water view rooms at the Hyatt have more wow factor, while the Hilton has the advantage of being connected to the airport via a skybridge. You can easily walk to or from the airport instead of taking the free shuttle. This time around I had to declare the Hilton the winning hotel at the airport because it has superior soundproofing between rooms. Staff was warm, welcoming and efficient. My room was nicely furnished, comfortable and well-equipt. For an airport overnight, a quiet room is key for me and the Hilton delivered. If peace is your priority, choose the Hilton at Logan.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay if flying out of Logan”
Reviews.Author: shelleevee
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice in the past month and have thoroughly enjoyed myself. Check-in, both times, was very friendly and prompt. Bellman quickly grabbed our bags and brought them to our room. Very clean and comfortable. Had dinner in the pub one evening, it was okay...drinks were expensive. We were given coupons to the breakfast but did not use them though the gesture was much appreciated. Cabs wait out front to take guests in to the city and there is also a shuttle, but I am not sure where it goes, probably over to departures. Rooms had views of the airport and we experienced no noise from the planes. Had a great night sleep, although I don't think the king bed is a real king, I have one at home and noticed a considerable difference. My only issue with the hotel is the internet charges - it is $18.00 (not $25.00). Get it free at a Super Eight for goodness sake. Both my husband and I had to work and we were EACH charged that amount. Ridiculous. Parking is also steep but it's at the airport, so expected. $35.00, I think. I do not have low expectations, have traveled considerably and have no issues recommending this property to other travelers. Not the best location choice if your plan is to sight-see, but for flying out? Top-notch for a Boston hotel under $200 (and I have stayed at several Boston properties including the Marriott Longwharf, Intercontinental, Omni Parker House, & Fairmont Copley...to name a few). :-)

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, unfriendly and expensive.”
Reviews.Author: examino
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is standard fare for a large chain, airport hotel, but being predictably average does not deserve a good review. The hotel is full of business travellers and early flyers with low expectations and it shows with poor attentIon to detail. Firstly, DO NOT book a room with two doubles expecting a bed that two could sleep in - you will find two 3.5 foot beds ("double" what....children?). Also, having travelled to 73 countries and to the U.S. For 20 years, I still find the excessive charges for services offensive. Room service for example will be loaded with a 15% service charge, 3% admin charge, and $3.50 room service charge,plus tax, plus tip - if you're on your own and want a simple $14 avocado sandwich, that'll be 30 bucks please. Broadband at any reasonable speed is $25 a pop - daylight robbery in this day and age, and designed to relieve companies of their staff's expense budget. Staff are lacklustre, mostly disinterested and unwelcoming on the whole. On the positive side, it has a gym, is well located and well insulated plane noise, but that won't stop you being woken from inconsiderate guests slamming their doors are they leave for their 6am flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with cool views of the Airport”
Reviews.Author: miamijoe
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a great hotel. One night stay in January 2011. Nice to accomodate the request for a good view of the airport. Previous reviews are accurate in that being so close to the planes, yet the noise is not there. I'd also like to commend the doorman and shuttle drivers who were stellar. Great room and I really like those beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for early flights”
Reviews.Author: Austintravelguy
Reviews.Content: When I have to stay over in Boston and need to fly out early this is my choice. The hotel is right at the airport and you can walk the skybridge to airport. Joshua at the front desk has been there for years and is always a great help. Breakfast even on Sunday is open at 5:30. Rooms are great, try for a harbor view, very nice. The restaurant is Boston expensive, but there a lot of options to call for delivery. Try the Vermonter sandwich at Doughs Pizza. Awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanessinha
Reviews.Content: Pretty Comfortable room with an excellent view. The complimentary shuttle to the airport really does run every 20 minutes, but you can go walking through the skybridge to the airport, if you want. The staff are very pleasant and the lobby is really beautiful. There's a pub in the hotel with good food and drink, full of locals

Reviews.Title: “Bad service and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: catarinasj
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Logan Airport Hotel due to my late international flight arrival. The shuttle arrived at the airport and after a flight of more then 10 hours and being exhausted the driver barely helps me with my heavy luggage and keeps on mocking me until I get out of the bus because of the bag weight. Upon I arrival I went up to the bedroom to find a dirty use toilet with pubic hairs on it.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious & Clean Rooms, Professional & Curteous Staff”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoCharley
Reviews.Content: Perfect for an overnight stay to catch an early flight out of Logan Airport.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: JSOCH
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton Boston Logan Airport and it was fantastic! The entire stay was perfect and I can not say enough about the staff at the hotel. They are just wonderful, especially at the Bell Desk. The kids had a nice swim in the pool, then a great dinner in Connolly's and we all enjoyed a great night sleep. You forget hat you are at an airport until you look out the window!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good with a few recommendations”
Reviews.Author: racimo
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through Priceline for $100, high but it was very last minute. We were upgraded as Hilton Honors members at no additional charge. We had a comfortable corner room with a great view of Boston and the airport, no noise! The hotel needs to be mindful of all the garbage and room service trays left along the hallway from afternoon to next day, it was smelly and an eyesore. There was also a wedding at the hotel and the ceremony set up was in the middle of the lobby which was annoying the rest of the guests who were not part of the wedding. There has to be a better place for a ceremony. There was a time that guests were asked to go back up the elevator to their floors while the ceremony got underway. In our case, it made us be late for our dinner in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NidMik
Reviews.Content: The room was great with fabulous views of the airport adn yet soundless. The cafe had few selections only but the qulaity of the food was good. Room service was impressive as well. very little to complain about and quite a lot to say in the positive aspects.

Reviews.Title: “A solid airport hotel--with a nautical Greek theme!”
Reviews.Author: etapley
Reviews.Content: I stayed with friends who were on their way home to the South. They had to wake up very early in the morning, but my girlfriend and I were able to secure late check-out (1pm!). Very generous, but the staff informed us that Thanksgiving and Christmas are their slowest weeks (read: deals!). Usually they average around 90% occupancy. The rooms are very comfortable and the room cleaning crew seems really great, not bothering us once before our late check-out and cheerily greeting us as we walked around the hotel. Brunch is bit pricy (~$23), but the staff there makes sure we got bang for our buck, as they brought our to-go containers without even being asked. We piled in extra blueberry muffins and fresh fruit and were on our way. They have no convenience store that is open late attached to the airport (proving to be inconvenient when we needed snacks or...whatever), but there is a 24/7 gas station located 2 minutes away. If you don't have your own transportation, the hotel shuttle driver will gladly give you a ride. The in-house restaurant ("The Publik (sic) House") is not bad and offers a very nice S.O.B. burger, complete with chimichurri and guac) All in all, a pretty nice place, though a tad pricy if you don't get a discount through a company, which we luckily had.

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice”
Reviews.Author: RoamingTheGlobe
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel by American Airlines after my flight out of Boston was cancelled. I can't comment on the value for money of the room in this case. I have never stayed at a Hilton and likely never will again, even on someone else's dime, because anything you do have to pay for is ridiculously overpriced. For example, I paid $15 for a hummus wrap (with tip and tax) at the Publik House restaurant on the first night because I didn't want to go into the city and search for food or eat at the airport's limited offerings. Internet was $5 for 1 hour or $10 for 24 hours in your room, but there are computers to use free of charge in the lobby. There is also free wifi at the airport. I was not happy with the level of cleanliness in my room - I am convinced that someone started to clean and did not finish. There was hair in the bathtub and a used washcloth on the shower curtain when I pulled it closed. I tried to call housekeeping to request they do a better job the next day, but got transferred 6 times before I finally gave up. In the end, the bathroom was cleaner the next day, but the floor was never vacuumed. I know this because someone else's fingernail clippings were all over the floor from the time I arrived to the time I left. The free shuttle is very convenient and will also take you to the T station. You need a cell phone and the phone number on the key card to get a ride back or go to the airport on the regular airport shuttle to use the courtesy phones to call the Hilton. The front desk staff and concierge were excellent - very professional and friendly. A previous guest had left a weekly pass for the T that still had several days on it, so I was able to use that to visit the city for free and still leave it for someone else. The beds are comfortable, but the heating was blowing cold air and my sinuses were insanely irritated after sleeping with the "heater" on the first night. Not terrible, but I've stayed in backpacker hostels that were cleaner and more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: TXBusinessTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night before my flight out the next morning and it was excellent! I was able to check in early around 2pm and a room was ready for me. I requested a view of the airport and that was not a problem. As a Hilton Diamond member I was upgraded to the Executive floor and it was very quiet and nice. The rooms aren't super special, typical Hilton, but very clean and comfortable. There are no restaurants around the property so you're pretty much stuck with the Pub downstairs. Although it was expensive, the pizza was outstanding! Make sure you go early because it fills up by 6:30. Overall an excellent stay and I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location ... and nice service”
Reviews.Author: LXM
Reviews.Content: Sure it's pricey, but the convenience to the airport can't be beat. We stayed there so we could easily make an early morning flight. All staff we encountered were delightful, even the waiter who forgot to bring my iced tea in the pub (forgot twice, got it on third request)... I can't complain because he was so darn charming and friendly. Food is good in the pub, too. On checkin, the front desk staffer took the initiative to change our rooms to two adjoining, so we could be near our family members traveling with us. We took their free shuttle to the airport terminal in the morning... so we were at our terminal within 10 minutes. Just one small critique: There was a room service cart with leftover food in our corridor from the time we checked in around 6 pm until we left around 6 am. It made the whole corridor smell like ketchup, plus being a safety hazard in case of fire or power outage. Someone needs to check more often to pick up the carts.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: BMBeer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night of â€œconvenienceâ€� when arriving in Boston rather than picking our hire car up immediately and were really pleased with the quality of accommodation. The fact that it literally took five minutes to walk to the hotel from terminal E was a real bonus! Our room was spacious, very clean and had a fantastic view of the sunset over the Boston skyline. Staff were friendly and helpful and it was really useful that they let us keep the airport trolley in our room overnight! Breakfast is quite expensive and we witnessed the staff repeatedly pressurising guests into ordering the buffet and not menu items, but the food was of a good standard. We would stay here again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient - but at a cost”
Reviews.Author: Mighty-Red
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night after flying-in. Exceptionally easy walk from Terminal E and a simple check-in saw me in the room within 45 minutes of landing, even allowing for baggage reclaim & immigration. Room was all it needed to be and was exceptionally quiet with a comfortable bed. Didn't use the restaurant before retiring but did have breakfast which was expensive (around $24) and only marginally above average quality. However, this hotel is all about the convenient location. You cannot get closer to the airport and all in all it's pretty good. As long as you can accept that you pay top dollar for such a location then there are no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hilton service but need to sort out their cleaning”
Reviews.Author: NG-Traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice at either end of a New England tour. Very convenient as attached to terminals A and E by a footbridge. This is clearly a conference venue as there were loads of conference rooms on the walk into the hotel. On the first and second visit, a used room service tray was on the carpet outside a room around 9pm with remnants of half-eaten food on it. The trays were still there at 8am/9am the next morning. Do they never check the corridors or remove food waste?

Reviews.Title: “Great way to start a trip”
Reviews.Author: Dr-Jill-from-NH
Reviews.Content: I live an hour's drive from Boston's Logan Airport (make that two hours with traffic). I try to take this fact into account when making airline reservations for personal trips. But inevitably, I make reservations 10 months in advance to leave at 11:00 a.m. and the airline deletes my flight and rebooks me and my long-suffering spouse for 7:45 a.m. Since getting up at 4:45 a.m. is never my first choice for starting a leisurely vacation, I fire up the computer and make a reservation at the Logan Airport Hilton the night before we leave. This hotel does a good job of maintaining Hilton quality standards for cleanliness and service. As in all the airport Hiltons that I've patronized, the rooms are small but well-appointed. The soundproofing is excellent such that I've always had a good night's sleep. This Hilton has an HHonors lounge with a wonderful view of Boston and comfortable seating. The food and drink offerings are not as generous as some HHonors lounges, but it is still possible to consume a serious number of calories! We used the indoor swimming pool once, but I found it awkward to walk through the lobby in my swimming attire (the only way to get to the pool). This placement was not the greatest design decision the architects ever made. While the hotel does has a shuttle to the airport, it is possible to walk to at least Terminal C via some enclosed walkways and then through one of the central parking garages. After more than half a dozen stays, we have "cracked the code" and walk each time to our concourse. We are very comfortable at this hotel and find it's a good way to start a trip the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “What comfort and convenience!”
Reviews.Author: Samlud
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight here on our way back from Norway. The beds were so comfortable, the rooms very spacious, the staff friendly and helpful. We were exhausted, and it was great to settle into such great beds after sleeping on much less comfortable ones in Norway. It was wonderful to roll out of bed and get to our airport gates the next morning with such ease. A bit expensive, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Just cannot believe that at $300 a night...”
Reviews.Author: Martino52
Reviews.Content: Just cannot believe that at $300 a night this hotel charges exorbitant rates for WiFi. In this day an age, in a business hotel, WiFi should be included. It is listed as an amenity in the description along with the hairdryer, but you don't pay extra for that. No matter how the hotel is otherwise, the charge for WiFi leaves a very bad taste. What else are they ripping you off for?

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel to Begin a New England Fall Trip”
Reviews.Author: michbren
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our one night stay here. The hotel is walking distance from Logan. It is a beautiful, modern, clean hotel. Our room was perfect for our needs and we found the staff to be accomodating. My single major complaint was the only restaurant open for dinner - Connollys Public. The very overpriced food was almost inedible!! After a long flight from the west we were very hungry and were more or less stuck there. I am surprised at Hilton for allowing such a restaurant in one of their hotels.

Reviews.Title: “We chose this hotel as we had an early...”
Reviews.Author: AymanN
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we had an early flight out if Boston Logan airport the next morning. Understandably we guessed that's why it was a lot more expensive than other hotels. Overall it's a nice large hotel. Rooms are clean and roomy. My main criticism is that the hotel is definitely not value for money. A little example is that they charge for wifi. Most hotels now offer this as free and considering the cost of staying at the Hilton, I was surprised that they charged. And the amount is prohibitive. I guess mainly business people are targeted. Staff also were not that friendly. Definitely a tip culture at the hotel. Everywhere else in new England this was present but subtle. At the Hilton it felt like being surrounded by scavengers! We overheard the complimentary shuttle bus driver complain to his colleague that he hadn't been tipped by some passengers. Even the free shuttle bus driver wants a tip for a journey he has to do anyway. The concierge seemed put out that we were asking for directions to the subway. Only 1 check in attendant and a queue of people wanting to check in. Who knows maybe we caught them on a bad day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect after a long flight.”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghAnna
Reviews.Content: This hotel can be accessed directly from the airport terminal. One of our party was in a wheelchair and this made the transition from airport to hotel very easy. The room was large, clean,quiet and very comfortable. Breakfast was delicous- a mix of healthy and filling. The service was friendly and helpful. We picked up our car the next day from the airport depot and drove to Cape Cod. We didn't therefore have to drive through Boston which would have been a bit daunting. For easy access and an upmarket hotel, we can recommend this one

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Short Stay in Boston via Airport”
Reviews.Author: Loiners10
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for a 1 night/2 day stay in Boston while en route back to the UK via Logan airport. Only a 10 min/$20 taxi ride into the centre of Boston. I could not fault the hotel at all. The rooms were modern and clean, the gym/leisure facilities were great and service by reception and concierge was faultless. Great for accessing the airport as you can walk directly from the hotel to the departure check in. Despite it not being in the centre of Boston I would still stop here again on a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for airport swift connections to city”
Reviews.Author: cymro98
Reviews.Content: Travelling with my teenage daughter, we based ourselves here for 2 nights as were flying in and out of Logan as part of a US tour with a tight schedule.We were able to efficiently check in/out and coordianted with our flight times to allow us good use of time for sightseeing. Shuttle works well with good links to T station and terminals and facilitates swift access to Boston centre (Silver line also). 20 minutes after shutting our room door we were in the city. Room gave us impressive view of city skyline and met our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for a overnight rest”
Reviews.Author: Cindy25171
Reviews.Content: The Logan Hilton is a good hotle when you need to get a rest after arriving from Europe in the evening and going onwards the morning after. We have used it few times and it is always solid, good rooms, nice restaurants and very convenient for the short stopovers. Easy hotle to recommend if you just need to get some rest.

Reviews.Title: “good choice for early flights”
Reviews.Author: sugarlandmom
Reviews.Content: Our extended family of eight stayed in two rooms for one night before our 720am flight. Check-in is quick, and the doorman/bellhops were very helpful while we unloaded our rental SUV, dropped off our luggage in our room, and quickly changed our clothes for dinner out (as others have noted, there are no outside restaurants near-by). Rooms are spacious & comfortable, with a nice bathroom...but nothing special. We slept fine, no airport or traffic noise. There is a free airport shuttle every 20 minutes-it will fill up during the "early-morning rush' so give yourself plenty of time. We would stay here again for an early flight, but don't recommend this if you want to explore the town for more than a day... we loved the Marriott Custom house, in the heart of the Freedom trail-see my review for full details.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: BeakerTX
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way out of the north east to make sure we were near the airport for a flight the following morning. Quiet and clean standard Hilton room. The only problems are lack of any neighboring restaurants (fixed by a quick cab ride) and poor or lacking bell hop services.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alaskaflyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before flying back to Alaska. Really liked the convenience of walking directly to terminal A for check-in at the Alaska Airlines counter. Restaurant served really great sandwiches as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great staff.”
Reviews.Author: rgibz
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed here four times while traveling through Boston and have always had very pleasant experiences. This hotel is one the nicest, cleanest most professionally run that I have ever stayed in. Plus it's consistent. We have stayed a total of 4 times and have never had a bad experience. The only caveat is that the hotel pub is quite expensive, but hey, most hotel restaurants are. The convenience, cleanliness and professionalism of the staff cannot be beat. We love this hotel and will keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great for early flights out of Logan airport”
Reviews.Author: ark6
Reviews.Content: We had a 6am flight from Logan, so to avoid waking up at 2 & driving from Rhode Island up the I-95 & 93 into Boston, we stayed at the Logan Airport Hilton. It's a little pricier than I usually pay for a room ($220), but well worth it. I shaved 1 day off the car rental. Dropped the wife & daughters off at the Hilton before returning the rental car. Called for the Hilton shuttle bus, which arrived within 10 minutes - very easy & quick. We had a very nice room on the 7th floor, with a great view of the Boston skyline. There was even a fireworks display to watch. We didn't use the dinning at the hotel, because the bell hop told my wife about a good pizza place that delivered to the hotel. The pizza & greek salad was wonderful. The fitness center was about the largest that I had seen at a hotel. My daughter used one of the dozen treadmills for her evening run. There was a nice indoor pool. The best part of the stay, and the reason that I chose the Hilton was the 7 minute walk from our room to Terminal A, which is where our Delta gate was located. 2 skywalks take you right to the security check-in for terminal A. I'll be using the Logan Airport Hilton for future Boston flights, because I dislike driving on I-93 & I-95 into Boston from the south.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Aardvarksheep
Reviews.Content: Booked in for one night prior to flight back to the UK. Very pleasant room with tea & coffee maker and a silent air conditioning unit (a first for this trip!). Very helpful staff, drop off & pick up service from the local T station meant we could spend a few more hours in Boston on our last evening. We had an early flight the next day so didn't have breakfast, but were able to walk across the skyway to Terminal E which was a great bonus (although it was a little longer than I'd hoped with very heavy baggage....).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: bhayes
Reviews.Content: Booking was not easy, Hilton showed availability on their website using Hilton Honors points, but then the site wouldn't allow me to book it. Had to call first their reservations, who said the site was wrong, there were no rooms available using points, and they couldn't book a room for me that way, despite the fact that they themselves could use the internet and pull up the same information I kept pulling up. I then called their tech desk, who also saw that the rooms were advertised using points on their own website but could not be booked. The wonderful man at their tech desk called the hotel directly and booked the room with them, he agreed with me that if their website showed a room available they should honor that commitment. Once at the hotel the staff was great, from the shuttle service to the front desk, the concierge, to the wait staff. Their shuttle will pick you up at the airport if you aren't at the terminal near them, and will drop you off and pick you up at the subway line and the ferry docks that connect you quickly and easily right into Boston. Our room was spotlessly clean and comfortable, and very quiet even though you're right at the terminal. We'd just flown 13 hours and were so happy to check in early, take a shower and then take the subway just 2 stops downtown and wander around and have a bite to eat before coming back for an early evening to try to reset our bodies to east coast time. We only ate breakfast here, we both had the buffet, I just wanted oatmeal, fruit and coffee, by the time you order those ala carte you may as well do the buffet, so then of course I had to have some smoked salmon with all of the garnishes as well....We've stayed here once before and would stay again, the ease for travel into the city is great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property but not so nice service”
Reviews.Author: jmort123
Reviews.Content: It's a Hilton like any other from a decor and amenities point of view, and it is handy if you want to walk in from terminal A. The housekeeping staff here is exceptional, and the staff at the restaurants are great as well. The wireless internet speed is terrible, and personally I don't think it's right to shut down room service at midnight at a full service hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to launch a trip in New England.”
Reviews.Author: InfrequentFlyer247
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Hilton several times after flying from the West Coast. It is a great place to decompress after a long flight. The staff are great, the rooms are clean and the food pretty decent. We stay on the Executive Levels when we can so we can access the Executive Lounge. The concierge service and snacks at the lounge are great. The fitness facility and pool are nice. The grounds are well manicured and pleasant - especially for being at an airport! Transportation to and from the hotel is easy due to their free shuttle service. Overall, a very pleasant place to stop over.

Reviews.Title: “totally did not feel like an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosimmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and our kids did not want to leave. they loved the rooms. They loved that we had a view of the airport and river but we never heard any plane noise. It was so quiet. The staff was great. The buffet breakfast was good and we all had a nice time. The bellman in the front was so nice. He was there when we checked in at 8:30 in the evening and then again in the morning. I think he might need some time off. But he totally helped us with any questions we had.

Reviews.Title: “Did not seem like an "airport hotel"”
Reviews.Author: JP&mom
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been often reviewed -- accurately. I spent two nights with my daughter. It was her choice to stay at the airport because she had 2 huge suitcases + pillow, etc. (for summer school in VT) and did not want to haul her stuff into the City. It was a good choice. Getting into the City is (as others have written) easy enough: hotel shuttle to T stop and a short T ride to (wherever). We never waited more than a few minutes for the shuttle. We had a room with a great view of the City. The room was very comfortable (although lacking in cushy beds). The hotel bar/restaurant has (I suspect) recently been remodeled (the photo in the elevator is different from the actual place). If I were a solo business traveler, I would give it very high marks -- lots of space at the bar and then a second laptop friendly bar running the length of the bar. Starbuck is available in the lobby. One caveat: it is a long walk (almost, but not quite, a mile, I would guess) from Terminal E to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Right at the airport, very convenient”
Reviews.Author: G8R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is connected to the airport parking garage and then to two terminals, so no need to wait for a shuttle. The hotel operates shuttle buses on a schedule, and you will need to take the shuttle to get to the subway station. When returning, we had to take the airport shuttle bus to Terminal A and then walk back to the hotel via the pedestrian bridge. But still very convenient. Our room was large, but we were on the side overlooking commercial buildings and roads. On the other side, though, was a fantastic view of Boston and the harbor. The only criticism I have is that there was an empty tissue dispenser, but a box of tissue was brought right up when I called. Finally, I was impressed by the nightlight under the vanity in the bathroom. Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “A few snags, but very convenient to Logan”
Reviews.Author: EfficientTraveler
Reviews.Content: Connected directly to Terminal A via walkway...great as a Continental frequent flier for that early morning flight out. Unfortunately, the executive club was closed on Friday nite. The worst thing was the running toilet. It had a leak in the flapper and would run for a few seconds every few minutes. I called the operator. No one showed up for an hour. I went down to the front desk; they sent up someone who tinkered for a few minutes and said it was fixed. I knew it was a bad flapper, but he didn't fix it. I had to call again in a few minutes; they sent up someone again very quickly who changed out the flapper. The maintenance man then gave me a coupon for a free movie for the inconvenience. I thought that was a great gesture. Unfortunately, it was very pricey...$15 for internet; $17 for a hamburger, and $6.50 for a bottle of beer. They get you for the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel & the Views (and didn't want to leave)”
Reviews.Author: lisajanetx
Reviews.Content: I had such an incredible stay at the Hilton Boston Logan Airport Hotel that I'm not exactly sure where I should begin. My family and I were treated as valued guests from the moment Souad greeted us at the reception desk until Shirley checked us out and inquired about the stay. I had just earned my Hilton Diamond status so was upgraded to an incredible room. The views were nothing short of magnificant. We had views of both Boston Harbor and the airport. As we are airport and airplane aficionados, we found ourselves easily entranced by the views. We stayed up for hours eyeing takeoffs and landings as well as enjoying the sunset views of the harbor and downtown. If you enjoy great views, this is definitely the hotel for you - whether or not you plan to use the airport. I can think of no better location in Boston for views of the city and harbor. The hotel is easily accessible to downtown via the "T" (1 or 2 stops from hotel to downtown). It is also attached to airport terminal walkways. This allowed us to casually stroll over to the terminal when we were ready to board our flight. The rooms were attractively furnished in modern style and all the top notch amenities one expects from a Hilton were available. The beds were amazingly comfortable - I slept like a baby. There were also plenty of mirrors scattered throughout the room which I appreciated. I also noticed padded trays which I believe were meant to be used for laptop computers (we were on vacation so left ours at home). The flat screen TV worked beautifully and more than enough channels were available for viewing. I was upgraded to the Executive Lounge and enjoyed the views from there as well. We did not dine in the restaurant so I can't comment about it, although we received a treat from room service (provided by Leon who graciously served us) which was delicious. We also enjoyed the turn down service provided by one of the housekeepers whose name I regret to say I've forgotten as she was terrific as well. When we departed the next morning, we passed by a housekeeper who came out of the room she was cleaning to greet us and ask if we had an enjoyable stay. Throughout our visit we received smiles and greetings from all staff we encountered. We felt pampered throughout the stay and can't wait to return. Whenever we make future plans to stay in Boston, we will stay nowhere else but the Hilton Boston Logan Airport. We have stayed at many hotels throughout the western world (and a few in Eastern Europe), and this was the best and most memorable experience we've ever had. We did not want to check out and are still talking about the hotel. Our stay at the Hilton Boston Logan Airport was the highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel. I really liked the hotel's style. Without being over-the-top or trendy, every part of the hotel (lobby/hallways/rooms) felt modern and stylish with a subdued, but not dull, color scheme. The lobby of the hotel is HUGE and filled with light. I really appreciated this, as it gave me the opportunity to find a place to work that was public but not overly crowded. I was able to take several phone calls in the lobby and not be disturbing to people. The fitness center is great -- it's on the first floor, brightly lit (with windows -- so much better than the basement) and had a good selection of equipment, both cardiovascular and weights. It is also open 24 hours. My room was very comfortable and clean. The hotel's location is great. It is connected to a couple of the terminals at Logan, including the Delta terminal (where my early morning flight was). It was delightful to just be able to cross a bridge and be in the terminal. Other terminals would require that you take a shuttle, but they appeared to leave in a timely fashion. Service was excellent. I was planning to park a car before and return it the next morning before my flight. So, I parked at check-in and told the clerk I'd be self-parking. When I discovered that the hotel was connected to my terminal, I made the decision to return my car that evening. Even though I'd been parked for 30 minutes, the clerk at the desk and the clerk working the exit of the parking lot waived all parking charges. Then, the shuttle picked me up at the Hertz location and brought me back to the hotel! I found all of the staff to be welcoming and helpful. Although some of the ammenities within the hotel (room service, etc.) were on the pricier side, I thought the room rate was very reasonable, particularly considering the quality of the facility, proximity to Logan, and service. Highly recommended! Looking forward to my return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel. A bit expensive...”
Reviews.Author: Fippo
Reviews.Content: Excellent airport hotel. A bit expensive but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “You be the Judge!”
Reviews.Author: DCFed
Reviews.Content: After a long day/night I returned to my hotel, and of course after walking 15 minutes to the end of the hall, the key of course does not work, I then have to walk all the way back at 2AM and get a new key, I am already tired and think itâ€™s a bit ridiculous that the key does not work, so to add insult to injury they question me like some homeless person on the street and ask for my ID, I said what if I left it in the room? The manager THEN TELLS ME THAT HE WILL CALL THE POLICE TO HAVE ME REMOVED! Iâ€™m sorry but Having been a Police Officer for over 10 years myself and now a Fed Govâ€™t employee, this is just wrong. It gets better, my co worker whom still is not back to the hotel from a meeting, returns later and of course his key doesnâ€™t work and they will not let him in the room because his name is not on the room paperwork, so he has to stay with another co worker in another room. I wrote to Hilton, Oh and BTW I am a Hilton Honors member! This is the reply: Dear Mr. X, We have received the comments from your stay in March 27th at the Hilton Boston Logan Airport through our Guest Assistance Department. We regret the incident that you described with our Front Desk as this is certainly not the service we pride and provide here at the Hilton Boston Logan Airport. It is understandable that you were upset due to the inconvenience of your room key not working and for that we apologize. Please know that the practice of verifying identity is a requirement that has the sole purpose of protecting our guests. We will follow up further individually with our staff to be sure the need for empathy and understanding is clearly understood. Thank you for communicating with us and we hope to see you amongst our guests in the future. Best Regards, Michal N. Penek Director of Front Office Operations Hilton Boston Logan Airport _______________________________________ So, I leave it up to you travelers if you think this is how you should be treated.

Reviews.Title: “nice location and rooms but to expensive”
Reviews.Author: swissy21
Reviews.Content: Liked all the aminities; the pool, fitness, etc etc. Rooms not to large but okay. You cna't open a window (I disliked this). Very nice staff but the hotel is really expensive! For 1 breakfast I had to pay 36 usd! That's crazy. Further very good hotel! Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dishmouse
Reviews.Content: We had a one night lay-over in Boston - this hotel was perfect. It had a nice restuarant and was easy to get to from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
