Reviews.Author: shed7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night at the end of a trip to Boston as we had an early flight to LAX the next morning and thought it would be useful to be close by the airport. I didn't have very high expectations but it was actually a great hotel. Very clean, modern design and a fantastic view of Boston from our huge bedroom window. The food in the restaurant was also surprisingly good too. The hop to the airport at 4.30 was very simple too as there is a frequent 24h shuttle bus. I probably wouldn't stay here if I was actually visiting Boston as there are other hotels just as good (e.g. The Lenox where we had spent the previous 2 nights) but was perfect for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “The best airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: cfischer
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and I have stayed there many times. It is very close to the airport terminals and you can either walk or take the free shuttle. If you are coming here for a vacation and want to go the downtown Boston it is NOT your best bet; they used to have a free downtown shuttle, but it was discontinued a while back. We had an early morning departure from Logan and decided to burn some HH points for this stay. Check-in was very quick/efficient and as a HH Gold I was upgraded to the 10th floor with lounge access. The rooms have recently been upgraded and are up the best Hilton standards. One of the best features is the executive lounge on the 10th floor which offers breathtaking views of the Boston skyline along with snacks and drinks. The only complaint would be the expensive alcoholic beverages ... they used to be $6, now they are > $10 and it feels like they are trying to make a serious profit on it. I'd recommend the Logan Hilton to any airport traveler without hesitation, it is in my opinion better than the ES and Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to airport but you'll pay”
Reviews.Author: H0lidayr0ad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently connected to the airport via a second-floor walkway. It's a five-six minute walk to Terminal A. But, the location comes at a price. Internet access is a ridiculous $15/day, coffee is $3 and a draft at the hotel bar is $7. And the prices for in-room dining are best viewed as entertainment only. The room was pleasant enough and the TV featured several channels in HD. My room was odd-numbered and looked out over an airport parking deck, where the rooms across the hall looked our over the harbor. If you need to stay close to the airport, the location can't be beat, but it comes at a cost.

Reviews.Title: “Not that convenient”
Reviews.Author: MWang
Reviews.Content: If you are flying US Airways and think that staying at the Hilton at Logan airport which advertises that it is connected to the airport, think again. The hotel is at the exit of the Logan airport and it is technically close to the airport BUT, if you are a US Air traveller, it is not convenient to WALK to the connecting airport. You are better off taking the shuttle which I ended up doing since the walkways with signs to get to the airport end at the lobby of the garage. Everyone is vague about how to get to the walkways other than point you through the garage. Fortunately, a shuttle was crusiing the garage to pick up passengers so I got a lift. The driver himself admitted that the 'walk' is not really user friendly. Once you get to the terminal via shuttle that leaves you at another garage, it is another hike to get to the actual airline terminal. My opinion is that if you are paying premium (even with the AAA discount, I ended up paying almost 200.00 with tax for one night) , you should be able to just walk over to the airport at your leisure. I am sure you can better a better deal staying at other nearby hotels that has shuttle service directly to the airport. departure terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Anna911
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Honors member but couldn't take advantage of speedy check-in because there was only one person working the front desk and working it very slowly. With only 2 people in front of me I waited for 15 minutes to check-in. Service in the hotel pub was even worse. It is seat yourself and apparently all they want you to do is sit. After 20 minutes absolutely no one had approached me even though I tried to get the attention of the manager and numerous members of the wait staff. When I finally did get to place an order they apparently thought their job was done. They dropped the food and didn't come back until it was time for a bill. I hate to say this but I wonder if it was because I was a solo FEMALE traveler. I noticed that all the men, couples and families that showed up after me received service long before I did and received repeated attention throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel check-in ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: cmorin79
Reviews.Content: I checked in with 3 other guests at 11:15 pm. Staff told me that my booking from Expedia had not come through as it should have therefore they could not release 2 of the 4 rooms I booked. They made us wait 45 minutes before they came up with the brilliant idea of releasing all the rooms and trying to work things out with Expedia overnight.. which they did. When I checked out at 4:30 am, they never even apologized. The service was simply awful, the staff was incompetent and the desire to see the experience from a customer's perspective completely absent!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable... but could be cleaner.”
Reviews.Author: 3GirlsandaBoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our flight to Disney. It seemed to be the most convenient option. Although a bit pricey, we feel it was worth it. The room was very nice, with a view of Boston, and the beds were comfortable. My only reason for giving it 4 stars is because we found a lollipop and candy wrappers on the floor under one of the chairs. If housekeeping had simply moved the little chair when vaccuuming, they would have found these. In the morning, it was SO convenient to just grab our bags and walk through the corridor into the airport to catch our flight. We didn't even have to step foot outside. This was really worth the price of the hotel, and we'd definitely do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Fit Our Needs Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SaNich
Reviews.Content: We had an early flight to catch and did not feel like rushing from home to make it. Found online that this hotel was close and had a free shuttle. I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel. Our room was beautiful, clean, and quiet. We stayed with another couple and they were able to get us adjoining rooms. Had some difficulty with the climate control - it seemed to fluctate dramatically with out touching the thermostat. We had a late dinner at Connolly's. The food was good - but I think a little over priced for pub fair. The wake-up call was on time. When it was time to catch the shuttle, the first one was full - but the second one was only a few minutes behind. That being said, the women got seperated from the men and we ended up taking two shuttles - we arrived within minutes of each other at the terminal. No questions asked, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, service lacking”
Reviews.Author: 1stCircumdedistiMe
Reviews.Content: Great Modern & beautiful hotel and well appointed. Crabtree Evelyn Toilteteries,etc. Hotel has a screen that you can use to check out if your flight is on time. It is connected to a terminal to the airport. Free shuttle to terminals that are not within range. The had awsome christmas decor, a train, santa, the whole nine yeards. However, as with most Hilton hotels, the service was lacking. Ar my room I find a dirty sock from a prior guest. This will never happend at a Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: shortperson
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best hotel located at an airport that I've stayed in. Yes it was large, yes it was a chain, but the rooms were decent sized, comfortable, and quiet. There wasn't a huge choice of eating places for the evening if you were at the hotel, but Connolly's was decent enough. We had to stay an extra night as our flight home was cancelled, but it's easy to get back into Boston from the hotel using the subway. For an early morning flight, the walkway directly into Terminal E was perfect - no taxis, no going outside, just walk to the terminal. The staff were very helpful, especially as our second night hadn't been confirmed when we arrived, but we didn't have to move room which helped. The hotel has all the facilities you would need for a short stay and great views of Boston skyline. Very quiet considering it's at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stop between flights”
Reviews.Author: simon06877
Reviews.Content: We needed an overnight hotel at the airport for a late arrival flight from Europen with and early AM onward connection. A great hotel, short walk from the terminals, great room. Bit pricey, but overall a 4* rating from me.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton charges $15 for wi-fi in your room”
Reviews.Author: Marywho
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe the Hilton at Logan doesn't include wi-fi in the rooms. Oh no, they want to charge you $15 for a 24-hour period. I recently drove across the United States and found wi-fi in every cheap and medium-priced motel we stayed along the way. But check into your fine accomodations at the Hilton Logan and expect them to be digging frantically into your pockets for more of your money. I was outraged.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, courtesy of Continental!”
Reviews.Author: Lubiere
Reviews.Content: After arriving from PBG (2 hours delay), there was yet other delays at BOS due to a thunderstorm system on the east coast. After hours of waiting, our flight to EWR was cancelled due to mechanical problems, which means....free room! Got the BOS Hilton. A nice hotel, with a fast shuttle from the airport. The shuttle allows stops at the Airport T too. The room was nicely decorated, with a king bed, very comfie, 40 in LCD, good amenities and toiletries, good gym and pool (which I didnt use). A very nice stay, for free.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Time”
Reviews.Author: ilovetravling
Reviews.Content: I went to prom at the Hilton Hotel, and it was wonderfully done. The service was excellent. The food wasn't so great. Maybe it's because they were cooking for hundreds of teens, but for a senior prom, I expected MUCH better. The staff were friendly, and the general set-up of the prom was phenomenal. I felt like I was really living the high-schooler's dream of a great prom!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: monaco72
Reviews.Content: Perfect airport hotel. The service was excellent, the rooms were clean and modern and the food was excellent. There is a free shuttle to the Metro which makes getting into town easy and simple.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: andharv
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a really cheap pre-paid deal at the Hilton and it was certainly value for money at the price. The hotel is fairly standard for its class and the rooms are quite nice. Its handy to the airport, you can either walk or get their shuttle. I don't understand why wireless internet is free at some of the more budget orientated members of the Hilton group but they sting you extra for it at the flagship brand. Service was a bit slow with a bus tour causing a lengthy wait at reception. The food at the Irish pub downstairs was also disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Conference PLUS a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: RheaHebert
Reviews.Content: The hotel hosted a conference we attended. It was a nicely appointed hotel; the bed was pretty comfortable and it was quiet. The curtains never quite blocked all the sun however--blackout curtains would be great. We overlooked the airport but had no problem with noise. The hotel food was expensive (as expected) but we found some good options: pizza at Connolly's was very shareable and quite good. Also: under $20! The breakfast buffet at Berkshire's was also good, though pricey ($22 each). We also had to carefully check our check, since things tended to cheap onto food bills! The complimentary shuttle to the T was fantastic--it ran frequently and the drivers were friendly. We were thus convenient to everything via the T blue line. This was my first visit to Boston and I would certainly have no problem staying at the Logan Hilton. It was wonderfully convenient to walk from the plane to the hotel. It's a bit of a hike, but nothing we found worrisome (we are avid pedestrians). I am always surprised when I enjoy a Hilton stay (I tend to prefer B&Bs), but I find it happens regularly. The rate wasn't fantastic ($159/night) but it wasn't awful, either. Overall, a wonderful way to get to know Boston while also attending my conference.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: El-Yuca-Ingles
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before flying out of Boston, after getting a great rate through Hotwire. Easy check in, very friendly desk staff, nice rooms with view over the airport. The hotel shuttle dropped us at the water taxi stop, and picked us up at the subway station when we returned from an afternoon in town. Great health club with sauna and steam; had dinner in the pub, good food and drinks but on the expensive side. Appreciated the computers (plenty of them) with free internet access and printers, which are on the 1st and 2nd floors. Slept great in the very comfortable king bed in my room. Didn't have breakfast as we had an early departure, and were happy to be able to walk through the skybridge directly to our terminal. Overall, a very satisfactory stay.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Logan Airport Hilton”
Reviews.Author: DanboyDanboy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. Check-in was quick, and the staff was very polite and friendly. Lugage and vehicle was attended to quickly. The room was clean and had ample space. The shuttle service was very efficient, as we used it to get to the T and back. I would stay here again if the price was right. We paid $119 through the Hilton site with advance purchase.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Airport”
Reviews.Author: merlinUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night following our flight to Boston. The hotel is ideally situated on the airport, however we wished it was more clearly signed as to how to get to it from within the airport. The reception staff were extremely helpful, the room was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was superb but quite expensive. The free shuttle bus to either the airport terminals or the hire car depots was excellent with the driver extremely courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: wallace404
Reviews.Content: This hotel is always top-notch and is the perfect hotel for someone traveling in and out of Logan Airport. I would even consider staying here even I were not traveling to and from Logan. The hotel is very nice and has one of the best health clubs I have seen in a hotel complete with steam and sauna in the locker rooms. The price is right too. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Airport Travel”
Reviews.Author: lhptraveler
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at this hotel and once again, it was perfect for flying in and out of Logan. It is such a pleasure to get off a flight and walk to your hotel. We only stayed one night and had to be at Boston College the next day so we left our luggage with the bell captain and were able to return later in the day and retrieve it, freshen up and have something to eat in Connolly's Pub rather chance airport dining. Then we enjoyed the walk to our terminal. It is not a bargain hotel, my AAA rate was almost $400. by the time they added all taxes and fees but I figure we saved quite a bit in taxi fares and the fact it was cold and rainy/snowy and not having to lug our suitcases made it worth it. Even my husband finally agreed I had made a good decision in booking it. The rooms are very nice and somewhat "feng shui" and very quiet. The shuttle to the "T" is runs every 15 minutes on schedule and is another bonus.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline60302
Reviews.Content: perfect hotel, perfect room, i loved the bathroom and the huge bed, very useful hotel shuttle from hotel to airport/train station at anytime!!! not noisy at all because of the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A very good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: regalaone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before flying back home the following day. For an airport hotel, this one is very special. The rooms were spacious and the beds very comfortable with the best in bedding and mattress. The bathroom was also spacious and well appointed. The staff was helpful and knowledgeable. You can walk to the airport if your flight is leaving from terminals A or E. The walkway is enclosed so it makes it very easy. My flight left from Terminal C so there is a shuttle that goes to all terminals (and the T station) which runs frequently and I used for my flight. Very quiet for being near the airport. Booked through Hotels.com and got a very good rate. If you need to be near the airport, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: sw94115
Reviews.Content: for an airport hotel it's great for the business traveler that just needs a place to sleep before getting up for an early morning meeting/flight. front desk was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: johnk123
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Hilton Boston Aiport. Easy walk from the terminal. Computers located in the 2nd floor with free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Night to End an Excellent Trip”
Reviews.Author: indriza
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. The bathroom was super large and had a lot of amenities. The only problem was that it was hard to get food. My husband and I got internet for free which was great. They also provided shuttle to the airport so we didnt have to spend money on a taxi. Overall a great experience and would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb accessibilit”
Reviews.Author: rod_hocking
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for its location at Logan Aiport. Not disappointed in anyway, there is a superb all-weather covered walkway from the hotel to the airport, once in the airport proper it is possible to get to any terminal without going outside again. The hotel also proviedes a free pick up bus that will also deliver you to the railewway station The city also provides free transport from the railway station back to the airport where you psick up the free bus again. Makes commuting a breeze. Food/drink was acceptable both in quality and range but fairly expensive.. Rooms were typical Hilton adequate but not opulent. Overall assessment; a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Solid airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2Traveller2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a solid airport hotel. It is nothing fancy, but clean and easy to get in and out of. I've stayed here twice, and the shuttle was prompt, and check-in fast. I was in bed and asleep within 45 minutes of the plane's wheels touching the runway, which is very good in my book. Beds are comfortable enough, and bathrooms are fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very Overpriced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelalot023
Reviews.Content: For a Hilton is was OK, but if a hotel charges that much for a room you would think the internet could at least be included. The woman at the desk asked with a big smile on her face,"Did you bring a laptop on your visit?" "Yes", I replied. "Oh great, internet is available in all the rooms." Then you find out there is an additional charge for the "available" internet. Also the restaurant (Connolly's Pub) is way overpriced. Two Bud Light beers and one hamburger will run you $29.72. Parking is an additional $20.00 per evening. Ridiculous! If you do stay at this hotel$$$ don't let them put you in room 548. It's a handicap room right next to the elevator shafts. You will have the pleasure of hearing six elevators going up and down all night. Tried to call front desk,but no answer.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast but really thin wall even at executive level”
Reviews.Author: SGTraveler01
Reviews.Content: Stayed on Aug 8th at the executive floor for a night as transit. Paid approx. US$200 inclusive taxes. Even the hotel is supposed to be connected to the passenger terminal directly, walking from United Airlines terminal is a bit far. Walking from Terminal A and E is quite convenient. Check-in was prompt. Room is cozy and nice, bed is comfortable as usual. Since it is a weekend stay, I got to enjoy a complimentary full breakfast at the restaurant next to the lobby, not the usual executive floor continental style. Breakfast was quite nice, especially the free flow of juice. Cheese and cold-cut were also good. Service however was just ok, not very attentive. The restaurant receptionist somehow thought that I didn't pay and chased me a bit, even though another waitist took my coupon after I sat down, but not much hassle. My two main complaints are (1) very thin wall and I heard snoring from next door the whole night; (2) shower head is really weak, and it reminded me of one of Seinfeld episode about weak shower head. With US$200, I think I expect a better property.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: AUTISMSMITH
Reviews.Content: Stayed here August 24th for 1 night - we met up with friends and spent a nice evening in the bar/restaurant and had a lovely meal there. Had breakfast in the morning which was expensive but was nice. Staff were friendly and helpful - even giving out 13 year old son a gift of a terminater toy - which being autistic he loved (we noted the little girls were given My Little Ponys) - this was a very nice touch. The room was clean and large. The location was perfect for the Airport - we just had a 10 minute walk from the terminal - which we took our trolley straight to our room!!!! We never even heard the Planes even though we watched them go off from our room!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a stop over”
Reviews.Author: IdRatherBeAtHome
Reviews.Content: Room comfortable, staff pleasant and loaction greta for popping in and out of airport. Room comfy, breakfast in room service was expensive for what we had, but all in all a good o/night stay

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: JaxSoxFans
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 1 night after flying into Boston relatively late. Easy walk to the hotel from our terminal (especially for me since my husband carried the heavy bags...). Check in was the fastest I've ever experienced. Pretty, clean hotel and room; comfortable bed. Only complaint is I felt as though we could hear every conversation and door closing, all night. And with the airport location - understandably - you have guests arriving at all hours. I generally sleep like a rock and am not overly sensitive to sounds, so I have to think the rooms are not all that sound-proofed. Although I did not hear anything in the way of airplanes, just people, so who knows? We did also have 1 really loud couple talking and laughing in the wee hours. Couldn't quite tell where it was coming from, didn't complain; certainly not the hotel's fault. We were there so briefly we did not try the in-room internet nor did we eat there. The walk back to the airport the next morning to the terminal to catch a car rental pick-up shuttle was a breeze. (Again, with hubby toting the big bags; it is a bit of a walk. There is an option to take a hotel shuttle that I would probably take next time if by myself with several bags.) Definitely ask questions as to where the hotel is in relation to your terminal because it is close to 1, reasonably close to another and it looked like kind of a haul to walk from the rest. Overall, I would stay there again for 1 night under similar circumstances: Either flying in late to Boston, or driving in to Boston to fly out early the next morning. This hotel is perfect for having that convenience. I would not stay here more than 1 night as it is on the expensive side, is not as close to the Boston attractions as I'd prefer, and I did not sleep well because of the people/door (although NOT airplane) noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hilton - convenience to airport invaluable”
Reviews.Author: GatorNana
Reviews.Content: The valet and check-in experiences were flawless. Front desk clerk was professional and cordial. Our room was perfect - all the usual qualities and amenities that you expect from a Hilton Hotel. Our room attendant was particularly helpful - she provided us with extra coffee and condiments after we asked her as we passed in the hallway. The personnel assisting with parking and shuttles were fabulous, even friendly! We were completing a 2-week vacation and turning in a rental car. The shuttle service afterward was worth every dollar as we used it to get to the "T" stations for sightseeing and getting to the airport with our bags. I liked the consistent high quality of the service, room and its furnishings and amenities, the business center which provided at least 5 computers with free internet access. The only drawback was the high price and "attitude" of the server and manager in the restaurant where we ate breakfast. The buffet was quite extensive and featured many fresh items to choose from but the service we received was almost nonexistent, even considering that we expect minimal attention when doing the buffet. Overall, though, this hotel was everything we looked forward to at the end of a long road trip.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient jet lag saver!”
Reviews.Author: Cork
Reviews.Content: There are now some flights from Europe into Logan airport arriving in the evening. The Logan Hilton is perfect for beating the first nights jet lag on those. We arrived on the second with Lufthansa from Frankfurt at 8:15 pm. 50 minutes later we were in our hotel room. Brief unpacking, a (well, two) Samuel Adams summer ales at the bar and back to the room, sleeping for 8 hours. CanÂ´t do better. Quality of the hotel is how you can expect it from a renovated Hilton. Good feel, excellent matresses and linens. Requested a corner room and got it. Friendly and efficient staff. Will book again.

Reviews.Title: “Top-Notch Airport Hilton”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixAZ
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent biz traveler and loyal Honors member and this is the nicest airport Hilton I've stayed at. Its not the Waldorf, but if your expectations are on par with other airport Hiltons this one will far exceed. Excellent gym/sauna/steamer, great bar, large updated rooms, turndown service if you are on the concierge level, and a great club lounge with one of the best views of Boston in the city. For being located literally on the airport concourse, rooms are surprisingly quiet. The shuttle service is free, but over used. If you are tight with time trying to get to the terminal, take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Go early for the van to airport, DON'T waste your $$ in the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: trixiefig
Reviews.Content: Just spend one night at this hotel. Good place to stay, close to the airport. If you like microwaved pizza, really gooey crust, cold soup and expensive prices, don't miss the restaurant in the hotel lobby. We were in the lobby at 4:30 AM for a 4:45 van, twenty people ahead of us, we had to walk so we wouldn't miss our flight. Hotel room comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Bed... How about free WiFi?”
Reviews.Author: GSP711
Reviews.Content: Just had an overnight from late arriving flight and early departing. Checkin smooth, room fine (not cheap at $199 but guess they are entitled to leverage their superb location!) and a great night's sleep on awesome bed/linens. My pet irritation in business hotels is those that charge for internet access - I often will choose another on that factor. Anyway, I commented negatively on that at checkin and the helpful and welcoming Javier on the 10pm front desk immediately indicated I should just go ahead and use it and he would credit the $15 odd on the room a/c... excellent customer relations... Quick shuttle to the terminal in the morning if the walkway too much with luggage. I'd overnite here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: travelingstar55
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel located minutes from the airport. They offer shuttle service every 15 minutes to the airport. After a very long and stressful day we were very hungry when we arrived a bit after midnight. All the restaurants were closed but the desk staff offered us a complimentary ham and cheese sandwich with an apple and chips. How did they know it was just what we needed! We received a complimentary breakfast buffet and were taken care of by a warm and friendly waitress. The bed was comfy and the linens clean and crisp. Unfortunately we were gone by 8am the next morning so we were unable to enjoy all the amenities that the hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “Vast hotel, well placed for transport links”
Reviews.Author: Solarsid
Reviews.Content: My stay here was over a 3 night period whilst I had work to carry out at the airport. Very big hotel, that was obviously a busy place with transiting travellers. The room was very pleasant with great size TV and king bed. Typical large corporate check in, not much information offered. Room service was very efficient and friendly and the in hotel 'pub' offered a good selection of food. Last night of stay was a nightmare with a family from hell moved in to the room next door. Child was ovbiously suffering from jet lag as the noise level was far from acceptable until gone midnight, with no consideration for other hotel users. Would prefer not to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “For Convenience to Boston Logan Airport, Can't Be Beat”
Reviews.Author: PAQ
Reviews.Content: We were bumped by Delta, and received free night hotel and $30/pp food voucher. Hotel is attached to Terminal A, so no more than 5 minute walk. I was not expecting much, and was very surprised (1) the rooms were pleasantly furnished, (2) the food in the tavern was very good, (3) the fitness center was very good, (4) the pool was good, and (5) the outside park area outside the pool door was extremely restful even with some airport noise. Even though right at the airport, room was totally silent. I noticed a lot of flight crew personnel which makes sense. I noticed that most of the guests at breakfast the next morning were also using food vouchers, so I guess all the airlines send passengers to the Hilton. It seemed busy. We took the Hilton free shuttle 5 minutes to the Water Taxi, which cost $10 one way to the Boston Aquarium. Highly recommend that. Only real complaint is that it took 4 phone calls and almost 2 hours to get a roll away bed to our room. We were not charged for it, at least.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for airport”
Reviews.Author: RossOrpington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this airport because we had an 0820 flight to the UK and knew that the hotel has walkways to Terminals A and E (we needed E). The hotel is nearer Terminal A. We'd booked and paid for the room weeks in advance and chose to have a $9 upgrade to a larger room if available on the day. It was and we had room 881. A very spacious corner room that had fantastic views over the airport and Boston. The hotel seemed very empty and the main restaurant, Berkshires, was not open for dinner (due to the recession so we were told). Check-in was very quick and easy. We had a fantastic large HD flat screen TV and I could have watched it all day. The hotel is very conveniently located for the airport and also for Boston itself. A free shuttle is provided to take people to a Metro station or you could use the Silver line from an airport terminal. So you could easily use the hotel as a base to explore Boston and also to use the restaurants in Boston. The hotel had a pub, Connolly's Pub, open but that was nothing special. Typical fast American food though there are a few lighter choices (a plate instead of the normal size helpings).

Reviews.Title: “A promise not kept”
Reviews.Author: Dettler
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that this is a beautiful hotel, on the outside at least. And it most likely is the best location for Logan Airport. The experience we had staying at this hotel was less than expected. We had called for an early check in to go out and see the city. They said "fine, 1 pm instead of 3 pm would be ok". But when we mentioned that we were part of the HHonors program we got no special treatment that is promised as part of the loyalty program. When we pulled up and eventually got a spot there was no one there to greet us. No one to take our large load of bags. I had to search for a luggage cart and finally found where they hide them. TIP - there are to the left as you enter the lobby all the way over by the fitness room and gift shop hidden around the corner. I snagged one and took it out the the car. Still no one around to greet or help out. When I had lifted the last bag onto the cart a man appeared in uniform almost demanding to help out finally. I told him that since there was no one to greet or help us that he was too late ( and by implication too late to get a tip). While my S.O. waited in the lobby for check in time and while I returned the car to Dollar (great experience BTW) she was asked/told at least twice to be sure to return the cart to the lobby. There was no HHonors dedicated check in line. Or rather there was a line but no one to man it. When we finally did get checked in there was no apology or explanation for the short staffing. The room was good, not great as you would expect, but good. No fitted sheet on the king bed but only a flat sheet folded around the mattress. There was some sort of settee that may have looked good in the design phase but was totally impractical for two people. The bottom on the wood on the settee was all banged up and could have used some attention. The view from rm 874 was amazing! The water and the Boston skyline was very romantic. I would love to post a picture here for all to admire but the floor to ceiling window was filthy. I had the shot all planned out but when we returned that night the filth and grime was too much even for me. The shower was weak and the flange that should have been attached to the wall and the shower head was not. A different bellman was prompt and very courteous when he came to our room at 5:15 am for our bags. And the van driver was just as courteous in helping with our bags at the airport. We used the van to go to the nearest T station and for a pick up at the water taxi. Both were a bit of a wait but not a major hassle. Maybe it was an off day for the Hilton, but it so happened to be the day we were there. Maybe if there had been any sign of management taking ownership of the problems, offering an explanation no matter how weak or making up for the short comings we would not have come away feeling that given a choice next time we would stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Frustrating Stay”
Reviews.Author: muttnjeff
Reviews.Content: We have written numerous reviews, most of them favorable, but this was our worst experience ever, Here's why. We flew into Logan. About 9:45 p.m. we telephoned for the shuttle from the handy terminal phone provided; they said it would be right over, so we walked to the clearly signed pickup point. Thirty minutes later the shuttle hadn't come, despite many other hotel buses having arrived and left. Because we could see the hotel a short distance away, and because we were tired from traveling, we decided to walk. Back into the terminal, up two escalators, across two skywalks and through a parking garage with a bad knee. The pleasant desk person told us the shuttle runs every fifteen minutes - I corrected her. The room was unremarkable, except that it had a very good flat screen TV. We heard no jet or air conditioner noise, but sleep was difficult because there was poor sound insulation in the walls. We heard our guest neighbors speaking normally, moving heavy objects, and closing doors far into the night and early the next morning. Next morning: Berkshire's restaurant offered a breakfast buffet - for $24 per person. So we ordered off the menu and the waitress wrote the order down. Waited a long time. Breakfast came with scrambled eggs instead of over medium as I'd ordered. Sent it back. Waited. Eventually she got it right, although I had to ask again for the jelly. $19 per person. I will say the bacon was superb. The next morning we ate breakfast at the Starbuck's Cafe in the lobby and found the counter person helpful and the food satisfactory, though somewhat overpriced. There are two old computers on the first floor for guest use, free. If you want to use your laptop either in your room or in the business center on the second floor, sorry, it's $14.95 per day. We rented a car, went out and returned to the hotel. Sorry, valet parking only, adjacent to the hotel. Want to self-park? Sorry, you'll have to use the airport parking lot out back of the hotel and walk in. How much? $32 overnight. Of course the hotel will give you a swipe-card to exit the lot without paying - how much shows on your bill as a result? $32. And the card worked the afternoon we got it, but didn't work the next morning, so we paid an additional $32 to exit the parking area. We are Hilton Honors members, but why pay $24 per person for breakfast, when off-airport chains offer free hot breakfast? Why pay $14.95 per day for internet access when off-airport chains offer free internet? Why pay $32 per day for parking when off-airport chains offer plenty of self-parking?

Reviews.Title: “Right next to the airport terminal”
Reviews.Author: sophielaura
Reviews.Content: You can't get nearer to the return flight ot the UK than this place. Have stayed in Boston a few times, and always use Hotwire.Com as hotels are expensive. Did last night here for Â£50 per room, against rate of Â£120, so good deal. If I had known, would have booked our previous night also, but wiuth Hotwire, you never know. As we always get a day flight back to UK, this is great as you walk out of the hotel into the airport, no worries. Also, only about 10 mins from downtown Boston

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: NineEighteen
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel, it's in a great location at the airport and easily accessible from the terminals. The lobby is huge and has a very relaxing atmosphere. The room was perfectly soundproof and the bed very comfortable. There is free Internet access in the lobby and I really cannot fault the hotel at all. We stayed here for a night to avoid a heavy snow delay on our way back to London and it was a perfectly welcome stop and added to the enjoyment of our holiday which I wouldn't necessarily expect from an airport stop.

Reviews.Title: “Asst Front Office Mgr - Ms Rivera - was my Hero!”
Reviews.Author: rwethereyet850
Reviews.Content: Had some real difficulties with housekeeping getting my room prepared in a timely manner for check in, but Ms Victoria Rivera, the Asst. Front Desk Manager, went out of her way to make sure that I was taken care of. Her actions, which were very genuine and specific to my situation, really sold me on this hotel. If you're interested in staying at a Logan hotel where the management really cares about your traveling experience, this is the place. The shuttle bus, which can be really sketchy at airport hotels, ran on schedule and the drivers were very accomodating. To avoid the high parking rate, I just dropped my rental car at Hertz and had the shuttle pick me up there. Unless you're looking at a significant drop in price for multi-day car rental while in the area, it's cheaper to just get daily rentals and avoid the $30 parking charges. The "T" gets you to downtown so having a car for the city is more nuisance than anything else (my opinion). What really started out as an upleasant experience was turned around by the great people that work at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel near Logan BUT BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: SchoonerChef
Reviews.Content: We decided on flying out of Boston for the first time to get a flight with no change plane scenairios. Also had an EARLY 6am departure so figured on putting some of the savings we made on the tickets (BOS) was much cheaper than our home airport BDL. Figured it made sense to stay at the one hotel directly at the airport - connected by interior walkway to terminal. So as much as I would have loved to hotwire or priceline a room - rolling the dice on which of the 5 or so "airport hotels" we decided to book it directly to be sure and get the Hilton - because it wa attached directly to the terminal. The trouble was it was only attached to one of the terminals - and not the one we needed. So we still had to ride a van at packed capacity at 4:20 AM no less. Our stop for United wound up the last stop. Ughhhhh stress you just don't need at that hour of the day. Luckily I thought to make a dry run walk top the terminal after we checked in and learned of the PITA it would be. What peeves me is all of the discount hotel site blurbs I read pushed how it was the only hotel connected directly to the airport. So it's just fine as an airport hotel but if you want the ease of walking to your flight you best find out what airlines are in the terminal it connects to. You would be able to spend HALF the money and get the same results - riding a van to the airport.......

Reviews.Title: “If you have to stay near Logan, this is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hought
Reviews.Content: Having never really stayed near an airport before, I wasn't sure what to expect. This Hilton is very nice, convenient, and has a good restaurant and bar to relax at before one flies away on business or vacation. It is also one of the most modern, new Hiltons I've stayed in. Save the commute to the airport and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Coming back for sure”
Reviews.Author: drettsonline
Reviews.Content: Very convenient, comfortable beds, quiet place to stay, nice TV's. I was flying my daughter in for camp and needed a easy place to stay because we were arriving late night, leaving the next morning to move her into camp, then I was flying out the next day. Only problem I encountered was that I booked online and paid for the upgraded 'city view'. When we arrived those rooms were sold out but we were told we could move the next day. I called the manager the next morning, who made an adjustment on my bill and found a great room on a higher floor for me to move into. Well worth the extra for the view if you don't have an early flight the next day and view is important to you. It's not a bad walk to the terminal, only problem is that the security lines can be long so give yourself at least 45 minutes to an hour prior to boarding. We ordered room service, it got very expensive with the fees added in. Pizza very good, probably the best bargain on the menu (we ordered pizza, steak salad and clam chowder, chowder good...steak salad expensive for what we received) Bathroom in my second nights room (city view) much nicer/ newer cleaner tile. Wireless internet is $14.95 for 24 hours, worked fine but wish it were free.

Reviews.Title: “New favorite hotel at Logan”
Reviews.Author: Lombard955
Reviews.Content: I have long been a fan of the Hyatt at Logan, but a recent stay at the Hilton has converted me to Hilton. (Not that I really have any choice in the matter. I always use Priceline to reserve airport hotel rooms. Always a great deal. But if I had a choice...it would definitely be the Hilton.) My latest Priceline "win" was the Hilton at Logan. My husband and I were just married in Massachusetts last week, and this was the last night of our stay before returning to California. We had a ton of luggage and were exhausted. The staff at the Hilton could not have been any nicer. The bellman graciously lugged our huge bags out of the car and up to our room. The desk staff checked us in in no time flat and were very concerned about making sure that we didn't have to walk too far from the elevator since my new husband has a walking cast on (long story - pre-wedding accident). I had pretty low expectations for the restaurant, and although pricey, it was pretty good as far as hotel restaurants go. Lastly, they picked me up at Hertz after I dropped my car off. The last time I stayed at the Hyatt they told me that i would have to take the Hertz shuttle to Terminal A and pick up the hotel shuttle there. What a pain! The Hilton folks were more than happy to pick me up and were quick to show up. Net-net: a great end to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, pretty room with easy access to the airport and subway”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaElizabeth
Reviews.Content: We really liked our stay at the Hilton at Boston Logan. It was roomy, extremely quiet, and a quick walk to the airport terminals. It was also very easy to access the subway system through the walkway and terminal. We liked this hotel a lot better than the Hampton at Boston Logan, which was about a 10-minute shuttle ride away and not in a nice part of town. The only complaint we had about the Hilton was the extremely expensive breakfast ($17 for pancakes, $24 for the buffet). We saved money by eating oatmeal for $7 and juice for about $5.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Choice for Airport Travelers”
Reviews.Author: lewiejay
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice for airport travelers. It is adjacent to Logan with every 15 minute shuttle service to the terminal. The rooms are well appointed, clean, with comfortable beds and bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Quiet at Logan Airport”
Reviews.Author: HiIslandsGuy
Reviews.Content: You can actually walk from your airline gate to this hotel through a series of enclosed walkways leading from Terminal A or E. The directional signage is excellent. Once you're in the hotel you realize what an escape it is from the noise and frenetic energy of the airport. The check in process is fast, friendly and efficient. The rooms are quiet, very comfortable and well appointed. The beds are some of the best I've experienced on the road. The air conditioning system is quiet and the in-room thermostat lets you select your favorite sleeping temperature at any time of the year. I heard NO airport noise and got a good night's sleep on both of my stays here. The service is unfailingly pleasant, be it the housekeepers, bellmen, telephone operators or front desk staff. I only ate one breakfast in the hotel restaurant, but the service there was fast and efficient. There are a number of healthy choices on the menu, although like most hotel restaurants, everything is a little pricey. Perhaps the only downside of this hotel is that there is nothing else around it except the airport. But if you want to explore some of Boston's restaurants, you can take the hotel shuttle to the Airport Station of Boston's mass transit system and be in Chinatown or Little Italy in twenty minutes. The shuttle bus can also take you to the car rental locations by the airport. This hotel is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort a few minutes from the airport.”
Reviews.Author: shelter
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Hilton Logan Airport in april 2009, we choose this hotel as it was the nearest from the airport (we had a late arrival), it is located not far from the terminals but you have to take the hilton shuttle to reach it easily. We booked an executive room with two double beds (for two adults and one kid) so the breakfast was included and served in the lounge, a quiet environment with a large view of the bay, downtown Boston and the airport, the buffet breakfast was ok but it has limited choice. The room was nice and comfortable and the bathroom was well furnished as expected for an hotel chain of this category but larger beds would have been appreciated after a long flight. The hall of the property was luxurious and well maintained with restaurants, a bar and a shop. Complimentary newspaper was provided.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent shuttle service , room allocation issues”
Reviews.Author: farawaymum
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night as I knew I was arriving very late- plane was delayed at JFK and I ended up calling the shuttle around 1.30am from the courtesy phone in the Jetblue terminal- it came within a few minutes. The shuttle is regular and will drop you at the airport T station (blue line) if needed- I used it several times that day and found it really convenient. Due to the late hour of arrival I basically took the room key from the desk and fell into bed without taking too much notice of the room- I was allocated a room on the 9th floor (9 and 10 are the honors levels). For plane spotters the view from upper floors towards the airport is great -with the bonus of effective soundproofing. There are free computers in the lobby. As it was the weekend the honors lounge is actually closed so I was given as voucher to the restaurant for a hot breakfast. Breakfast was good- plenty of choice-all very nice. Before checking out I looked at my reservation and realised the room type allocated to me was really a downgrade from the larger corner room I had actually booked . I queried this at checkout and had my bill reduced accordingly ,although the argumentative clerk insisted that the rooms were "nearly" the same despite the room descriptions on the website- I find this hard to believe-it all seems rather deceitful. This is part of a problem I have encountered on numerous occasions as an honors member where the "upgrade" is really a worse room ( smaller than the category booked) but on an honors floor. Honors members it pays to asked a lot of questions before accepting a room so you know what you are getting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Mom2LifeAndJoy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend back in October of 2008. We chose this hotel because of location, ratings here on Trip Advisor.and the times we were to arrive and depart from Boston. We were not disappointed. We were met with friendly staff and our room was clean and well appointed. I was also amazed at how quiet it was considering its location. The only bad thing I have to say is that the parking was expensive, but after checking out other establishments found that to be the norm for this area. So, I guess that isn't too bad after all. Hubby and I really liked the shuttle service. We never had a long wait and service was always with a smile. I can not comment on the room service because we never ordered, but we did partake of the breakfast buffet and found it to be well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: BizCasFri
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The rooms were modern and well furmished(flat screen tv, fancy coffee-maker with gourmet coffee and special mugs, etc). The staff were pleasant and accessible. The bar and restaurant were extremely accommodating and pleasant(Connolly's, which deserves its own review), and checkout was seamless, having a zeroed-out balance in the quick check-out invoice shot under my door late night(this is important if you are a business traveler). And the view was impressive as well. Nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Great- for an airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaJazzy
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The rooms were clean and nicely appointed. The rooms were very quite despite the fact that it is located next to the airport. The shuttle to the airport was convenient. The service was kind and courteous and the breakfast was varied and satisfying.

Reviews.Title: “dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: SElario
Reviews.Content: Hilton Honors members no longer has its benefits or rewards. Value for this hotel in this area at the time was by far the best. Great, if you like stale food, dusty rooms, overpriced amenities throughout hotel and on occasion an encounter with a cranky employee. We always stay here when visiting family. We're now looking for another chain hotel. Visitors beware the recession has clearly hit this chain. Bring snacks and food with you. Use the business center or your I-Phone to access the internet. Be prepared to make compromises. If possible, ride your bike, parking a vehicle is also overpriced. Oh and bring lots of cash as there are many staff on hand to help you lift, direct and assist you with luggage, your keys and a glass of water. They expect to be and should be tipped. All in all the value is no longer worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Eat elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: metricmike
Reviews.Content: Room was very nice, clean, modern, comfortable beds. Internet access was $15 day. The only restaurant is a pub with pub like food, mostly fried. I tried the room service menu, A club sandwich, soup and glass of wine was $48, soup was great, sandwich mediocre as was the rest of the menu. The menu was apparently downgraded about 3 months prior according to room service (about Feb 09). I would stay here but definitely eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Flying Visit”
Reviews.Author: adrianhobson
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for 9 hour layover at Boston on the way to Miami and teh Hilton fitted the bill. Its on the airport and accessible via a (long) walkway from Terminal E. It aws a bit further away than I expected - maybe 10-15 mins walk and the hotel stands alone rather than being part fo teh airport complex but you can't deny its the best placed hotel if you want to cut out any problems with getting to and from when you're tired aftar a long flight. We didn't test any of teh facilities other than teh riooom which was large and comfortable with a big flatscreen TV. Some good views over the airport. Efficient chack in (although it was very late (10pm) when we turned up. Well informed staff helped with transfer information and shuttle times. Check out was fast too - although at 5:30 am there wasn't a queue! The Hilton is further away from other terminals. It's easier to get to them by using the regular shuttle which was running every 15 minutes at 5am and took only 5 mins to get to Terminal B where we caught a connecting American Airways flight the next morning. Check the location of your onward connections in advance. Incoming international flights use E (which is directly connected to the Hilton) but onward domestic connections will be from other terminals depending on which airline you use.

Reviews.Title: “if you get a crib make sure you ask for bedding for it!”
Reviews.Author: deerislegirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hilton at 12:30 a.m. after a late flight. I had called ahead of time to ask for a crib in the room. It was not in the room when we got there although they brought it a short time later. Keep in mind it is 1 o'clcok in the morning and I have been traveling all day with two small children who just want to go to sleep. When the crib arrived my husband went to the door and did not see that the crib only had a vinal covered mattress in it with no bedding at all. We tried several times to call the front desk to have bedding brought up to the room but no one answered the phone. The baby ended up sleeping with me who didn't get any sleep because I was worried he would fall off the bed. With that said the beds were very comfortable, the room was clean, and quiet. So I would stay there again with not kids. ps. the breakfast (2 eggs, bacon, juice and toast) is $26.00...no kidding!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but watch the extras”
Reviews.Author: murdock110
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights last week for a meeting. Rate was comperable to other local Hotels at around $225 a night. Parking is nearly $40 a night with a tip - wow! Parking alone added nearly $100 to the bill. Not sure if there is an easy cure for this, but be aware of it before you book this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great room - clean, spacious and cheap”
Reviews.Author: taxpolicy888
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight at the Boston Logan Hilton since I have a layover between an iceland air flight and my flight back to Ottawa. Since my flight was leaving at 6am I wanted to be close to the airport. This hotel is directly attached to the airport and has a free shuttle to all the terminals which operated 24h a day. It has a very nice pool and gym. My room was super clean and spacious. I found the bed to be super comfortable. I loved that in the lobby there were 4 computers that were free for guest use and a printer. I got a very good rate $65 USD for a king room off of Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: seasontraveller02
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. I stayed with my Boyfriend at the begining of January. The rooms were very clean and the maids were very nice. The front desk staff was very helpful and polite. Overall the staff was great. The location is perfect! Will stay next time we're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at this airport Hilton. Very close to airport with good links between hotel and terminal. The bedroom on the executive floor was clean and spacious. Executive lounge was good in the evening for snacks and drinks but the continental breakfast was limited in comparison to other Hilton Executive lounges in the USA. Overall this was a good hotel for the purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel with amazing views!”
Reviews.Author: chocolatemonkeybear
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hilton for a few nights on business. The location was great, extremely easy to get to from the Airport via a walkway. The views over the bay were fantastic and very easy to get to using public transport. Big room with a very large bathroom and two king size beds. Fantastic for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorCalculus
Reviews.Content: The location is fine evidently, unless you feel like wandering outside. My gripe is the awful breakfast. Undrinkable coffee and a dried out pastry. I got my money back. The meal in the restaurant was distinctly unimpressive. Evidently Hilton does not mean the same here as in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: saramaddison
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via lastminute.com and it was good value for money at Â£74 for a king sized bedroom. Choose this hotel as we only had two days to see Boston and were flying out on the second day back to the UK. Staying at the airport meant that we didn't have to drag our bags in and out of the city on public transport. We did go in and out of the city to sightsee using the T subway system. Either walking to Terminal A from the Hotel through the Skytunnel (covered walkway - 5 mins) and then getting on the Silverline bus which is part of the Boston T Subway and Bus system (tickets can be purchased just inside the Terminal by the bus stop, or taking the hotel free shuttle bus to the Airport T station on the Blueline to catch the Subway train. The Silverline takes you to the habour area and the Blueline into the city centre (both areas are worth checking out. Very comfortable room and all amenties were good. we didn't dine in the hotel, but grabbed a Starbucks and Bagel in the lobby coffee shop (open 5.30am - 12.30pm only).

Reviews.Title: “uktra cinvenient airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stevied888
Reviews.Content: Wonderful pool large clean rooms well decorated offers a bridge into the terminal. Food is a little expensive but that is to be expected. Excellent salmon salad.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: jabiru
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before an early morning flight. Room was modern, clean with a very comfortable bed. I am a light sleeper but wasn't disturbed at all by aircraft noise. Good shuttle service to the airport which departs every 15 minutes. Wish we had spent our entire stay in Boston at The Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Combined with the "T", it worked for me.”
Reviews.Author: lafayette74
Reviews.Content: Got it for $68 on Priceline for a conference in Cambridge. Room was immaculate, very comfortable beds, nice HD LCD TV, nice bathroom setup, no noise issues whatsoever either airport or neighbors. Parking ridiculous at $35/night so I stashed the car in Cambridge and took the Silver Line "T" from Terminal A which is about a 10 minute walk via the Skybridge from the second floor of the hotel. The "T" ran every 10 minutes and the trip to downtown took maybe 15. Switched over to the Red Line for another 15 minute ride up to Cambridge. I did this round trip about 10 times over 3 days and never had a problem - couldn't have been nicer. "T" pricing was $9.00 for a 24 hour ticket which included free rides for my 11 year old. And it goes everywhere you need to go. Didn't partake of hotel food but pricing seemed high to me. $15 for internet access also too much for me.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Getaway”
Reviews.Author: popo134
Reviews.Content: This was my once a year birthday getaway that my wife and I so look forward to. We usually go somewhere that I havenâ€™t been before so this year I chose Boston. Apparently this was the perfect time of the year because the leaves were changing and the temperature never dropped below 40 and never reached above 70 degrees. Our room was nice, better than most but not worth the price. It was clean and the staff was very helpful when needed. The King size bed was the most confortable bed I have ever slept in while on vacation. The hotel was well decorated and had a very nice sports bar that surprisingly became packed at night even for an airport hotel. We chose the Hilton Boston Logan Airport because we didnâ€™t want to rent a vehicle and we didnâ€™t want the hassle of taking a cab to and from the airport. The hotel supplies you with a complimentary shuttle to and from the closest subway terminal which is commonly referred to as the â€œTâ€�. The â€œTâ€� will take you anywhere you might want to go for fifty cents one way. I recommend buying a subway ticket worth $20 for the week. The subway was clean but crowded. I also recommend visiting the North side of Boston, particularly Hanover Street, for some of the finest Italian dishes Boston has to offer. Please donâ€™t leave out the bakeries. If you have the time, take a guided tour either with the amphibian â€œDuckâ€� vehicles or the trolley. I preferred the trolley because the Duck vehicles were too loud. There was so much to see I recommend planning for at least four days to take your time and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Pricy but good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: lakeflyer
Reviews.Content: I had to attend a large tradeshow in Boston in September 2008. The only option I had for the dates I was attending was the Hilton. I don't normally stay in airport hotels because I find them overexpensive and usually underdeliver service. I was glad that this hotel, although really expensive (likely due to the tradeshow), was a decent hotel. You cannot beat the convenience of the hotel. You don't ever have to step outside Logan Airport if you arrive in Terminal A. I walked from the plane directly over to the hotel via a skybridge in less than 10 minutes. The skybridge dumps you off by the conference area of the hotel. A little extra signage would have been helpful, but I managed to find the lobby to check in without too much hassle. Check in was quick and the staff helped me with understanding the bus routes for the tradeshow. My room was on a lower floor with the most dreadful view of roofs, pipes, and a slice of road. Fortunately, the noise from the airport was minimal, although you could hear the occasional jet taking off. The room is done in a minimalist style, very cool and gray. It was pretty masculine looking, but the bed was comfortable. The desk was useful for getting work done but the chair was a bit difficult to sit in for long periods of time. The hotel pub restaurant is a good option for those staying here. I was hesitant to eat there, because you really are a captive audience. But the portions were huge, prices were reasonable and the service was really good. I ended up eating there twice during my stay and the waiter remembered me on my second visit. I really liked the convenience of the hotel. If I absolutely had to choose between one of the Logan hotels for a future visit, I would want to return to the Hilton, as long as the price was not too outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort at the airport Hilton”
Reviews.Author: littlechaos
Reviews.Content: Even though located at the airport, it was easy to get to transportation to take you downtown. The front desk people were very nice and personable. Even though I am only a Silver Hilton Honors member, I got upgraded to a club floor. All I had to do was ask. That meant a free breakfast and internet access which was a nice way to end a great visit to Boston. The rooms were on the small side but clean. The bed and linens were very nice along with the bathroom and toiletries. The hotel gym was very nice. Had a steam room and lap pool in addition to plenty of machines and weight options. It appeared to be a gym that airport employees also used. More of a club than a hotel gym in teh basement. Topnotch equipment also. Room service was good and prompt and all the employees we encountered were very nice. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the food”
Reviews.Author: bognor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the start of an excellent Caravan tour of New England. The hotel is attached to the airport by a walkway but since the airport is pretty large you will probably use the free hotel shuttle which takes just a few minutes. The hotel is quite new with very nice bedrooms. Our one gripe was the restaurant which seems to no longer serve dinner. Their only other option is the hotel's pub which stank of stale pizza which we found totally offputting. This forced us to take the shuttle to the nearest station where a very helpful worker suggested we take the train one stop away from Boston to her own neighbourhood. Here we found a number of wonderful Italian restaurants and had a great meal at non-tourist prices. So the Hilton's loss was our gain, excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moira41
Reviews.Content: Spent our last 3 nights here after a 16 day holiday in New England. Hotel was very nice and, as we had read in some other reviews, there was no aircraft noise to be heard. I'm sure most people spend only a night here, so thought we might have been given a room with a view of Boston, but we weren't. I know breakfast is not normally included in American hotels, but it would be nice for the price you are paying. Coffee in the room consisted of 2 packets of ordinary and decaffeinated with 2 creams! My husband phoned the front desk to ask for more to be told some would be sent up, but wasn't. The next day I phoned housekeeping and more was sent up immediately. There is a good shuttle service to the subway as well all parts of the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sallynb
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for airport travellers.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIFIC”
Reviews.Author: follymeanywhere
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of location and the fact that the airlines kept switching our reservations and we couldn't finish our trip without an overnight stay somewhere. After being "rescued" by the wonderful people who represent the parking structure at Logan Airport, we exprienced a restful evening at theHilton. "Rescued" because we chose to cut across the parkiing structure and wandered around lost. (There should be more signs to the hotel.) Once we registered, we were treated to one of the best nights of rest! Tired, we ordered Room Service and tasted the most incredible Clam Chowder! The room was lovely, and the beds just invited sleep. Yes, this hotel is definitely on our Return To List, only the next time, we'll take the airport shuttle. :-D

Reviews.Title: “great for a weary traveller!”
Reviews.Author: a-fussy-traveller!
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Logan International with my family - after a long flight from the UK. Was seduced by the promise of a 'covered walkway' so we didn't have to venture outside the airport feeling exhausted from the flight. We had a very good experience at this hotel. The room was comfortable and clean and we had a fabulous view of the airport and highway. The kind of view that made us think - YAY we're in America! Breakfast was great and the staff very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “You cannot fault this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: andrew23
Reviews.Content: Located directly across from the Delta terminal, this hotel is a welcome oasis for the weary traveler. I arrived very late at night and it's comforting to know that my room is only steps away from the baggage carousel. The hotel has a very dependable shuttle service to the airport terminals, and to the "T" station so that meant downtown was only minutes away. The lobby and public areas were beautifully designed, and the rooms were very new and contemporary looking. As usual, they had the usual Hilton signature beds, and toiletries. Food in the restaurant was pretty good as well - decent chowders and steaks, YUM!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Rahael
Reviews.Content: Hilton Hotel was very nice...beds very comfy, shuttle service was on time and wonderful to get to the "T" walls are very thin at 3 am in the morning I woke up to the people next door chit chatting...that was frustrating...it was difficult to get back to sleep... make sure you get the side of the hotel with the view of the water and Boston...much better than the highway view...One thing I wish the hotel had was a conceige desk in the lobby...especially for questions as to what restaurants to go to, or directions somewhere...they have you ask the bellman but he is too busy with people coming and going that it seemed like he didn't want to be bothered with answering those kind of questions...most hotels have a separate stand for a conceige... Overall, it was a nice expereince...rooms are clean...

Reviews.Title: “Excelelnt hotel”
Reviews.Author: Californianative123
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Extremely clean, modern, and really comfortable. The beds are as luxurious as any other hotel I've stayed in. There is no airport noise, surprisingly. The lobby is very grand. The rooms are meticulous and the bathrooms very clean. All in all, an excellent place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: Patriot27
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed one night using points before flying out the next morning. They put us on one of the two executive floors (9th & 10th) -- the room was very modern, decor, flat screen TV, comfortable beds , and very quite despite having a few of the airport runways. We also utilized the hotels free shuttle that runs every 15 minutes to either the terminal or to the train station which we took to downtown boston -- it was literally a 10 minute ride to Quincy Market. I would definitely recommend staying here if on business or flying out the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good!!!”
Reviews.Author: duderator
Reviews.Content: Super location. Friendly staff.. would stay there again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jelh
Reviews.Content: Nice airport hotel within walking distance of terminal Stayed on the Club Floor which was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Helpful Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BillF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to Logan Airport and has a frequent shuttle service. They are good at adapting to schedule changes, flight issues, and emergencies. Good food in the restaurants (there really isn't another option for eating close by). ROoms are clean and quiet. Well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable place”
Reviews.Author: JClasstraveller
Reviews.Content: I only stayed in this hotel for a night before flying out to San Francisco the next day. The flight was early so decided to stay here instead of staying in downtown. Had driven from Albany and returned the car to the Avis rental place without a hassle. Room was very large, with comfortable beds and a nice "old Boston" map which added a bit of class to the room. Internet came at a cost and this was disappointing for a hotel that catered quite heavily to business travellers. The shuttle bus to the T station was very convenient, made travelling into downtown, and particularly the waterfront very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wildthing271
Reviews.Content: A trip to Boston for the 4th July fireworks meant a chance to spend a night in one of my most frequented hotels, the Hilton at Boston Logan Airport. For convenience this hotel is hard to beat. Whilst not in the downtown area, for business travellers, or those with early or late flights, you cannot beat the location. Physically connected to Terminals A and E, the hotel also offers a courtesy shuttle, which also drops and picks up at the T subway station for the city. I used Hilton's online check in system so I knew I had an upgraded room. Arriving at check in there was a lengthy line, but the Hhonors line was clear so I joined that, only to be consistently ignored by staff and barged out of the way by non-Hhonors members. I got zero benefit from using online check in or the Hhonors priority line, so I have to ask what the benefit of these services are if a hotel ignores them... But that was the only flaw with the stay. The rooms in the Hilton are nice. All have views, some of the airport which is surprisingly interesting, and on this occasion for, a view across the airport to the city sklyine. A great vantage point for the firework display, enhanced by the presence of the Queen Mary 2 in the harbour. Rooms are clean, bathrooms good, and the new flatscreen TV's are very good. My only criticism with the room is that they appear to have removed the mini-bars. Wifi internet access is available, and seems quick and stable. The exec lounge is good, offers a reasonable conteninental breakfast and again has superb views over the harbour. Check out was painless, the bill accurate and every member of staff I met courteous and polite. I would have rated at 5 stars if not for the check in experience.

Reviews.Title: “super hotel”
Reviews.Author: redjimmy
Reviews.Content: this hotel is an excellent place to stay i stayed 2 nights and was very impressed, shuttle service is brilliant,staff friendly and rooms fab.right next to airport but no noise whatsoever,very quiet,would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for gentle start to a trip”
Reviews.Author: DPtraveler_8
Reviews.Content: I needed to stay in Boston the night before flying to California and the Hilton was great. Very comfortable room, very friendly staff, no problems, everything comfortable. Used the shuttle to get to the T to go downtown and meet some friends for dinner and that worked great. The hotel is a shlep from the terminal through acres of parking garage, but the shuttle serves the terminals. I liked being able to walk though.

Reviews.Title: “Rat!”
Reviews.Author: TravelCarol47
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in the middle of June, one night before a flight home. I had stayed there in March and had a fairly good stay at that time. I checked in at about 3 PM. As I walked to my room,which was the very last unit on the fourth floor, the hall way was lined with at least two dozen used room service trays from the night before. I got into my room and sat on the bed for a while watching TV. Out of the corner of my eye I saw movement. I looked over at the air conditioning vent, which is on the lower part of the wall against the window, just in time to see the back half of a rat crawl out of my room and into the vent! Folks, I grew up on the corner of a farm and I assure you that I know the difference between a rat and a mouse. Mice don't have long tails and they are not the size of a hamster. Surely all the dishes I saw out in the hall were the rat buffet. I called the front desk, and they changed my room, but they were not very much more accommodating then just giving me a pass to the executive club for the day. While the front desk guy was appologetic, what he didn't seem was suprized!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Convenient to Airport, More coffee please”
Reviews.Author: Rockingtraveler
Reviews.Content: We were treating our mother to a cruise and decided to stay here pre-cruise as it was convenient to the airport. A little expensive for my taste, but this was vacation and for the hotel class and convenience not badly priced - $220 for 3 people. Very, very comfortable beds and pillows, excellent linens. Clean modern room though a bit small. Safe and secure premises. Free airport shuttle, even at midnight. Friendly efficient staff. Did not like: paying for internet, too little coffee in the room, no continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Taymar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a two day visit to Boston, before flying from the airport. The airport is only 3 miles from the city and the hotel runs a free shuttle to the subway, so access was easy. We stayed in a high room (9th floor) and had fabulous views from the room. We booked and were given an early check in. The hotel bar was OK for food and you get the usual Hilton standards, so we were perfectly happy with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: SFBayArea2
Reviews.Content: There was a dog barking near my room--on my floor--on and off from before 11pm until well past midnight. Repeated calls the the front desk and management did no good. It seems they sent someone to "check", who stuck their head off the elevator and went back downstairs. All they had to do was stick around for 10 minutes but no, that was asking too much. And I did ask--repeatedly. With an early morning flight, this was most unwelcome. To add insult to injury, when I complained to the manager in the morning he suggested I made the whole thing up to get a discount on my bill. Yeah, right. Even it it was my nickel (it was my employer's) I'd much rather get some sleep than get a discount. This was not the first time a Hilton family hotel has demonstrated a complete disregard for customers' sleep, BTW; it seems to "run in the family".

Reviews.Title: “If only other hotels were this good!”
Reviews.Author: bisbohemian
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, the guy at the front desk greeted me by name, noted my Hilton diamond status... VERY professional... if only other hotels could be half this professional... We went to our excellent room (1057) which has a great view of the airport (although you can't hear a sound) and Boston Harbor beyond... Then we made a trip to the concierge lounge... excellent... the lounge, the drinks... the food... excellent!! All-in-all, this is a great hotel... as for airport Hiltons... this is by far the best so far!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkremer
Reviews.Content: The staff is super friendly helpfull, the rooms are great nice design and clean. you can walk from the airport to the hotel and they also hav an excellent shutlle service. Also the brakfast is great absolutely great place to relax after a long flight

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Boston Logan”
Reviews.Author: CarShowIllustrated
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate on Hotwire of $84/night.
