Paid dearly for parking (rape) at $35/day valet or $30/day self-park, which is the most I think I've EVER paid for parking at a hotel, including downtown hotels around the country. Internet was overpriced by $5 at $14.95/24 hours. A little tricky to get to because of it's location on Logan's grounds, and a long walk from the terminals, or you can wait for the shuttles. The coffee bar in the lobby is only open until 12:30pm, boo! There is a Starbucks about 3-4 miles from the hotel that is easy to find in the Target just down the road and a Wendy's in teh same lot. The staff was very friendly and helpful in giving directions, if you have a car. The room was very clean, nicely decorated and had a 32-37" LCD TV that had a true Hi-Definition signal. This was nice feature since most of the hotels I've been in tout their 32-42" plasma and LCD TVs and then have standard signals and stretch them to boot, yuck. Even though I booked through Hotwire, they were nice enough to upgrade me to the Executive Level because I'm HHonors Gold. I had to ask for it, but they otherwise wouldn't have known about my status because Hotwire doesn't tell them, or ask. All staff was very friendly and helpful during my 2 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: thaJack
Reviews.Content: The room, at $179, was a great value considering this is a full service hotel. Unfortunately for me the hotel was not in the most convenient location, but most other locations were booked up already due to the marathon. Everyone was very friendly and helpful and with a shuttle service to the subway station, I did not personally need a car. There is also an enclosed walkway that directly connects the hotel to the airport. The only problem I had was that my room had neither microwave nor a refrigerator. I don't stay in full service hotels very often, so maybe this is just their way of trying to get you to eat their overpriced food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: HunterJayDogg
Reviews.Content: So I booked this through Priceline for a Friday night stay (got a great rate - 1/3 of rack rate). I was doing a one night overnight stay in Boston for a "Daddy / Daughter Day" so in reality we just needed a safe nice place to stay. We checked in pretty early (11:45am) and our room was ready. Got to the room and it was pretty nice. 2 double beds, a flat screen TV, a little chaise lounge type thingy. The bathroom was OK, a little dingy on the bathtub grout, but besides that OK. The view was nothing great (but did I mention I got a great rate?) but I never heard any airplanes (so it was pretty soundproof). I didn't like that the pool was off the lobby (I prefer them on an upper floor so I don't look like a fool going by the front desk) and the pool seemed to be in the spa / fitness area (not really a family type pool / more of a business type pool - but then again it's a business hotel). We took the shuttle to the T (never had to wait - it was even there when we were coming back to the hotel). Staff was very friendly. Parking was expensive, but it's Boston - all parking is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gymstara
Reviews.Content: We were very, very pleased with our one night stay here. We booked through priceline and got a price of $149 per night. We were given and unexpected upgrade at the front desk to an executive level room. The room was spacious and comfy, with a great flat panel tv! The bed was super comfortable, and the bathroom was very large. We had a great view of the harbour! I have to comment on the cleanliness - This room was spotless. I have never stayed in a cleaner hotel room before. We ordered room service for dinner. The food was good, and the prices reasonable for room service. The executive floor also has a lounge with light snacks at dinnertime. The night we were there they offered cheese and crackers, fruit, chicken skewers, samosas, cake bites, and free sodas and coffee. We also had the breakfast buffet in the morning, which was the standard Hilton breakfast, and it was great as always. My only complaint is that parking is very expensive - It should be free to guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and stay”
Reviews.Author: Horsenhounds
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay at the Hilton Boston Logan Airport. Great location, great service, spacious, well equipped contemporary rooms with fabulous views across Boston Harbour. We stayed on Room Only so can't offer an opinion on the dining availabale. Would definitely stay again. Soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Travel”
Reviews.Author: travelmeMaine
Reviews.Content: This hotel served our needs very well for an overnight and early morning departure from Logan. The hotel is connected via sky bridge to Logan which is great for Delta flights. However, we were flying American and although a bit of a walk , we were able to get to any terminal using the airport sky bridges. We never had to go outside and didn't use the free airport shuttle. We were able to leave our room at 4 am and be in our terminal well ahead of time for our 530 am departure. The hotel met our needs perfectly. I enrolled for Hhonors points but really don't expect to be treated like the King of New England because I have them. Check in was easy and the front desk clerk was very friendly and helpful. The room was super modern and nice. We used a park and fly rate for 4 nights and then the hotel only charged us 23.00 for each extra night, making it actually cheaper then staying in Logan central parking area. They give you a special card to swipe when leaving. There really is not an option for food other than eating at the hotel which is very overpriced and only very average food. The workout room and pool looked very nice but didn't get a chance to use them. It was great returning after a 5 night vacation and departing the plane, grabbing your luggage and heading back to the hotel via sky bridge to obtain the car. All in all a great hotel for travel.

Reviews.Title: “Ugggh!”
Reviews.Author: grapdad
Reviews.Content: I am an Hhonors Diamond member, and get great treatment from Hilton properties. Not here! I got a little room across from the ice machine, no drinks in the Executive Lounge, $14.95 a day wi-fi connection fee (cellular modem doesn't work in this hotel), and to top it off, I asked for a breakfast coupon, since none were enclosed in our envelope. I was told if I wanted breakfast, I had better pay for it! As a "courtesy" after raising a fuss, I was given a coupon for one day, and told that was it! Breakfast was awful! I love Hilton properties, but will make sure I never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: HP1972
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal ($100 per night) on this hotel via on-line booking. It was clean and comfortable. The staff was helpful. It is within easy walking distance from many airport terminals even if you have a moderate amount of luggage and saved me from having to get up early and then grab a cab to the airport. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: atlantisadvisor123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on friday february 29, 2008. We had an early flight out of Boston. We made parking reservations at thrifty. they refused to honor our reservation and we asked the hotel if they had the park and fly package available. They were full..but they did give us a list of parking lots where we could park and gave us a good recommendation. We asked for two rooms on a high floor...they gave us floor 8. we were rooms 830 and 831. The hallways were nicely appointed. The rooms were your standard business class 4 star hotel, which was nice. It had a nice plasma tv in it and the beds were comfortable. the shower was nice, good toiletries...nice furniture...rooms were a bit small but that was okay. the staff was fine too. we awoke in the morning to snow and feared the worst but everything was fine except for a small delay out of boston due to deicing the plane. the shuttle came promptly to take us to terminal B (American Airlines). When we arrived there was a huge line..but the bus driver got us a luggage cart and pushed our luggage to the very front of the line, where some of us could wait for it while the remaining people in our party stood in line. that was very nice not to have t o wheel 12 bags around through a line. Overall the hilton is an excellent hotel...we will use it again.....there is also a pool and a gym and a hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: GoodCompany2000
Reviews.Content: Last minute booking with no problems. The hotel is right at the Boston Logan Airport and can be accessed from the gates by walkway. I came into Terminal B and it was about a 10 minute walk, all indoors through walkways and through Terminal A, and it was not difficult to find. It appears to be new. Although it is it at the airport, I did not hear a single jet take off or land, which I was concerned about when I booked. Check in was quick and easy (I came in at 11:00 and there were only a couple people waiting at the check in desk) and the assistant at the front desk was pleasant. The room was a good size, very clean and very comfortable. I particularly appreciated the HD television and HD Channels. I also liked the night light in the bathroom, of which I had not seen a similar one before. It was its own "outlet" and gave off a very low blue glow when the light was turned off - not bright enough to be seen in the bedroom, and just light enough to let you see the floor as you walked into the bathroom in the middle of the night, so that you could easily find the light switch without banging a toe, or worse. My view was of the road coming into the airport, but I wasn't looking for a good view given my limited time there. It looked like there were potential for some nice views of the harbor from other rooms. The lobby is large and well appointed, and we used a conference room that was clean, well appointed and had convenient power plug ins for computers located within the tables and out of the way. The only negative I have about the hotel is that you have to pay for the wireless internet connection. I personally believe that today all hotels, and particularly hotels catering to business people, should not only have wireless internect connection, but it should free (at least build it into the cost of the room). One last positive. I had to cancel my second night stay and check out about 15 minutes after noon. The hotel did not charge me for the second night or charge a late cancellation fee without me asking. I really do appreciate that and I consider that good service.

Reviews.Title: “As always, excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: GeneralHalifax
Reviews.Content: Arrived real early, 2 rooms ready in 45 minutes, both rooms were what we asked for, very clean and quiet Shuttel Drivers as always very prompt and courteuos to all passengers, would like it though that they put their tips away as you feel compelled almost to tip them however, I only tippled if they assisted and that did not happen on this trip, sorry boys no tips. The Hilton is a great place to stay especially with the convenience of airport, thanks Hilton

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful send off”
Reviews.Author: daisymayMA
Reviews.Content: It really doesn't get any more convenient that this. With an early morning flight we decided to treat ourselves to an over night at the Hilton - I'm delighted we did. The rooms were wonderful and the bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. We were particularly impressed with the staff who seemed interested and happy - a refreshing change to many "transit" hotels where the employees seem jaded. I'd certainly recommend the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim2458
Reviews.Content: The night before taking a flight out of Logan, my partner and I stayed at the conveniently located Logan Airport Hilton, which I would have to rate as one of the best airport hotels anywhere. It is adjacent to the terminals and has an enclosed bridge that takes you to the central parking lot. From there, you can walk or take airport's parking lot shuttle (the drivers are not allowed to accept tips, btw) to any of the terminals. There is also a Hilton shuttle from the hotel to each terminal. While overnight parking is available at the hotel, the central garage is enclosed, important in the winter, and cheaper ($24 vs. $30 a night at the Hilton), and I'm sure long-term parking is even less. So, we parked our car in the central garage for the five days we were away. We saved some money and the car was right outside the door to the terminal. The lobby is grand and check-in was efficient. The very pleasant desk clerk invited us to use the concierge-level lounge for snacks that evening and for a continental breakfast the following morning. There is no alcohol served in that lounge. Breakfast was very good -- fruit, cereal, coffee/tea, juice, bagels, muffins -- enough to get you going before your flight. Our room was a good size and very quiet. Beds are comfy and the bathroom, stocked with Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries, was spotless, as was the main part of the room. The shower had great water pressure. There was a coffee maker in the room. We did not use the workout area or the spa, which offered a variety of treatments. Check-out was a breeze and the clerk on in the morning was as pleasant as the one the night before. Two things keep me from giving the excellent rating -- a charge for Internet service, which should be free, considering many businesspeople use this hotel, and some knocking noises that were hard to determine as to origin, and lasted for about five minutes. I've also stayed at the Hyatt, the equivalent of a few blocks away but still on airport property. While I liked the Hyatt, I would probably choose the Hilton instead, especially since it offered a lower rate and was much more conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilroy0
Reviews.Content: Right next to the airport, this hotel is fantastic. It is large, clean, spacious, and the rooms are nice. The front desk staff was amiable and helpful. The fitness center is terrific and the club room is great with hot food & drinks and flat screen tvs. Overall we had a terrific stay and look forward to staying here again before an early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: rbaelp
Reviews.Content: Right at the airport with shuttles running every 10 to 15 mins. Great Exeuctive floor. Rooms are above normal standards. Hotel food was good. Best cheese steak since philly (except for the bread).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KINGHOPWAS
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight after flight cancellation. Checked in late but plenty of staff and meal available if we had wanted it. Lively Connolly's Pub within the hotel. Reasonable size room with all you need (including large flat screen TV) except for in room safe. Good variety of choice at breakfast. Not the cheapest but value for money. Regular courtesy bus to all parts of airport including car hire depots and transport stops. Pedestrian bridge connecting hotel to terminals. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best "in airport" hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Pramstroker
Reviews.Content: Once again, our layover got extended so we walked over to the Hilton and got a room. (Long walk, but it's covered.) This is about the third time I've got "stuck" in Boston at this hotel. But if you're going to get "stuck," this is the hotel to do it at. Great sfaff and good property. This would not be, however, a good hotel to stay at for extended stays in Boston for the fact that getting to and from the city - albeit close - would get expensive. Between the taxi fare, the add-ons, and the tolls, about $25 each way.

Reviews.Title: “Airport hotels are rubbish.... don't believe it - this one was excellent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: stuartmo
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. It was a business trip and I was a bit worried about being out of it by the airport but the combination of the excellent accommodation, shuttles to the subway and excellent subway infrastructure made this a superb stay. There is a good Irish bar within the hotel, a good gym and pool, good rooms and overall a very nice hotel. If I went back to Boston I would stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: NashuaNH
Reviews.Content: My Minneapolis flight came in very late and I booked a stay instead of driving over an hour home at midnight. What a beautiful hotel. It is easy to find through a catwalk at the airport. They also provde a shuttle if you dont want to walk. In the lobby there is a nice pub and all business amenities. The room is absolutely beautiful, new furniture, updated, with a pretty view of the airport and water. In the morning, I went to the health club. There are towels, a locker room, a lap pool and updated equipment. TV's were everywhere to offer distraction and individual TV's on each machine. I am a Silver Hilton member and I was immediately offered services of the members lounge, even though its usually for Gold or Platinum members. there was complimentary breakfast, newspapers, magazines, concierge and another business center. Beautiful setting. The staff were all excellent and to be commended for their attention to detail. I have been in many Hiltons due to business and this was absolutely the best. I will definitely go back, and my thanks for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the Exec Level...”
Reviews.Author: dogsareforlife
Reviews.Content: This is an above average airport hotel however we used it for a city break to Boston - 4 nights. We booked an Exec Level room (10th floor) for $199 plus various taxes. The 10th floor has certainly had a re-fit with new furniture and decorations. Overall the scheme is very pleasing. With the exec level you get access to the lounge with free continental breakfast and hot snacks in the evening. Note: there are no free alcoholic drinks due to Massachusetts state law. Pros: its an easy 5 min walk to termial A to catch the silver line downtown (about a 10 min journey) and a 10 min walk to terminal E. The shuttle runs fequently if you cannot be bothered to walk or if you want to go to the blue line subway. Cons: We've stayed at this hotel about 5 times and it is a very nice hotel but we felt this experience was a little disappointing. Check in wasn't until 4.00pm and although we'd arrived after an international flight (at 2pm) not one room was ready...even the baggage man was surprised that we had to wait when we checked our bags for the wait. I think this is something they could address quite easily but no one on reception was bothered. When we did check in there was no apology for the lengthy wait (3 hours). The rooms are spacious and comfortable - no complaints. There is no noise from the airport and our neighbours were quiet so no disturbing noise from them either. Housekeeping was a bit hit and miss - dust was clearly visible when we arrived but it gradually disappeared dueing the stay. Bedding and towels changed everyday. The bed is VERY comfortable... The exec lounge is a nice facility but the breakfast NEVER changes - cereals, fruit, bagels/muffins/pastries and cold boiled eggs. Is it really too much to expect a little variation? It wouldn't cost THAT much to put some hot eggs and bacon on the menu - even a Hilton Hampton Inn can manage that. That said, its fresh and good quality so if you are only staying 1 or 2 nights then you'll be OK. Anything longer will send you out looking for alternatives. Staff are polite but a little remote - no complaints. Overall it's worth the money given the accommodations and facilities compared to downtown Boston prices and it's easy to get downtown if you want to go there. For a little bit of investment it could be outstanding...

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but not Excellent”
Reviews.Author: derekgorman
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this is a hilton connected to the airport with a good shuttle service so it is what you expect from a Hilton so of course it is very good....however it is not excellent and i will tell you why.. Firstly, the walls are paper thin so if the hotel is busy and the room next to you is occupied then you will hear the TV, i booked and pre-paid breakfast in advance but the hotel had no record and depsite showing written proof they still wanted to charge me $20 and then refund me when they contact the travel agent. Now, customer service should indicate that they as a gesture of goodwill take the temporary $20 hit... If you get this hotel for under $200 then its worth booking but if you pay more then you won't get value for money...

Reviews.Title: “Nice resting spot”
Reviews.Author: zachsaunt
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hilton at Boston Logan Airport every year during our annual trip to the Carribean. The skywalk is a great alternative to the hotel shuttle however the shuttle does run every 10-15 minutes. Check in was easy and pleasant. We ordered room service which was VERY good, it arrived on time and hot. We had a very early flight out the next morning and the "ZIP CHECKOUT" made our departure all the easier. One call to an automated line and we were on our way. I was a tad concerned when we returned as our flight was delayed and we didnt get in until 1:00 a.m. I had not requested a late check and was concerned that perhaps they didn't hold our room. No need to worry, they did. Even at 1:00 a.m. they had plenty of front desk staff to attend to us as well as other travelers. Room service was even available at that hour and again the food arrived on time and hot. The Hilton is a nice resting spot in between flights and we will stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable place; ideal if you have an early a.m. flight”
Reviews.Author: JMB2003
Reviews.Content: I am staying here for 1 night at this hotel because I have an early morning flight. It is about a 7-10 minute walk from Terminal A to the hotel lobby (signs are everywhere so you don't get lost). If you have heavy bags, just be aware it is a little bit of a walk. Front desk was very courteous--no offer to help with bags, but then again, I like that (less I have to tip), and I'm sure they would have helped if I asked. Executive level floor has nice rooms, free bottled water, coffee maker, and flat panel TV. My room looks out to Terminal A, it's neat watching the planes take off and land. Quality bath products (crabtree and evelyn), and the robe is a nice touch. Room service was prompt--good food for a hotel restaurant. I don't know why hotels of this quality make you pay for Internet (and for the money you pay), that's my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorCalresident
Reviews.Content: This is a nice Hilton connected by a walkway to Boston Logan. I found this to be a great convenience. The restaurant was all right. The beds were very good (I spent two separate nights in this hotel -- therefore, I stayed in two different rooms -- when I was arriving in the evening in Boston from a long flight and another night when arriving back in Boston in preparation for an air departure the following AM out of Logan.) The only problem is you are isolated there, nothing to do or walk to, except the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at Logan - and so convenient ...”
Reviews.Author: Hostiarius
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you have an early flight: just walk to your terminal in under five minutes. Comfortable room, with superb view across the water to the city; good buffet breakfast; very tasty meal from room service ... what's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RUDisney
Reviews.Content: I was provided a corner room with a view of Boston from one window and a view of the Delta terminal from the other window. The room was clean and comfortable with typical Hilton Le Source bath products. My only disappointment was that there was no bottled water in the room. Not a bad problem to have if that is the only one. The fitness center was upgraded to all Precor equipment. I got to spend an hour on one of the ellipticals while I was there. The meeting rooms were comfortable and the food was very good. Transportation to/from the airport was quick and painless. I will definitely stay at this hotel again if I'm in the Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “Hotels should deliver what they confirm”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterfirst
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is very convenient for the airport and we chose it for that reason. Arriving from the UK very late in the evening we were not pleased that the room that we had booked months in advance was not available unless we took the type specially reserved for the disabled. All other rooms except twin bedded had been allocated. Why? Also the televison did not work at all-but after a trans atlanic journey you do not want an engineer in your room at night at 11pm. All in all, a lot needs to be done at this hotel to give the customer what they have asked for and paid for. Unfortunately, we spent a month in various hotels in the US and it does seem to be a common fault. Service is no longer a priority in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: caper6767
Reviews.Content: This was the hotel booked for a group travelling for business. Once we got into our rooms, and some of us didn;t until VERY late in the afternoon, they were great! The rooms were spacious with good beds and nice furnishings. I would stay here again, but would avoid the restaurant....it wasn't so great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value; Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pfpurcell
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 spent the night of Aug 16th. at the Hotel before our early day flight back to London. It was excellent. The service was great. The room was particularly good with a HDTV. The shuttle was full at 6am so within 30 seconds the second shuttle was in place to take us promptly to the terminal. The only negative was that the onscreen departure info was not working on the TV so we could check that our flight was on time, (and thus get up at 5.35am!). The front desk quickly searched this on the internet when I phoned them. We could not get the hotel at any discount on Priceline only for my wife to get it via our airline BA (British Airways) for just Â£90 (US $179), so it is worth giving BA a call or booking it via their website as we stayed at the height of the holiday season. I regularly get a day flight back to London form NY, Boston and Chicago and this is the best hotel I have used at JFK, Newark, BOS or O`Hare for the night before. Highly recommended at that price. Patrick

Reviews.Title: “Great anniversary night!”
Reviews.Author: KBAJ
Reviews.Content: We were able to check in early (probably as it was a slow day - the Saturday of a three day weekend) and the desk clerk, when entering our Hilton rewards card number, found out it was our 32nd anniversary. She "upgraded" us to a fabulour corner room, facing the harbor and gave us complimentary access to the executive suite hospitality room. The staff were all very nice, from the bell man who gave us tips on how to get into Boston and what to do once we got there, to the desk clerk, to the health club attendant, to the shuttle bus drivers. Would stay there again in a heart beat! Was only sad it was a one night stand at the end of our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Dependable Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Mad537
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip to Boston, 4 days 3 nights. Staff was friendly and courteous. Helped me find where I needed to go for my meetings as well as dinners. A lot of activities (an out of state high school band staying there, a different high school prom, etc) going on in the hotel, yet it was quite and restful. Food at the bar/restaurant was above average. They gift shop attendant was very helpful and informative. Overall above average stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: paulrb
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family on holiday for 5 nights, booked solely for convenience to avoid a long trek with bags into Town following a long flight. Superb hotel, totally insulated from sound of airport, excellent rooms, comfortable beds, plasma HD TV in rooms. Staff all competent and friendly. Executive lounge on 10th floor great for views and free snacks am and pm. Shuttles regular and reliable, never had to wait more than a minute. Pool was a bit cold, but otherwise highly recommended, and not too expensive when booked direct.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Walkway from the Airport a bit Misleading”
Reviews.Author: The_Crofter
Reviews.Content: Stopped for one night having arrived in to Boston just before midnight on a late flight. The handy link walkway to the hotel is misleading although it does have one if you happen to be in the right terminal. We probably dragged our suitcases a couple of miles around the airport and car park. It would have been easier to just get a taxi outside the terminal to the front door of the hotel. Then to find that the room we had booked had been given out because we had arrived late...........no suprise there we told them on our booking request, we just felt that the staff didnt care whether we stopped or not. A handy stop over but I could'nt recommend it for anything more than an evening.

Reviews.Title: “They Do It Right”
Reviews.Author: hausmaus
Reviews.Content: Great. Beautifully appointed room, courteous staff, and they made it easy to return our rental car after checking in -- sent the shuttle to Avis to get my husband. Despite its being located at the airport, it was quiet. The art in hallways, common areas and rooms is a cut above the average hotel blah. And even though we were Priceline guests, we did not get the room by the elevator with the dripping window unit air conditioner, rusty sink bowl, and off-kilter ceiling tiles.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay on executive floor”
Reviews.Author: jonathan020
Reviews.Content: Booked the romance package and stayed on the executive floor. The room was excellent and we had access to the private executive lounge for free food and snacks all day long including private breakfast! We had free champagne and roses upon arrival. The Cafe Presto in the lobby brews Starbucks coffee. Also had a lovely sandwich in the pub. Great access to Terminals A and E via walkway and all terminals and MBTA subway via a free shuttle bus. I have no complains whatsoever!

Reviews.Title: “Solid airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: eaglehaslanded
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hilton Logan three times over the last two years. It is a solid hotel with comfortable, clean rooms, completely insulated from the noise of the airport. Its weekend rates can be quite reasonable, especially for Boston. Room service and the restaurants are very, very pricey (presumably since most people who stay there are on expense accounts), and if you arrive at night, there is nowhere else you can go. The breakfast buffet is unexceptional (scrambled eggs, oatmeal, fresh fruit, cereals, sandwich breads and bagels) but decent. The airport shuttle is irregular; if you call from baggage claim, be sure to go out immediately, since it won't wait around for you. Be aware, however, that you may end up waiting anywhere from two to forty minutes. This hotel could use an extra shuttle since there are times that the wait at the terminal can be very long for a hotel that is right on airport premises. That said, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who needs to overnight at the airport, particularly if you can get a price that's $150-200 range. And remember to eat before you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service/Hotel”
Reviews.Author: venuswaldo
Reviews.Content: We were on vacation for 6 nights there. The service was outstanding! They have a free shuttle service to the Subway and it takes less than 10 minutes to get downtown. It is also walkable to the airport. The shuttle is available 24/7 and free! The rooms were great-panel HD TV, newly remodeled rooms. Great gym and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay @ the Hilton Logan”
Reviews.Author: am12pm
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our brief one night stay at the Hilton Logan. Based on earlier reviews I requested a room overlooking the airport. We didn't hear a thing and my twin 5 year olds LOVED watching the planes coming and going. The room was as you would expect of an airport hotel, clean but not extremely spacious. Overall it serves its purpose. We had returned our rental car so we availed ourselves of the hotel shuttle to eat at Legal Seafoood's airport location for dinner. We will be back to this hotel next time we have an early morning flight out of Logan!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for the price and convenience”
Reviews.Author: uvula
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in order to facilitate an overnight (15 hour or so) layover. The convenience is great (right in the terminal of the airport) and I could not believe how luxurious the hotel was for the price. We had a wonderful time, and the restaurant food was good (though a little pricey).

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel”
Reviews.Author: dpatterson2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the first night of our honeymoon since we had an early flight the next morning. We arrived very late that evening and check in was fast and easy. They had even chilled a bottle of Champaign since we were on our honeymoon. We had breakfast very early the next morning and that was a very nice start to the long day of traveling. The hotel is not as close to the airport as it appears. You can walk over but you are probably better off asking for a ride over to the airport instead of trying to navigate through all the parking lots to the actual terminals.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: jjacon
Reviews.Content: We stayed Jun 22 for one night. Got this hotel at a bargain of $85 a night on Priceline. Room was nice and clean and the decor was nice, not Motel 6 cheesy. Ate at the Pub downstairs. Disappointed on their seating policy--they don't have a hostess that seats you. You are supposed to walk in and seat yourself. The night we went, flights had been cancelled so the restaurant was full and at least 20 people circling like vultures for an open table. I found the manager and advised to get a waiting list because it was soon going to get ugly. Food was okay for a hotel. Kids loved the indoor heated pool. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton was Average”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvl4
Reviews.Content: Our family was one of two families traveling together with teens. The hotel itself was attractive and clean, both the lobby and room. The room was a tad on the small side, specifically the beds. I believe they were full beds, not queens. Had I known that, we might it have opted for two adjoining rooms. Check-in was quick and efficient. Once reaching the room, we did have a few minor issues, but ones that I wouldn't have expected when staying at a four star hotel. The television didn't work for starters and it took two calls to housekeeping to get it fixed. Within about 2 hours, the toilet was clogged, and again, it took two calls to housekeeping to get them up to fix it. While fixing the toilet, the guy splashed water all over the floor, and left it there for me to clean up. Not something I wanted to do, but did anyway. Both times, we waited about 30 minutes before making the second call. We also had to call down to get a key for the mini-bar... ours was missing. After spending the afternoon in Boston, the shuttle picked us up at the train station (very timely here) and the adults in our party decided to go down to the lounge for a drink. I wanted to order a take out salad for one of my children, but it was against hotel policy, so we were stuck ordering room service instead. Room service was fairly quick. We ordered the fruit plate (the fruit was very good), but the cup of yogurt had a huge hole poked through the top of it, and it looked like someone had already eaten out of it! We called about that, and they brought rasberry sorbet instead. Most of these issues are small, I agree, but when given the choice of staying at a 3 or 4 star hotel, in my mind, these things are what seperate the two. Overall, nice place, a bit pricey, but not in-step with other 4-stars I have stayed at in the past.

Reviews.Title: “The best at Boston Logan”
Reviews.Author: West_Linn_Travelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boston Logan Hilton earlier this month (June) prior to flying back to the west coast. In a nutshell, this Hilton-franchised property may be on the spendy side, but on balance it's worth the price paid. This Hilton has recently undergone a change in ownership, and as a result the hotel has undergone some cosmetic improvements including new bedding, new carpeting in the rooms and common areas, and new tile and fixtures in the bath. The result is that the hotel is in almost new shape and is exceptionally clean and well-maintained. Our room was on the 10th (highest) floor; rooms at the ends of the hallways are quite a walk from the centrally located elevators. This Hilton does have a lounge on the 10th floor. HVAC worked well, bedding was exceptionally comfortable, and linens and towels were spotlessly clean. The hotel recently equipped its rooms with large, LCD flat-panel hi-definition televisions with digital sound. The hotel has the best location at Boston Logan and two recently-opened sky bridges connect the hotel directly to the International Terminal and to Delta Airline's new terminal. We have stayed at this property a number of times over the past few years, both on business trips and vacations. When on business we actually prefer staying at this Hilton property, either using a cab or the nearby water taxi to get into the downtown core. We were pleased to find a number of bell and front desk staff still at the hotel since our last visit in October. The staff is generally very, very helpful and eager to please. As an example, my wife and I had a number of perishable items that had to be kept cooled/frozen. Aside from a mini-bar, the rooms do not have mini-fridges. to our amazement, within five minutes of calling the guest services line, a mini-fridge was delivered and set up in our room at no charge. Additional "added-value" touches include that the hotel's shuttle van will deliver you to or pick you up from any of the nearby car rental centers, again at no cost. This level of service is extraordinary in our view. Others have mentioned here that the hotel imposes many charges on guests. It's true that parking can run $35 per night and that internet access runs about $10 a day. Food - especially room service - is similarly very expensive. We didn't havea car to park, we used the business center internet-equipped computers that can be rented on an hourly basis, and frankly the food we ordered was delicious (especially the clam chowder!!). Our stay at the Boston Logan Hilton was great from the painless and rapid check-in to the ease of checking out and the helpfulness of the shuttle driver. We highly recommend the Hilton Boston Logan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mulled01
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I got stuck in Boston due to a flight cancel and picked this hotel because it is at the airport. I didn't care if it was nice or not, but I was pleasantly surprised. Here are the pros/cons: Pros: 1. Everything about this place is nice and new! It has a beautiful, huge lobby and at the end of the hallway on each floor are two chairs/table that you can sit and look out into the Boston Harbor - very nice. 2. The furnishings and decor in the rooms are top-notch. There is even a huge LCD HDTV in the room - and you get HD programming. 3. If you want to be by the airport, you're there! There is a shuttle that can take you from the airport to your terminal, which is what I did. I think you can walk from the hotel to the airport, but the agent told me to take the shuttle and it was very convenient/quick. 4. Since my flight was cancelled and I had a rental car, I had no way to get to the hotel from the rental car place. I called the hotel and they picked me up in 5 mins! 5. The food/service in the restaurant was great and not over-priced. Cons: 1. Half the channels on the huge LCD HDTV I mentioned above didn't work. 2. The sound insulation in the rooms is not good - I could hear people coughing in the room next door and could hear people in the hallway outside my room very clearly. 3. Again, the location is great if you want to be by the airport, which I did. If you want to walk the freedom trail, go to a game at fenway or eat in the North End, you are not in the city and you won't be able to walk to them. It's a short cab ride, but it's not like you're staying in the heart of the city. Overall, this is a very, very nice hotel and I think I'll stay there the next time I go to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: EagleCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We spent the night of May 22 and also May 29 at the Hilton Boston Logan Airport and had awonderful stay each night. We have stayed here a number of times in the past and enjoy being welcomed by DeeDee in the Dining Room. Our dinner meals were outstanding. The beds and pillows were extremely comfortable and it was nice to have a night light in the bathroom. This hotel was an excellent choice. Hotel Guests from Bella Vista, California

Reviews.Title: “Decent on Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UkJoe
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, with good comfortable beds and very quiet bearing in mind it is right by the airport. It quite a walk from the terminal - involves going up and down floors. Food prices in the bar are pretty poor value for money. Service from staff excellent. Starbucks in the lobby in the morning. Couldn't rate the leisure facilities as they were shut.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lifeontheroad
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Boston Logan Aiport in Mid-May, 2007. The property is centrally located to the airport (shuttle took 5-minutes to gate) and to the downtown/financial districts. The property is well appointed, staff was extremely friendly, and my room was exceptionally clean and modern. I would recommend room 774 - it provides an EXCELLENT view of the Boston skyline and harbor. I did have two meals in the hotel's restaurant/pub. Again, staff was exceptional and the food was above average for hotel food. I will have to admit, their claim chowder is some of the best I have had. If there is a downside to the hotel, it would be the cost of parking -it will cost you $26.00/day to park your vehicle!! Nevertheless, if your travels take you to Boston, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the Best Hilton Ever”
Reviews.Author: NHFlyer
Reviews.Content: I stay at hotels in Hilton family hotels about 40 times each year throughout the country. I am almost never dissappointed with the service that I receive. Having extensive experience with the Hilton chain, I must report that I think the Boston Logan Airport Hilton might be one of the best. I stay there frequently when I'm catching an early morning flight, I live two hours away from Boston. I am always impressed with the service and the facility. It isn't an inexpensive place to stay but then there are no inexpensive hotels in Boston. Most recently, I stayed at this Hilton and then caught a flight to Anchorage where I stayed in the Hilton there. It was just a reminder of how much I like the Hilton Logan Airport in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “very nice!”
Reviews.Author: kjfiliault
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before we left on a trip from logan.... stayed on the executive level with the conceirge lounge. Rooms very clean and beds are very comfy. Had a beautiful view in our room and everyone was so nice and helpful there. Service was great and convient walkway to Terminal A airport which was Delta. We could walk to our flight. Great place to stay near the airport

Reviews.Title: “Another decent stay!”
Reviews.Author: OP2002
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed here before, back in July but had another early flight out of Boston and following my previous stay it was an easy choice for me! We walked from Terminal B through Terminal A and over the bridge. We had a couple of suitcases and had no problems but for most I'm sure just dealing with the shuttle would be preferable. Checking in was easy and as a Hilton HHonors Gold I was given a nice room on the corner of the hotel looking over the city. The only problem is being the hotel is quite spread out and the ends of the hotel are a good couple of minutes walk from the elevators! You can't have everything though! After some confusion regarding access to the Executive Lounge we went to the room itself, nice and spacious, billed as a Deluxe Room it was quite a bit bigger than the room I'd previously had on the Executive Floor. The view was great too! Room had a flatscreen HDTV which made watching some late night TV a bit more pleasurable too. We spent the rest of the evening itself in the Executive Lounge (open to all HH Golds & Diamonds plus Exec Floor folks regardless of booking method). We'd just missed the evening hors d'oeuvres but watched a couple of shows with some drinks, enjoying the views of the city. The staff came over to have a word with my wife and I and were very friendly, informing us of the weather tomorrow, inviting us to check-in for our flight using the computers etc etc. For those of you contemplating paying for an Exec Floor room do it! This is one of the best Exec Lounges in any Hilton I've come across. In terms of facilities it is comparable to a half decent airline lounge. We slept very well, as I do with all Hilton beds and breakfast the following morning in the Exec Lounge was quitre sufficient to tie me over with an early bite to eat before getting breakfast on our flight. I'd say unless you aren't fussy about what you eat you'll struggle to get a decent breakfast on the top floor lounge and getting breakfast downstairs must be better. That said I've had early flights both times when staying here so can't comment on it. Overall still one of my favourite hotels in the Hilton Family and excellent for an airport hotel. The staff seem very friendly, the rooms are great and the facilities decent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic remodel”
Reviews.Author: SFOF/A
Reviews.Content: After a long trip from Jordan to Boston, via London, I was ready for a good nights sleep before heading to San Francisco the next day. I arrived at Logan airport around 8pm, very tired. The Hilton is the closest hotel, located on the airport grounds. I located the hotel board near the exit and called to see if they had any rooms at the Hilton. Thankfully they did. A van was there to pick me up in 10 minutes. Check in was smooth and I was soon off to my room for a much needed rest and shower. When I entered my room, I thought I was placed on the executive floor. (I wasn't) My room had just been remodeled. It is the most modern hotel room I've stayed in, the furnishings, design, pictures, large flat screen HD TV, coffee maker, large king pillow top bed, even the trash container and ice bucket were modern stainless..... the soaps, etc in the bathroom were boutique, actually, the entire room felt as if I was in a boutique hotel, not the usual Hilton. The only problem was I had to leave early the next morning! I wanted to stay in this comfortable, beautiful room longer!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel That Could be Great”
Reviews.Author: MrktMgr
Reviews.Content: Got into Beantown really late after some major delays on a flight outta Chicago. Man was I glad that I had booked a room at the Hilton and didn't have to drive that night. Pick-up was quick after I called. Waited all of maybe 5 minutes for the shuttle. Check in was fast. No rooms available on the executive level even though I'm a HH Gold. Room was great - looked brand new and the bed awesome after a very long day. I really appreciated the new LCD (or was it a plasma) TV. That was nice - just like being at home. That was the good..... What I didn't appreciate was the housekeeping staff knocking quite loudly on all of the doors adjacent to my room and announcing "HOUSEKEEPING" way too loud at 7:30 the next morning (5 hours after going to sleep). They were so loud that they woke me up - and they didn't even knock on my door. The icing on the cake was that one of the housekeepers decided to have a chat with one of the maintenance guys right outside my room. Wide awake and mad. I got up, showered and checked out. So much for sleeping in.... I hope that the lady at checkout did speak with the manager about this. This is an easy problem to solve and once they get it solved, it will be an excellent hotel and not just above average.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: LoveMyTrips
Reviews.Content: I am traveling on business. The room has a nice desk for working, highspeed internet, great bed, flat screen TV. I think it is a great place for business travelers. I would recommend it to anyone. Room Service dining was nice, food was good but not amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Handy”
Reviews.Author: Joanel
Reviews.Content: Good Place to stay for early flight the next day. Have a shuttle bus that takes you to the various terminals. Rooms are clean, seems fairly new. Well decorated. Quiet Computer access in lobby is free. also have a business center you can use for a charge.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here!”
Reviews.Author: locondcoco
Reviews.Content: From the second we pulled up to the second we left, this hotel did not disappoint. Exterior/Lobby: It has a very attractive and sleek exterior, and the lobby area was clean and welcoming. the bellhop/doorman greeted us when we arrived (tried to get us to pay for valet, but we kindly declined), at about 1am. we chose to self park and retired to our rooms. Rooms: we requested 2 adjoining rooms(there were 7 of us), each with 2 double beds, and thats exaclty what we got. the rooms were clean and cozy, and bathrooms were nice as well. I forgot to bring a toothbrush, so i called guest services, and one was brought up for me in a few minutes. being physically located AT the airport, one would be concerned with the noise, but that proved to not be an issue. the only noise was from the HVAC. the negatives included an HVAC system that needed to work better. it was hard keeping the room at a constant temp level, it would consistently go from too warm, to too cold, and could be a bit noisy. the rooms were a tad on the smaller side, but was not really a problem. we had a nice view of the airport from the room, and plenty of sunlight through the full floor to ceiling window. ammenities/services: shuttle service - after reading a couple reviews on how it was unreliable...i was a bit hesitant. but we used it to get to the T and at no time did we have to wait more than 5 min (either going to or coming back) for the shuttle to arrive. in fact, on 2 occasions (4 total trips), the shuttle was actually waiting for us. heck, we even used it after we checked out! =) pool/fitness center - the gym was very clean and had sufficient equipment. even each treadmill had individual monitors for you to watch as you worked out. we were offered lockers (for FREE), so we used it. towels were plentiful (i used 5 myself), for the pool and gym. the pool was nice, not too large or small. and the area was again, very clean. the hot tub was a TAD too hot, but not a big deal. locker rooms were nice and clean, and the showers were stocked with body wash and shampoo. Connely's pub - we grabbed some late nite appetizers and drinks at the hotel pub, and it was just great. i was very impressed with the wings and the prices were reasonable. service was fine and it had a great atmosphere. OK, the only REAL negative about this hotel, was the price for parking. we parked for 2 nites, 2 cars, it was $52 per car. $26/ nite to park, so we paid a total of $104 just for parking, which is a little over the top in my book. oh yea, and housekeeping did not empty out the ice bucket for us, and didnt restock the coffee supply. again, not a big deal. Overall - this place is almost perfect. from the rooms to service to the ammenities, all the bells and whistles, made this stay just wonderful. this was my first trip with a group of friends in a while, and this hotel made it a lot of fun for all of us. HIGHLY recommended!

Reviews.Title: “An experience designed to suck your wallet dry”
Reviews.Author: Flying_Lawyer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are Hilton Diamond HHonors members; we've stayed at this property both in its former life and as a purpose-built new Hilton. As it's right on the airport, the property has one huge advantage: location. Making our reservation was a snap on Hilton's website. Check-in was even easier as we checked in and received our room assignment on-line; from the time we walked through the front door to crossing the threshold of our room, not more than five minutes passed. Rooms - even rooms at the end of hallways/corner rooms are fairly small, more in line with what one would find in a newer European Hilton. Rooms are well furnished and our king bed had a wonderful duvet. On the negative side, the room HVAC air-flow is minimal and cooling the room took longer than expected. Our problem with this property is that aside from the fairly steep room rates, everything at this hotel is designed to extract additional fees and costs from guests. Let's start with overnight parking: US$30 (plus tips every time to arrive/depart). Want to have internet access? That will be at least US$10. You've paid the additional cost of upgrading to the Executive Floor so you will have access to the lounge. In Europe, breakfasts, snacks, and evening treats are all complimentary together with beer, wine, and all spirits. Free. No cost. Included in the cost of paying for a room on the Executive Floor. Oh, no. But not at this Hilton. My wife was billed for more than US$10 for a single (small) glass of a routine Merlot. I could go on and on, but by now you have the idea. I suppose it's all about yield-management and enhancing the bottom line, but frankly there is a limit on what we will tolerate by way of being nickle and dimed. So, before we commit to another stay here, we are going to evaluate our other nearby Hilton family option here at Boston Logan: the close-by Embassy Suites. If you choose to stay here, fine, it's a nice property. But watch your wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: miglet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were impressed with this hotel - our flight arrived 3 hours late, and we hadn't eaten in hours. Therefore, we now know that the 2 AM room service was fast, accomodating and fresh. Bed was very comfortable, shower was nice, it was everything we ever wanted. We were driving up to Maine that afternoon, so we didn't get to stay long, but will definately stay here again next time into Logan.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and extremely convenient”
Reviews.Author: lebelgo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights. We came in at 8 PM the first night, stayed three nights while we visited Boston by subway, then picked up a rental car at the airport, drove around other parts of New England, then returned the car in the evening, stayed another night, and picked up an 8 AM flight the next day. For the first three nights, we booked our room through Priceline, for $65 a night. I would consider that one of my best deals through Priceline ever. On the way back, I paid $145 through Hilton's [--] website, and I still felt the price was fair (but glad I only had to pay one night at that rate!). Visiting a city has never been more convenient. No worrying about taxis, Super Shuttles, or public transportation with luggage. We called them on the courtesty phone at baggage claim, and they were there in 4 minutes. We had many opportunities to use the shuttle to the subway stop, rental car place, etc., and never had to wait more than 5 minutes. They essentially run continuously. They even took us directly to and from the rental car location (we didn't have to switch to the rental car shuttle in the airport). It's only a few subway stops to most of the tourist spots in Boston--you're there in minutes. The rooms, while not huge, were comfortable, attractive, and, above all, absolutely quiet. My room faced the airport both times (I incorrectly thought I would get a Boston skyline view on my return stay), and I never heard a decibel from the airport, or from other guests for that matter. Since I'm a HHonors Gold member, we received a top (executive/10th) floor room both times, and the water pressure, while not gushing was fine. The gym, sauna, steam room, indoor pool and hot tub were all in perfect order with an attendant on hand at all times and a towel service. There's a locker room so you don't have to go through the lobby in a swimsuit. All in all, this hotel worked out perfectly for us due to comfort, convenience, and price. My only complaint was that I found their policy of only cashing $50 a day in travellers' checks a little strange, not that I usually spend that much in cash (I'm not sure how well it would be enforced if you cashed $50 in the morning and tried again in the evening). I recommend this hotel highly not only for those with morning flights, but also for those visiting Boston as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a between-flight rest”
Reviews.Author: j32063
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton 2 nights this past month...once en route to Rome from Seattle and then again on the way back. Both rooms were comfortable, quiet and equipped with everything I wanted for a restful night. It was easy to get to the hotel via their shuttles, and the 5-minute distance to the terminals can't be beat. I spent some time in the health club and steam room...a nice bonus after a long trip...and had some mixed results from Room Service and Berkshires restaurants. All in all, a perfectly good place to rest before, after or between flights.

Reviews.Title: “dirty room”
Reviews.Author: threeways
Reviews.Content: Great location if you are taking an early morning flight as we were. Of course it helps if you get your 5.30 wake up call which we did not. (we had a cell phone call as a back up). Main problem was how dirty the room was. It appeared to have been used by someone else to some extent. bits of food on the chair. note pad and pen used. Toilet seat up. In particular the floor was littered and it hadnt been vacuumed at all. This was the most expensive hotel on the trip and the only one which was dirty!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: Dee831
Reviews.Content: Great location if you fly into boston--free shuttle to the "T" and only 2 stops away from Quincy Market ...great staff ....small pool ..but nice sun deck area...excellent location if plan on day time site seeing using the train...easy to find even if you drive into boston-but parking is expensive ...

Reviews.Title: “Great service - good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gstoat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Boston Hilton Logan for a week to attend a conference. It's a great location for the conference center. The staff were great and a complimentry shuttle bus will drop/pick you up from the airport T stop (Blue and Silver line) and any airport terminal. The gym was ok - the pool a little small but the room was pleasant and clean. The choice of resturants was good - the option of a resturant or pub/sports bar. Don't be put off by it's location you can't hear any planes and we didn't even see any through out our stay. If you can't stay down town this is a great option for the conference centre.

Reviews.Title: “Low water pressure, irregular water temperature”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are well traveled, and stay in high-end hotels all over the U.S. and internationally. We usually choose Marriott because of the consistency of cleanliness and comfort. We needed to stay close to the airport, and the closest Marriott was in town. I read very positive reviews on TripAdvisor for this airport hotel, so we booked the Hilton @ $199/nite (regular room, 2 dbls) for 3 nites. Upon entering the room, which faced the Boston skyline and harbor, I did not find it to be a large room, but rather standard. This was probably due to 2 dbl beds in the room, which, by the way, were small for doubles. I was informed all rooms were the same size, unless you booked a suite. I did not find it to be very clean. I had to wipe down the light switches, as they were filthy with caked-on dirt and finger prints. Carpets were dirty, and furniture was dusty. Once cleaned, it would be ok, but the real bothersome part of our stay was the low water pressure in the shower and the very old showerhead. Also, the water would go from warm to cold to scalding hot. Terrible.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient”
Reviews.Author: rozona
Reviews.Content: Reserved rooms for two visits through BOS May and June 2006. It was very convenient to the car rentals and the flights. Bar open late for real food. Staff very helpful. But the price was higher than the better Hyatt. The staff wanted me to use the rental car van to drop me at the hotel and the rental car van wanted the hotel van to pick me up. We were upgraded to use the club lounge for a quick breakfast at 6am. But there was a grey line of dust around the brown carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: vozbelle
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5/26-5/28, Memorial Day Weekend. I was attending a game at Fenway and venturing in to the city. Choose airport for cheaper rate. The Good: -Comfy bed and linens -Well apportioned, spacious rooms -Shuttle Service-prompt and friendly drivers. I never waited more than 10 minutes for a ride -Cheap Price-Used Priceline for 65/night -Computer and printer free for use in Executive Lounge and Lobby to check e-mail and print boarding pass. -Able to check in early (1:00) and out late (4:00) for no additional charge -Quiet Room, not a peep heard from outside or other guest The Bad: -Horrible water pressure -Problem with Toilet, stopped up several times -Restaurant service very slow -I left a sheet protector with my travel information and fenway tickets either at front desk or bell captain station. When I realized after nap and called down 2 hrs later the front desk said they did not have. I went down to the front desk and was informed she never checked in the back, they had a prom and were busy. No luck. At Bell Captain station the gentlemen informed me "they would have thrown something like that away". Thrown something away that had my name all over?!? I was able to reprint Fenway tickets using computer however I was upset at the lack of concern that my travel information was missing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John Leghorn
Reviews.Content: Although I had never stayed at an airport hotel previously I did so on the basis of reports on TripAdvisor.I was not disappointed.It really is a very nice hotel and the staff were extremely helpful.I stayed for 4 nights and it has certainly changed my view about airport hotels. On the day I checked out my flight was not until 8pm in the evening and after a busy day sightseeing I asked if I could use the facilities in the hotel spa to freshen up. There was no difficulty at all and the staff were very accommodating. I asked for a room with a view of Boston and was given one without any difficulty.The room was well appointed and the bed was very comfortable. I made use of the pc in the hotel lobby to surf the net which was for a small nominal charge.The only problem being there is only one pc so you have to wait sometimes. The shuttle service to the 'T' station is excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BadgerAlumn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton at Logan Airport while on a business trip with a colleague. We walked to the hotel from the airport in terminal C, which was not as easy to walk as Terminal A is, but was a pleasant walk nonetheless. The skyways all have moving walkways, which makes the trip a lot quicker than it might otherwise seem. We were able to check into our rooms at 10:30 in the morning and then took the hotel shuttle (which runs every 10-15 minutes) to the Silver Line stop to go downtown. It took us about 30 minutes to get from the hotel to downtown and only cost $1.25 each, which was great! The rooms were wonderful and the beds were incredibly comfortable. It was obviously not in the most scenic part of Boston, so if I were traveling for pleasure and sightseeing, I might not stay there, but it really was a great hotel, and I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, everything perfect . . .”
Reviews.Author: dukektown
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Boston Logan Hilton for just one night following a return from Europe. What a wonderful hotel! The room was quite large by anyone's standard and included a big king bed with comfortable pillows and blankets. There was a television in an armoir and included about 30 different free channels. A work desk as well as several lounging chairs were also there. The view overlooked, what else, the airport but who cares. The Hilton is itself connected to terminal E (international arrival/departure) by a raised enclosed walkway. I was able to get to my room in less than 5 minutes walk after exiting customs! I did use the healthclub which is on the lobby floor. Probably not so great a location as I hate to walk across a lobby in gym shorts. Oh well. I ate at their sports-type restaurant and found the food and service quite good as well. Free internet access is located at a computer workstation in the lobby. Wifi access is an additional charge. Free shuttles also take you to any of the terminals as well as several locations in greater Boston. Basically, the Hilton is a great place to stay especially if you need an overnight before your net flight!

Reviews.Title: “Good for an Early AM Flight”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently stayed here before an early morning flight to Florida. Check-in was easy and the lady was nice, but not very personable. We requested a room on a high floor and given one of the 8th floor with a GREAT view of the city and the harbor. I read one comment on the view, if you request a room between _60-_80 the views are AWESOME! I was impressed with the room and the bed was comfortable. The only thing I didnt like is the lack of vending machines on the floors. $3 for a Coke, No Thanks. We ate dinner at the Irish Pub and the service was HORRIBLE!!!! There were no signs that said you needed to seat yourself and we were eventually told by some guests to seat ourselves. We only ordered sandwiches and we were there for over an hour. A severe lack of help. Check-out and Shuttle staff was great, especially for 5AM! Overall, if flying out, I would stay here again. The service is much better than the Hyatt Harborside and more reliable shuttle service. HINT: If parking your car, park in Economy Lot and take the shuttle to Terminal A and take the skybridge to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great one night stay”
Reviews.Author: CindyZMomof3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my son for one last night in Boston. Used priceline trying to get the hyatt harborside, but got this instead. All in all, nice stay. Self parking was nice and close and slightly cheaper than valet parking ($26 vs $30) for a 24 hour stay (plus I saved on the tip!). We had a great view of the Boston skyline. We were in the right wing of the hotel (as you look at the hotel from the outside) which faces the skyline instead of the airport. Just opened up the curtains and enjoyed the view as I lay down to sleep...best part of the stay. The pool was nice, with maybe a bit too much chlorine. Staff was friendly, although our interaction was limited. Using the T from this hotel was very easy. I would definately recommend, especially if coming/going from Boston Logan.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: ahoy31
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the night before an early morning flight. The beds were very comfortable, bathroom clean with granite counters. Shuttle service ran very early in the morning and the shuttle bus drivers very helpful (even helping me find a place that sold live lobsters late at night)

Reviews.Title: “TravelAgent Review”
Reviews.Author: LovelyDove
Reviews.Content: Well, my flight got cancelled on Monday so company checked us into the Hilton for only 1 night. This hotel (although an airport hotel) was FABULOUS, the amenities included (serenity bed, steamroom, sauna, lappool) were all fabulous. The resteraunts within the hotel were VERY good for an airport hotels food. The manager was excellent and very much cared about his job and choosen careerpath. I traveled with a group of travel agents and we all agreed this was the best airport hotel we have ever stayed. Check it out, for even more than 1 night you will NOT be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Justin_Magro
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It is not downtown but you can walk to all airport terminals via covered bridges and from there take a free shuttle bus to the Boston subway station and be downtown in minutes. Rooms that face Boston have a great view of the city skyline, harbour and surrounding areas. The pool was a small but well staffed. The hotel bar was average. Justin Magro, Halifax, Nova Scotia.

Reviews.Title: “Our first trip to Boston”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel while attending an IT Conference at the Hynes Convention Center. Boy where we surprised when we found out there were TWO convention centers in Boston and unlike the online listing, shuttle service was NOT provided to this particular convention center. Even though this was one of the benefits that they emphasized to our companies. The hotel seemed overly booked with not enough staff to service customers at the front desk, or the 'pub'. Sometimes finding a clean table took upwards of 30-40 minutes and food took as long or longer to receive. The room was fairly spacious, although typical fare and had a wonderful view of the parking lot and the airport (yes, if you cranned your neck just enough you could see a little bit of the harbor). The most disappointing thing about the room to us was that there was no inroom safe and the safe's offered at the front desk weren't large enough to accomodate a laptop. Rather unusual for a 'business' hotel, wouldn't you say? Also, even though we stayed for a week and asked repeatedly if/when the shuttle went into south Boston, it wasn't until we were leaving that the doorman finally told us they go into Fanneuil Hall every evening for one drop off and one pickup. Would have been nice to know so that we didn't always have to take the 'T' and walk all the way back to our hotel. However, several of the personnel were very nice and gracious. Construction was also a nuisance. Room cleanliness depended on the cleaning staff of the day, with Wednesday's cleaning being the best (5 stars for that day!). Water was also at a premium and made a very loud whiney/gurgley noise when running...not just our room but several others as well as we kept getting woken at weird times when people were showering or bathing. If you expect just the basics you won't be disappointed, but if you expect something a lot nicer you should look somewhere else. Just remember you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “great for an airport hotel, convinient for the flight check in.”
Reviews.Author: ItchyfeetOxford
Reviews.Content: Door staff and parking attendant extremenly helpful and freindly, and gave a good first impression. Rooms very clean and comfortable, with no airport noise. Airport check-in was within walking distance via a corridor link, but no trolleys provided, so this was a chore, and would expect better of this class of hotel. Bar food was ok, but maybe could have been better, as could have been the gym, with sauna / steam rooms not working properly. Pool was relaxing, with good jacuzzi, but you had to trudge through the gym in your swim gear to reach it. Overall, convenient if you are leaving the airport at an early hour, otherwise stay in Boston itself.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: s25843
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I usually stay in 5-10 different hotels a year, and am a Silver VIP member with the Hilton HHonors program. I stayed in this hotel in July of 2005, on a walkup basis, without a reseveration, at 1am in the morning. My flight had arrived 3 hours late, and it resulted in me missing my Commuter bus home. (I did not have a car for this trip, as it would have been too expensive to keep it parked in Boston) Rate: Walkup rate of $129/night Rooms: The room was your average new Hiton property with a small bathroom, but a very comfortable bed. There was a desk with HSI, Sitting chair, TV, and a big picture window with an airport view. The MiniBar in my room did not have a lock on it, and the room did not seem properly stocked (Eg. Pen/Paper, Hotel Guide, etc). Although, the room was clean, which is really all that matters. Service: Since this was a strictly sleep/shower/go home stay, I did not interact too much with the staff, although, Checkin was pleasant, and checkout was the same. There is a constant every 10 minute free shuttle going to the Airport, Subway station, and on request (depending on the driver) any of the other 3 hotels in the immediate area. The drivers were very friendly, and would remember you if you tipped them. I would not stay at this hotel for any other reasons other than anything involving the airport. Side Note: As far as I could tell, there are no vending machines in the hotel, forcing you to use the minibar. HOWEVER, as I later discovered there is a 24 hour Dunkin Donuts in the baggage claim area of Terminal A (Short Walk, via dedicated skybridge to the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel has mostly non-refundable rates, so, not wanting to waste money, we stayed here. I stayed here with my wife. We came up from Sarasota, FL and we were continuing on to montreal. This was a last second trip so, to get a good deal, we chose a flight with a overnight stop. We spent one night here and payed 300.00 For 300 dollars for 1 night I'd expect almost the Ritz. I was, however, a typical Hilton. Staff was nice. Good restaurants. And, most important, nice rooms. We got one king bed in a standard room. We got a view of the airport which really didn't matter to us. Room was clean and plenty of space. I would definently say this hotel is made for buisness travelers. There had to be at least 10 good sized confernece centers. Big work out facility and pool. And for us, extremely convenient to the airport. We were in terminal A so we could walk there. Walkway for terminal E as well. If in terminal B-D, there is a bus. I would not stay here again for so much money. At max, this hotel should be 250.00 a night. Hotel istelf: Great Value & Price: A bit below average

Reviews.Title: “Positive all around”
Reviews.Author: lolabarney
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to see so many negative reviews of this hotel. We stayed here unexpectedly (on Oct 30/05) after our flight was cancelled and found it excellent. The hotel opened in 1999 but looks like it was yesterday. The lobby is large and bright. Front desk staff were competent and checked us in quickly. When I didn't have a room service menu in our room, they sent one up immediately. The room (a standard king) was exceptionally large, nicely decorated in reds and taupe, with desk and chair, fridge and two padded armchairs. The bedlinens were of high quality. Everything looked brand new. Bathroom is equally large with a granite counter. My only complaint was the toilet is beside the tub, which is annoying because there is no where to put your clothes when you get out of the shower. The towels were small and thin. Nice Crabtree and Eveyln soaps and shampoos. I made a one-minute long distance call to my home in Toronto which they charged me $13.00 - did not appreciate the obvious gouging. One point worth mentioning is that we were on the shuttle bus to the airport with an Air Canada crew and they commented on how this hotel has the best shuttle service of any Boston airport hotel - fast and frequent. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your cleaning supplies!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After arriving on a long cross country flight, I did not expect to find a dirty bathroom and have my room service order be incorrect. All this for $310. The lobby was beautiful, clean...that's about it. My bathroom had spit in the sink and a bowel movement left in the unflushed, obviously uncleaned toilet. I complained to the front desk but no one came. I ordered a pizza from room service. The order was incorrect, correct pizza came 20 minutes later and was told the whole order would be complimentary. I was exhausted at 2:00 a.m. after flying all day, and just went to get to bed so I ate my pizze, flushed the toilet and rinsed out the sink myself. Upon checkout, I mentioned the dirty bathroom. The front desk clerk jotted something down, but did not apologize or even look up. When I mention the room service on the bill, no effort was made to comp the order. How dissapointing for $275 a night. I will definately think again about staying at any Hilton. Yuk.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Sausage-Chops
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay one night here as we had an early flight out in the morning and needed to be close to the airport. The rooms and facilities were the usual Hilton standard and it is really only the staff that let this hotel down. The Reception staff did not bother to offer any greeting and were monosyllabic throughout our transaction. We were advised that the room only had a shower and when I asked politely whether there were any other rooms available, I was told that we had to take what was offered because we had booked a 'cut price' rate through a 3rd party (surely everyone does that these days?!). It felt like we were labelled second class citizens for being sensible! We were not provided with directions to the elevator or to our room and when we asked about luggage assistance she simply rang a bell and waved her hand to dismiss us - no one came to assist. The room was clean and well fitted as always, but the promised shower was extremely weak and ineffectual and the bathroom floor was basically dirty. We tried to use the offered by-phone check out service, but although my first try was answered I was then dumped on hold for five minutes and eventually hung up and tried again following which there was no answer. We then picked up the bill and went to the front desk where again the reception was monosyllabic and extremely unhelpful - in the end I asked if there was anything else needed as we were trying to catch the waiting shuttle to the airport and I have to say we walked away. A direct complaint will be made!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Hilton we're accustomed to...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton-BOS for one night before flying to Oregon.
