We always stay at the Hilton Executive Towers in Portland, OR and have always had AMAZING service, etc. Much to our dissappointment, we had a much difference experience here. Upon checking in the front desk clerk was very unpleasant and didn't bother to ask if we needed help with our bags, or even bother to point us towards the elevator nor did she wish us a pleasant stay. We felt this was rude seeing as how she asked the 'business' looking man who checked in before us if he needed help with his bags and wished him a pleasant stay....hmmm...we got a great rate on priceline ($60!!!) but this doesn't excuse the attitude! Upon arriving in our room mini bar key in hand we were eager to raid it seeing as how we had just traveled four hours (2hrs by boat, 2hrs driving) from Nantucket. No such luck, the mini bar was empty! We called guest services and they explained that the fourth floor is where flight crews generally stay so they don't stock the mini bars there. Funny, you would think the front desk clerk would be aware of that and not have given us the key or even perhaps asked if that was acceptable!? From there things went from bad to worse. When calling guest services you have a 50-50 chance of getting someone who has even a remote interest in your needs. Later my husband went down to get take-out menus from the bell boy who didn't bother to say a word to him but rather threw the menus on the desk and continued socializing with his co-workers! Now here's where things get interesting....on his way back up to our room in the elevator a man asked him if he knew of any prostitutes around or would like to go find some!!! Ok, my husband is a quiet, polite man and was dressed in a polo and slacks!!! Needless to say we stayed in our room and prayed that we could complete our stay without having to see, contact, or deal with the lousy attitude of the staff again! The one and ONLY advantage I can see to staying here is that you don't have to wait for a shuttle to arrive (BTW, the Hilton shuttle is ALWAYS very crowded) and can take the sky bridge which connects to the airport very easily and it even has moving walkways! A great walk to get those restless legs moving after getting off a long flight but not a short trek for anyone unable to walk a distance or someone with a ton of baggage (young kids included!). I wouldn't recommend staying here, check out the Hyatt Harborside which has good service, free shuttle, nice rooms, and a beautiful view of the harbor and you can also watch the planes approach the runways and not hear a thing!!! There is also a really lovely paved walking path along the water that is great for evening walks as the sun sets!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to transition in/out of Boston”
Reviews.Author: TravelerOmaha_NE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Logan Hilton the night before returning to Denver from a week in Nantucket and couldn't have been happier. Used the self-service kiosk to check into room (convenient and easy), had a great meal in the pub, checked in and printed our boarding pass from the convenient computer in the hotel lobby and enjoyed a restful evening in a quiet, clean and comfortable room. The next morning, we could sleep in knowing we were only a short walk to our gate. There is not a better place to stay in Boston if you have a late arrival or early departure at Logan. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “the way a hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: trippingJack
Reviews.Content: Picked up at the airport by the hotel shuttle near the baggage claim area in the evening. Alternately, the hotel is attached by skybridge to Terminal E - other terminals require a short walk. Lobby sits in the rear of a spacious atrium - check-in went smoothly. There is 24 hour room service and two restaurants in the lobby area that cover most of the daytime hours. The breakfast restaurant gives you the option of buffet-style or order-from-menu. Food is good and plentiful. The health club is spacious and contains workout appartus, locker rooms, television sets, a indoor heated lap pool (about 15 yards long) and a large jacuzzi. Service in the bedrooms is prompt and excellent. There is a coffee maker and a newspaper is delivered to your room each weekday morning. On weekends you can go to the gift shop in the lobby (after 7am) to buy a newspaper. The hotel shuttle will take you to the local subway (Airport) station - called the 'T' in Boston. For $18 you get a three day pass good on all city transport services. If you don't mind walking you can take the skybridge to Terminal E - go down to the surface level and catch an airport bus to the 'T'. The buses run all day and are free.

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal but convenient”
Reviews.Author: Riverbankannie
Reviews.Content: Stayed in August 2005 before early morning flight to London. Disliked over-attentive valet system and impersonal large hotel ambience but this hotel most convienient of the airport hotels as, in addition to normal shuttle bus, you can walk via a footbridge to the terminals. We collected an airport trolley which we took to our room and then pushed directly to check-in desk. Unless you are parked at the airport, trolleys are not easy to find and we were envied by others as we pushed all our luggage along in the inevitable check-in queue shuffle. Checked out via room television inter-active service so by-passed hotel reception area altogether and left by 2nd floor footbridge. Got good hotel rate by booking with expedia.

Reviews.Title: “an oasis for a weary traveller returning home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a busy two week family vacation in Maine sleeping in camp beds, tents and the like, my husband and I had an early morning flight out of Logan and decided to spend the night before at the airport. We were very pleaseantly surprised! We were ready for some pampering and felt the Logan Hilton to be a definite cut above our expectation for airport hotels. Our room was average size but well-appointed with a heavenly bed and linens. We found the spa/fitness center to be clean, very well equipped with a nice pool and whirlpool to relax in. The staff was friendly, responsive and courteous- we were not on the executive level but they brought us very comfy robes to lounge in at our request. After returning from the spa we ordered room service and a movie- the food was excellent (I had the scrod which was really delightful and my husband had the chicken florentine). All at very reasonable prices. I would do this again!

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant staff let it down!”
Reviews.Author: inthepool
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a trip to New England, after travelling around for 2 weeks we thought we would give our children a treat by staying at the Hilton Logan airport before flying home, most of the hotel is okay but it lets it's self down in it's catering departments the staff at breakfast made it clear that as we were on a bed and breakfast deal we were only entitled to the buffet which was average at best and so the staff were inattentive we had to clear our dishes ourselves I think they were only interested in the business customers as they probably tip better! It's a shame as our children were really excited about it. Also the coffee shop closes at lunch time so you could not get a hot drink unless you made it in your room. On the possitive side the spa staff were great with the kids and the shuttle bus to the T was hassle free.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and exceptional for an 'airport' hotel”
Reviews.Author: Standby4321
Reviews.Content: Since our weekend trip to Boston involved an arrival late in the evening and an early morning departure, we opted for the Hilton Boston Logan Airport on our two-night weekend stay. In addition to being a very nice hotel, there was a substantial savings, compared to staying right in the city. This is a fair trade-off for the need to take a taxi, water taxi (you can figure about $20 for two people on either of those two option as a ballpark estimate) -- or the "T" into town. A nice feature of the hotel is that in addition to the hotel's courtesy shuttle, visitors have the option of walking over on a skybridge that connects the Hilton to the terminal (we flew on Northwest, using Terminal E, but there are connections to other terminals, too.) The hotel itself is impressively appointed, with a large lobby, well-maintained common areas, a pub that serves a decent menu (including room service). There is also a more formal full-service restaurant on the property. The 10th floor executive level has a nice lounge area with long hours (5:30 a.m. until 11 p.m. on weekdays). In addition to the usual morning continental breakfast items and before dinner snacks, we made use of a single computer that is available for the complimentary use of lounge guests, (though it obviously gets plenty of activity and it is a first-come, first-served type of thing.) There is a first floor fitness center with a good selection of weights and equipment, as well as a swimming pool and hot tub. All are kept in great condition and the hotel itself is immaculate. There were no traffic jams at the elevators during our stay at any time. We never heard an aircraft during our stay, so the building is obviously well sound-proofed. Size-wise, we would put the guest rooms on the average to even slightly smaller than average size, but they are well-furnished and maintained. Beds get well above average marks from us for comfort. Towels were plush and robes were provided on the executive level, too. The bathroom was plenty roomy enough and immaculate. Overall, we have no problem giving the Hilton Logan Airport an excellent rating and we highly recommend it for those situations where an airport hotel makes sense.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Enjoyable Stay at This Hilton”
Reviews.Author: val2val
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Boston was made even better with our stay at the Hilton Boston Logan Airport. The hotel is not only very beautiful but the employees were friendly, helpful and made us feel very comfortable during our stay. The rooms were very nicely decorated with extra pillows on the bed and an oversheet on the blankets. The mattress had a comfy cover and we slept like babies. We visited the hotel gym/pool and spa and were very impressed. The indoor pool had large windows and skylights and was extremely clean. The jacuzzi was also large and very clean. The equipment in the gym was top of the line, varied and nicely laid out with televison viewing. Massage was available. The locker room was equal to that of a memebership gym. They had a steam room and showers and attendants checking it often. We ate at Connollys Pub and had great food and drinks at a reasonable price. You can even take a catwalk from the hotel to the airport for convenience or use their shuttle. The walk for us was a little far considering where our airline was located. We would definately return and plan to do so in the next week.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, but....”
Reviews.Author: ceemarie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before flying back home on an early morning flight, and I chose it like most others, for convenience. It is a beautiful hotel, we never heard a single plane, and our dinner was very good. We were, however, given a handicap room upon check-in, which we Ok'd. If you are given this option, don't take it! The shower flooded the bathroom unless you shored it up with towels. When we called maintenance, they implied that it does it all the time due to flaws in design. They didn't mind bringing us the half dozen towels we requested, though! Other than that, we were very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable beds ever”
Reviews.Author: Dfab5
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Hilton airport hotel in Boston on June 26 for 1 night before our early morning flight home. My husband, myself and our children were very comfortable at this hotel. We got a great rate through their website but didn't expect much since it was an "airport hotel." We stayed here for the convenience of being able to walk to the airport in the morning without a shuttle, etc. Well, I heard on Tripadvisor that they had comfortable beds at this hotel. They were the most comfortable beds I've ever slept on. Check in was a breeze with their "ATM" style check in machine. Our room was ready when we got there and room service was fantastic. Great pool and exercise facility. Wonderful toiletries!! We never heard an airplane the entire stay! I never would have guessed we were in the airport! The rooms were a bit small, but as I said before, the location and convenience and did I mention the comfortable BEDS make this a must stay for a late night/early morning flight into Boston, MA!

Reviews.Title: “Easy, easy, easy access”
Reviews.Author: flaknitter
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, very comfortable beds, easy airport access, easy T access, free gym pool and spa. Frequent shuttles to the T and Quincy Market is the second stop. If you're not right downtown, this is as good as it gets. Only issue is the T closes midnight (or is it 1:00), so if you want to go drinking, you'll have to take a cab back. I was in town for a conference at a rate of $156 a night - got the same room on a very well advertised discount website for $100 a night (weekend). Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I used to stay here for my business visits. The treatment went from good, worse to worst. Started getting handicap room, smoking room with double bed et al when I clearly booked for King non-smoking. They overbook the hotel & give rooms of their choice. Customer service at front desk is Zero. Dont plan on staying longer or frequently. Its a OK hotel for just one nights stay. Also, I am not white, felt that I was discriminated.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days at the hotel. Easy to get to subway and see the rest of Boston. No noise from airplanes. Great service.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Boston Logan Hotel over Memorial Day Weekend and had a wonderful experience. Finding the hotel was a little difficult at first but that was mostly my fault because I didn't bother to read the directions on Hilton's website. It's a quick walk across the SkyBridge at Terminal E, or if you have a lot of luggage, you can always take the Hilton Shuttle. Check-in was quick and easy and my room was pleasant. Getting to and from the city for sightseeing was a breeze also. You simply take the Hilton Shuttle to the Airport T (subway) stop and you're on your way. To get back to the hotel from the T you can either wait for the Hilton shuttle (every 15 minutes), call Hilton and tell them you need pick up service, or you can take one of the Logan Airport shuttles to Terminal E and walk across the SkyBridge. All in all, if you're looking for a nice, convenient hotel with easy access to the airport for your return flight, I highly recommend the Hilton Boston Logan Airport.

Reviews.Title: “A welcome way station”
Reviews.Author: arlenejoe
Reviews.Content: The lobby is spacious and inviting. I especially appreciated the guest PC with internet access. The lobby staff were friendly and efficient. The room with its comfortable beds were nicely appointed and well-maintained. The location close to the airport terminal and free shuttle service were great. The only reason I rate it above average is that it wasn't a premium experience, but, for the money, it was just fine.
